Job Description:
About Kappa Publishing Group

Kappa Publishing Group is one of the nation’s top publishers, specializing in puzzle and game magazines and books, coloring and activity books, seasonal products, and educational books for children.

Kappa is a market leader in the “puzzle” space with its crossword, sudoku, codebreaker, and word search books and magazines.

This is an exciting growth period for Kappa as we look to invest in consumer promotions, growth of our existing product lines and expansion of our team.

In this position you will work directly with a team of experienced professionals on sales and marketing projects undertaken to grow the company.

Job Summary:

The Sales and Marketing Analyst is a very important role that manages communication of marketing initiatives and assisting the sales team to manage accounts. The Sales and Marketing Analyst keeps all tasks on track while recording and presenting progress of strategic sales and marketing metrics and initiatives. The Sales and Marketing Analyst reports directly to the General Manager.

Responsibilities include:

Helping launch, manage, and align projects with business goals
Project management of key marketing initiatives
Identify and define project requirements, scope and objectives
Data analysis seeking key insights from ongoing and new projects
P&L Analysis
Sales forecasting; compiling and analyzing monthly customer performance reports, identifying sales trends
Inventory forecasting/planning
Creating quarterly and annual budget estimates
Researching new marketing methods and partners
Analysis of market data seeking trends and new opportunities
Determining new product release content for customers

You will love working here because you:

Have strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Bring a strong sense of urgency, enthusiasm, and commitment to all aspects of the work
Have strong organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management
Have strong written and verbal communication
Have strong teamwork skills

Requirements:

2+ years experience in project management and/or sales and marketing or recent graduate with a degree in this field
Microsoft Power BI and Access skills a huge plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Job Summary:

The ERP Business Analyst (BA) supports our client's ERP systems project. The BA works with our client’s functional and technical stakeholders to gather business requirements and document processes for ERP system testing and QA. The BA will coordinate project stakeholders to effectively implement large-scale organizational, process and system improvements. The BA will report up to project stakeholders using project management tools and desired client reporting structures. The position is located onsite and remote in Philadelphia with a hybrid work option available.

Essential Functions / Responsibilities:

Support in the design, configuration, and implementation efforts or the system modules.
Develop Testing Plans, strategies, and test cases
Document and communicate test results
Identify and facilitate issue resolution with functional and technical groups
Conduct business analysis activities by working with functional and technical stakeholders to support the functional systems, data integrations, data validation, data cleansing, testing.
Seeking experience with a client or vendor relationship, implementing business application systems such as ERP (Oracle, SAP, Microsoft, Salesforce).
Organize and facilitate stakeholder requirement sessions
Demonstrate the ability to document, define, analyze and translate functional and technical business requirements
Translate business needs into requirements specifications and clearly communicate requirements to both the business and technical stakeholders
Lead in the development and review of requirements documents, use cases, test cases and other functional and technical artifacts
Promote best practices in data analysis and reporting
Capture and document meeting minutes, requirements, work-flows and best practices
Effectively communicate to management and client stakeholders on work products and status
Participate in enterprise-level project teams to identify and implement process and system improvements.
Responsible to understand Worldgate’s values and behaviors (The Worldgate Way)
Ensure that my daily interactions with Worldgate internal and external parties align to Worldgate’s values and behaviors.

Key Competencies:

Business Analysis
Problem Solving
Technical Capacity
Team Collaboration

Education, Experience and Certifications:

Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B.S.) from four-year college or university
3+ years of experience as a business analyst focused on enterprise IT systems
Experience supporting the implementation of an ERP system
Experience with SAP Implementation

Specific Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Excellent documentation and writing skills
Experience with data analysis using Microsoft Excel and SQL Database
Experience with implementing large-scale organizational, process and system improvements
Organizational skills, communication skills and strong attention to detail
Knowledge of BI reporting tools
Knowledge of back-end database systems and database languages

Position Overview:

Nutrisystem is seeking a highly experienced BI Developer with a minimum of 10 years of experience in report writing or as a business analyst. The ideal candidate will possess extensive expertise in SQL query development, the ability to effectively engage with business stakeholders, and a strong track record in creating reports using tools such as Looker, Business Objects, Power BI, or Tableau. Prior experience with Looker Reporting Studio is considered a significant advantage.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and analysis.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and understand reporting requirements.
Create visually compelling and insightful reports using Looker.
Field daily report requests from multiple Backoffice teams to meet the needs of customers.
Conducting and troubleshooting reports and data models.
Comprehend and work with Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics.

Qualifications:


A minimum of 10 years of experience in report writing or as a business analyst.
Proficiency in SQL query development (queries, stored procedures, functions) and data analysis.
Familiarity with SQL Server databases and data warehousing.
Proven experience with one or more of the following reporting tools: Looker, Business Objects, Power BI, or Tableau.
Strong understanding of KPIs and metrics.
Exhibit adaptability and a quick learning curve to efficiently contribute to projects.

Knowledge of Snowflake Datawarehouse query development is a plus.

If you are a skilled BI Developer with a deep knowledge of reporting tools and data analysis, and if you are ready to hit the ground running in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply and be a valuable part of our team.

Description

HITACHI RAIL is looking for an enthusiastic self-motivated Digital Business Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate is comfortable performing a wide range of tasks from administrative to strategic. The position is based in Pittsburgh, PA.


Who We Are

Hitachi Rail is a fully integrated, global provider of rail solutions across rolling stock, signaling, service & maintenance, digital technology and turnkey. With a presence in 38 countries across three continents and over 13,000 employees, our mission is to contribute to society through the continuous development of superior rail transport solutions.

The Digital Business Analyst is required to gain and demonstrate technical knowledge of Hitachi Rail products’ portfolio to review and report revenues powered by Lumada for Hitachi Rail.


The right person will have strong business analysis skills with a versatile mind-set to converge technical and economic concepts to understand stakeholder needs and business strategy and to able to synthetize correctly the information and disseminate it to an audience with different background.


In D&LS, we work with an Agile mindset, with maximum flexibility and extreme focus on results. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to embrace the digital transportation ecosystems of Hitachi and live on the edge to be part of creating new source of business in Hitachi Rail.

Position responsibilities:

Define and implement organization governance within the D&LS unit. Set control and reporting mechanisms.
Coordinate development of commercial pipelines and budgets. Develop and implement budget planning and control processes. Develop KPIs for monitoring and reporting to enable decision-making.
Support business transformation activities and special projects including business integrations with diligent planning, control, and reporting.
Manage projects with effective stakeholder management, project management, risk management and conflict management.
Ensure effective collaboration with Hitachi BU/Group companies and business partners and support interactions for Digital & Lumada projects.
Support CLBO activities in cooperation with the corporate and cross-BU colleagues with data collection, analysis and reporting of revenues and financial performance.
Collaborate with all teams within the DLS unit to achieve business results.
Collaborate with External Communications and Marketing team, ensure planning and implementation of Business Development and Marketing activities in accordance with the Commercial plan.

Required Skills/Knowledge

Minimum of 3-5 years working experience in a similar Business Analyst role
Expertise to use project management practices and tools
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong analytical skills and can extract key points from large quantities of qualitative and quantitative data.
Attention to detail whilst also retaining a view of the bigger picture.
Excellent project management skills.
Ability to plan, coordinate and prioritize workload independently and proactively.
Strong IT skills, in particular high proficiency in the use of MS Office Applications (i.e. PowerPoint, Excel, Word and MS Project)
Strong written skills, excellent written English and able to produce precise and concise reports and meeting notes.
Ability to understand Hitachi Rail’s core and digital products and solutions.
Experience in finance, sales or projects environment is preferable.
Experience of working in a global organization.


Education/Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (Engineering, Business School)


Languages
Fluent Knowledge of English (written & spoken), French advantageous

Benefits:

Hitachi Rail employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package including Competitive Pay, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability, Life & Accident Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Savings Plan, and Paid Vacation. We also offer a number of Work/Life Programs such as Flextime and a variety of Training and Development opportunities.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Join us at www.Hitachi Rail-sts.com/en/careers.

It is our commitment at Hitachi Rail to create a diverse environment and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We would be delighted if you would be one of our followers!

Have a glance at our LinkedIn page https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirailsts/

Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)-Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

If you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job at Hitachi, please send the nature of request and contact information to hrunitedstates@hitachirail.com. Queries other than accommodation requests will not be responded to.

Overview
Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.
Responsibilities
Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap for BI products and features.
Collaborate closely with development to scope requirements and deliverables, launch criteria, and success metrics.
Create and maintain a product roadmap, define key deliverables, and proposed value to the client.
Utilize analytics and metrics to measure performance and continually improve product effectiveness.
Monitor, analyze, and respond to market changes to remain competitive and deliver on Client needs.
Qualifications
3+ years of product management experience.
Experience defining product requirements and Agile user stories.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
A passion for technology, user experience, and continuous learning.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary team environment.
Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum software development methodologies.

With support and guidance, the Forecasting Analyst will provide accurate and timely deliverables for designated in-line brands as well as technical support for tools used by forecast team (i.e. Tableau, SAS, Forecast Pro). Success in this role entails proactive and effective stakeholder management (including the ability to influence without authority), attention to detail and intellectual curiosity.
Performs forecasting activities with guidance from team members to ensure accurate and timely forecasting deliverables for a broad range of in-line brands. Serves as a proactive Business Insight partner with Sales and Marketing, Finance, Customer service, and Supply chain
Enhances and maintains internal forecast models:
Responsible for standard trending analyses together with ad hoc event sizing.
Creates structured standardized outputs including key assumptions and results.
Responsible for keeping inventory of forecast models and bridging changes from scenario to scenario.
Delivers on all outputs needed for Finance and supply operations.
Measures forecast accuracy and works to improve processes to allow for continuous accuracy improvement.
Plays the role of ‘data miner’ bringing various data sources together to formulate superior ‘insights’ and ‘hypotheses’ that have a business impact and are pragmatic.
Takes point ownership for summarizing / presenting findings and driving data-driven objectivity into the development of financial and manufacturing forecasts; consistently challenges the validity of forecasting assumptions leveraging range of data sources and analyses to identify most likely outcome.
Reconciles the models to help constituents understand the reason for forecast errors and improves the forecasting process on an ongoing basis.
Create and maintain reporting in Excel, Tableau, or other tools to deliver key insights to stakeholders on a weekly/monthly basis.
Accountable for ensuring all forecasting questions/follow-ups and ad hocs are closed out in a timely manner.
Responsible for ad hocs regarding product performance and source of risks/opportunities given variance in forecasting assumptions vs. actuals registered.
Bachelor’s degree with a quantitative focus in business, finance, engineering, statistics, economics, or any related field from an accredited institution is required.
1+ years’ experience in Commercial Analytics, Business Analysis, Forecasting, or Sales Operations, preferably within the Pharmaceutical industry or as a Consultant at an agency (e.g. IQVIA, etc.).
Strong data skills, with demonstrated ability to use tools such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau or BI tools to obtain, cleanse, and standardize data so that it is suitable for analysis.
Experience with Commercial Analytics/Business Analysis models, techniques, procedures and processes and a range of other forecasting models and problem-solving techniques.
Experience with forecasting software (e.g., ForecastPro) is preferred.
Experience with maintaining data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake) is preferred
Proficiency with various pharmaceutical secondary data sources and knowledge regarding their limitations (e.g. IQVIA Rx data, claims, EMR data, etc.) is required.
Sound knowledge of excel programming with proficiency required with experience with forecasting software/tools strongly preferred.
Depth of understanding and experience building baseline trends (e.g., exponential smoothing) coupled with ability to size the impact of foreseeable events (e.g., new competitor to launch)
Experience with broad range of product types (generic, hospital, specialty) preferred.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with superior problem solving and technical forecasting skills including some experience with time series trending.
Strong data skills, with demonstrated ability to use tools such as SAS, SQL, R, Python, or BI tools to obtain, cleanse, and standardize data so that it is suitable for analysis.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize key data and insights spanning different sources and types of data coupled with an intellectual curiosity to better diagnose brand performance and underlying brand health.
Solid communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships with Finance, Marketing, Sales, and Supply Operations
Strong organizational skills, proactively ensuring that the forecasting process is implemented for designated brands with proven ability to manage on-going processes and projects.
Advanced skills in MS Powerpoint, Excel and Outlook; Snowflake or other database skills a plus.
Ability to influence without authority, attention to detail.

Hi there! We're WebFX, a full-service digital marketing agency based in the US. We've been named the Best Place To Work in Pennsylvania 8 times in a row and we'd love to meet you! We are a fast-growing company that has doubled in size over the past 5 years, with talented team members now based around the globe (and representing 18+ different countries!). While we are growing at a rapid rate, we are committed to growing strategically and sustainably, and that starts with growing our team of the #BestCoworkers - that’s where you come in!

We're looking for people to join our mission to provide world-class digital marketing solutions to mid-size businesses around the world. We are passionate about what we do, we’re committed to driving business growth for our clients, and we’re on the hunt for people just like you, who take pride in their work and want to be part of a company that does too.

You Might Be a Great Fit For This Position if You Have…

A Bachelor’s Degree
Successful FXers in this role have majored in Marketing, Advertising, Business, Journalism, Communications, Information Systems, Statistics, and beyond
GPA above 3.4

A Few Related Skills and Experiences
(This is an entry-level role, and experience in every one of these areas is not required - we will train you on what you need to know! But the following skills/experience are awesome to have, and will help get your career off to a running start):

Part-time/summer job/internship experience is a must
Customer service experience in any industry
Advertising/marketing agency experience
Digital marketing experience
Basic HTML experience
Google Analytics and/or analytical/research skills
Excel/Google Docs skills
Copywriting for the web
Presentation skills

Any of these Signature FXer Traits!
You have an interest in the web and stay up-to-date on new and developing technologies
You are a professional, dependable, and independent worker with a strong work ethic
You’re self-motivated, thrive on challenges, and enjoy getting things done
You have an eye for detail and dedication to high-quality work
You have an exceptional level of follow-through
You are a proactive, creative problem-solver who faces challenges with a can-do mindset
You possess excellent time/project management skills
You have solid analytical skills and a knack for making data-driven decisions
You work with a sense of urgency and can consistently meet deadlines
You are an outstanding communicator and possess strong interpersonal skills
You are a lifelong learner who loves to grow and stretch outside of your comfort zone, and are always looking to improve your skills

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better everyday, and we believe working at WebFX could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better - after all, you would be surrounded by the #BestCoworkersinPA!

In This Role, You’ll Get To…

Work directly with a portfolio of clients as their direct point of contact at WebFX, educating them through clear communication, and helping them achieve their goals
Work to maintain our world-class client retention rate by developing and fostering long-lasting client relationships
Analyze performance data (in Google Analytics and MarketingCloudFX) and prepare monthly digital marketing campaign reports
Develop appropriate SEO strategies and action plans/optimizations based on data
Create and manage PPC (think Google Ads!) campaigns and work to ensure a positive ROI for clients
-Perform research to ensure client success - think keyword research, competitor analysis, and everything in between
Devise the content strategy and outlines for our team of copywriters and manage the execution of web content based on client goals
Manage the ideation, planning, and execution efforts of CRO special projects and champion CRO best practices for clients
Perform A/B, website usability, and website conversion rate testing to determine what works best for your client and provide recommendations accordingly
Interpret web analytics, demographic data, market research, and buyer behaviors, and generate and execute strategies as they relate to findings
'Get your hands dirty’ and get into the backend of client websites to correct errors and technical issues and implement content

A Typical ‘Day in the Life’ Might Consist of:
5% managing resources for CRO projects
5% analyzing clients’ competitors and making appropriate recommendations
10% working in the backend of websites/fixing technical issues/implementing content
10% creating reports for client campaigns
15% analyzing data and identifying deliverables
25% communicating with clients
30% executing on SEO and PPC strategies with regular optimizations
100% pursuing your own personal best while delivering real-world impact for our clients!
Note: The Jr. Business Data Analyst is a client-facing position

What You’ll Get From Us!

Opportunities to Learn and Train With Our Team!
Our “Bootcamp” training program will be provided for new FXers to learn, grow and develop both in and out of the office in the specific hard skills necessary to be successful in their position
World-class on-the-job training from the experts (think Sr. Marketers, not the HR team) as well as opportunities for ongoing personal learning and development
On-site, state-of-the-art training amenities to facilitate departmental trainings, industry-related updates, and monthly Lunch-and-Learns.

A Place to Grow Your Career
WebFX grew 250%+ over the past 3 years, and we promote almost exclusively internally. Merit-based promotional opportunities are abundant for new FXers who meet or exceed position performance metrics.

In-Person Experience Alongside Our Team of Industry Experts
This position is based fully in-office at our riverside campus in Harrisburg, PA, with opportunities to evolve into hybrid or remote flexibility as FXers grow in their career tenure.

Potential promotional path for Jr. Business Data Analyst:

Description:

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Hybrid (Remote and 2-3 days in the Philadelphia, PA office)

Department: Project Management Office (PMO)

Overview: CGFNS International, Inc. (CGFNS) is seeking a Business Analyst with 1-2 years of experience who is energetic, highly motivated and self-starter professional to join its Project Management team in Philadelphia, PA. The Business Analyst (BA) reports to the Chief Project Management Officer (CPMO). The right candidate will be able to document requirements and work with project managers to execute projects to completion. CGFNS is a global, non-profit organization that is rapidly adapting to enter new markets based on industry and marketplace trends.

Requirements:

Responsibilities:

Meet with project stakeholders to understand their needs and turn them into requirements documents.
Work with developers to interpret the requirements.
Assess options for process improvement, including business process modeling.
Create functional designs and wireframes.
Create process flows.
Collaborate with and support the project manager.
Develop test scripts and support users in user testing.

Qualifications:

1-2 years business analyst experience.
A bachelor’s degree is preferred, or equivalent experience as a Business Analyst will be considered.
Familiarity with project management software such JIRA and a solid working knowledge of current internet technologies, as well as experience in working independently in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is preferred.
Strong business acumen in project planning and management
Strong verbal, written, and organizational skills.
Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with an ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) is advantageous.

About CGFNS International, Inc.:

CGFNS International is an immigration neutral nonprofit organization that helps foreign educated healthcare professionals live and work in their country of choice by assessing and validating their academic and professional credentials.

We provide foreign students and healthcare professionals with a comprehensive assessment of their academic records to facilitate their successful admission to schools in the US and other countries. Also, we help protect migrating healthcare professionals by advocating for ethical recruitment practices and continuously monitoring the global landscape for developing trends in employment recruitment and workplace norms.

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

Perform general analysis and prepare reports to support business operations. Conduct modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other general financial and operational analysis. Monitor and coordinate activities to support operational performance management (e.g., safety, reliability, service level, productivity, etc.). Research and provide statistical financial and operational information. Track, maintain, analyze and provide current information on the operation's business scorecard or key performance indicators (KPIs). Develop and organize performance reports for both internal and external use. Contribute to the development of shortterm and long-range business planning. Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit. Position may be required to work extended hours for coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.



PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES
Support and contribute to the development of short-term and long-range business planning. Conduct modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other financial and operational analysis (e.g., operational effectiveness, budget, resource, workload, workforce and capacity utilization, competitor, etc.).

Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit.

This is an individual contributor position that works under general supervision and frequently performs non-routine work. This position is expected to resolve most questions and problems through interaction with internal and/or external stakeholders, executives, directors, managers, and staff across the organization, and refers only the most complex issues to higher levels. May require working extended hours and/or shift work to support business operations.

Ability to provide general analysis and apply managerial accounting concepts, customer intelligence gathering, forecasting, staff planning, scheduling, analytical and statistical problem solving, financial, accounting, business and budget analysis. General analytical skills for project evaluation including analysis of projects with economic, financial, risk and decision analysis. Experience in business case development and ability to effectively present business cases to business unit leadership.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst with PMP Certification
Job Description:
Position: Senior Business Analyst

Location: Harrisburg, PA

Duration: 6+ Months

The Department of Labor & Industry desires an experienced Senior Business Analyst to help oversee multiple ongoing Information Technology enhancement projects supporting the DLI Vocational Rehabilitation, Central Services, Labor and Safety Management (VCL) division.

This engagement requires staff interaction with agency program areas, potential vendors, and EBR (IT) Delivery Center. Prior experience in Software Development and Implementation is required. Familiarity with Project Management methodologies and/or managing & tracking a project against a project plan is also a plus.

Incumbent will work closely with the assigned Division Manager/Project Manager and must be able to help coordinate activities, staff schedules, and support the Division Manager/Project Manager in keeping the projects on track and on a very strict timeline. The incumbent may be required to assist with small tasks to ensure project is on schedule and suggest or coordinate corrective action if it is behind schedule.

Incumbent must be organized, self-motivated, able to meet deadlines and capable of working on multiple tasks at one time. Must also be able to effectively communicate, verbally, in writing, or via electronic media, and facilitate collaboration across the full range of executive, business, and technical resources. Incumbent will also be closely aligned with requirements gathering, validation testing, and developing training materials.

The incumbent must have advanced business analytical skills, leadership abilities, and be able to perform the following activities:

Perform Business Process Reengineering (BPR) including assessment of existing business processes (As-Is Assessment), determination of future state (To-Be Assessment and Requirements), and Gap Analysis
Facilitate Joint Application Development (JAD) or Detail Design Sessions (DDS) facilitation
Document business process requirements and process diagram flows, review business policy and procedure documentation, create/update documentation as needed and review with business partner and IT administrator resources
Engage as Liaison between business partner agency and information technology (IT) staff including Project Manager and internal/vendor development staff. Possess the ability to interact with various staff levels including senior executive managers.
Collect, analyze, and document business requirements, business rules, processes, and legislation and generate functional and system requirements documentation required for system development.
Plan and coordinate overall testing efforts to include test plan, creation, and execution of test scenarios for system integration testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Orchestra coordination and execution of Training Plan including development of training materials, quick reference guides, and standard operating procedures manuals.
Use specialized software (Team Foundation Server) for creation and management of system application documentation, tracking system changes, tracking reported bugs, creation of Test Plans, Test Suites, Test Cases
Ensure compliance with all applicable Commonwealth information technology policies and EBR-DC guidelines, security, and related standards.
Analyze legislation or other business documentation to determine any necessary IT system or business process changes that are required.
Ensures proper escalation to appropriate management of issues and potential project risks including compliance risks or limitations of available information technology services risks impacting development completion or impacts to schedules
Other related Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) activities related to the Business Analyst functions.

Work may also include leadership activities of lower-level team of resources used in the completion of project related objectives. Those activities include but are not limited to:

Advise/guide assigned staff involved in documenting business process as requirements within and across multiple business areas, review business policy and procedure documentation, create/update documentation as needed and review with application developers for code development.
Lead lower-level business analysts and assigned contractor staff ensuring completion of project tasks and maintain status tracking of related tasks against project timelines.
Participate in the performance evaluations of subordinate business analyst and assigned contractor staff work consistent or organizational requirements, as appropriate.
Oversee contractor staff assigned to tasks regarding the analysis of legislation or other business documentation (i.e., RFPs) to determine necessary IT system changes or changes to business processes required to meet the objectives of an agency initiative.

About TherapyNotes

TherapyNotes is a national leader in behavioral health Practice Management and Electronic Health Records (EHR) software. Our software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution is at the forefront of innovation, seamlessly integrating patient scheduling, medical records, billing, and electronic claims to revolutionize how mental health professionals manage their practices.

At TherapyNotes, we are a growing team of passionate and talented individuals. Our team thrives on collaboration and innovation, continually pushing the boundaries of what EHR software can do. We pride ourselves on our ability to adapt to the ever-evolving landscape of healthcare and technology, staying at the forefront of industry trends.

We believe in pushing each other to learn and solve complex problems, fostering an environment where your skills and expertise will flourish. Together, we are shaping the future of behavioral health software, making it easier for clinicians to provide the best possible care to their patients.

If you are passionate about technology, mental health, and making a difference, TherapyNotes is the place where you can realize your potential.

Business Requirements Analyst (BRA)

Branding Brand is seeking full-time Business Requirements Analysts with mobile e-commerce experience. This position is responsible for eliciting business requirements, leading workshops and prototyping efforts, analyzing scope, and management requirements. This role serves as the primary support between the Project Manager and clients in turning ideas, concepts, and requirements into production-ready features and functionalities.



Responsibilities
Create and control requirements management plans
Define the solution and product scope to be implemented as a result of a project that solves a business need for our clients
Elicit, capture, analyze, refine, articulate, document, and trace business requirements, user stories and flows, and acceptance criteria in order to enable the project team to implement a solution throughout the project lifecycle
Collaborate closely with engineers, designers, integration testers, and external stakeholders e.g. clients and third-party vendors to ensure technical specifications and designs satisfy the business needs
Participate in Agile cadence such as Scrum standup meetings, backlog grooming sessions, review and retrospective meetings
Ensure secure, robust, and scalable software solutions are delivered with quality and align with stakeholder goals

Qualifications
2+ years of experience in business requirements gathering and analysis, preferably for iOS and Android mobile application implementations
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Business, or related field
Certifications preferred e.g. PMI-BA, CSBA, CBAP, CCBA, PMP, etc.
Proficient in requirements gathering, project scoping, and use case creation
Strong written and presentation skills; comfortable interacting with and managing enterprise clients and collaborating across many teams
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to negotiate and effectively build relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels, including deeply technical individuals
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills
Familiarity with software development processes e.g. agile/SCRUM/Kanban
Experience in e-commerce, UX/UI design, and/or React and JavaScript (TypeScript) is a plus

About Us

Branding Brand launched in 2008 as an interactive marketing firm and quickly evolved into the largest and fastest-growing provider of mobile commerce apps and sites for retailers. Although it has since expanded into an international clientele and additional offices, the Company continues to operate out of its Pittsburgh headquarters, where it employs over 100 full-time technophiles and proudly contributes to the City's rust belt transformation.


Branding Brand is proud to be an employee-owned company, a supporter of the Whitehouse Equal Pay Pledge, and a Top Workplaces award winner. When we're not working from home, Branders (company employees) enjoy numerous in-office perks, including the ability to bring dogs to work and a free onsite, waterfront gym. In addition, all Branders enjoy unlimited PTO, free employee health insurance, a 401(k) matching program, paid leave for new parents, flexible work schedules, use of a new Mac, sponsorship, and stock options-everyone in the Company is an owner.


Branding Brand is also an equal opportunity employer. We seek applicants of diverse backgrounds and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law.

THE POSITION

Do you have an interest in Information Technology (IT) and project management? Would you like to have a role in the implementation of various initiatives to support individuals with intellectual disabilities and autism? Then look no further because this job is for you! The Department of Human Services, Office of Developmental Programs is seeking a highly motivated, forward-thinking individual for our Business Analyst 4 position. Apply now and unlock your potential!



DESCRIPTION OF WORK

This position is responsible for management and oversight of two business areas in the Office of Developmental Programs (ODP). One area is directing, managing, and oversight of the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of system solutions, budget vs the level of effort, and resource allocation to support successful implementation of Enterprise level and program office focused Information Technology (IT) projects that advance ODP goals and systemically enforce State and Federal regulations and policy. The second area of responsibility includes directing, managing, and oversight of operations and staff output and performance in the ODP Contract Management Unit.

In this vital role, you will direct and manage the staff and operations of the Contract Management Unit functions. The demonstration of a thorough understanding of state and federal laws, rules, regulations, and procedures impacting all contract functions is essential to this position. Emphasis is placed on ensuring that the unit meets specific quality and timeliness standards in performance of duties and provisions of services and that goals and objectives are met.

You will also manage, develop, and implement, ODP’s contract management structure and the coordination and adherence to statewide contracting practices and processes to assure consistency and compliance with procurement regulations. This includes, but is not limited to, identifying the agency’s need, procurement options, procurement development, contractual monitoring, invoice pre-audit, invoice processing, internal self-audit, and external audit leadership.

Interested in learning more? Additional details regarding this position can be found in the position description.


Work Schedule and Additional Information:
Full-time employment
Work hours are 8:00 am to 4:00 pm, Monday - Friday, with 30-minute lunch.
Telework: You may have the opportunity to work from home (telework) part-time up to 5 days a week. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.
Travel: All regions throughout the Commonwealth.
Overtime: As needed.
May change based on operational needs.
The Department of Human Services provides excellent benefits, pay increases, paid leave and holidays, as well as opportunities for career advancement.
Salary: In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.
You will receive further communication regarding this position via email. Check your email, including spam/junk folders, for these notices.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY

QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Experience and Training Requirements:
Seven years of business process analysis experience; or

One year as a Business Analyst 3; or
Three years of business process analysis experience and a bachelor’s degree; or
An equivalent combination of experience and training.

Job Title: Business Analyst (Entry Level) - Hybrid position, Exton, Pa.

World Travel, Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to play an integral role in providing regular management reporting, business analytics, variance analysis and decision support to senior management and stakeholders throughout the organization. The Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business results and trends, providing financial decision support, modeling, forecasting and budgeting, and driving business results through the identification of growth and productivity opportunities. This position reports to the Vice President of Supply Chain, Finance & Revenue Management.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create and deliver monthly financial reports that will provide timely and accurate insight of business results.
Develop appropriate metrics for the business to measure growth, profitability, expense control and productivity.
Perform monthly variance analysis compared to history, forecast and budget.
Analyze, identify, and communicate trends and issues impacting the business on an ongoing basis and make relevant recommendations.
Create and maintain financial models using complex data sets and formulas to deliver insightful reporting, develop multiple scenarios, provide recommendations, and improve financial projections.
Partner with multiple cross functional teams to prepare and communicate insightful results to business leaders to improve and predict performance.
Develop process improvements to increase automation and efficiency, including identifying opportunities to enhance our existing reporting and forecasting processes.
Perform other ad hoc projects as needed.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL:

Strong analytical skills with the ability to summarize complicated reports for key decision makers.
Solid verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently, be a self-starter and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to think critically and apply thought leadership.
Strong skills in the Microsoft Office Suite with advanced Excel skills (including lookups, sums ifs, pivots tables).
Ability to develop and maintain various financial models and scenarios.
Travel industry experience a plus, but not required.
Must have the desire to learn and grow.

EDUCATION:

BS/BA degree in Business/Finance/Accounting with strong grasp of financial statements

Location: Exton, PA (Hybrid schedule: 3 days in person, 2 days working from home)

Salary: Starting at $60,000

Ballard Spahr has an opportunity available for a Software Test Analyst to join our Project Management Office (PMO) within the Information Technology Department. The PMO is at an exciting point in its evolution. We have a skilled team across business analysis, UI/UX, and software testing that is maturing alongside project management. This role presents an opportunity to evolve this team’s position in the firm as we continue to make value investments in technology and business process improvements. This team supports the firm through high quality user-first design, business analysis, and quality software testing so that the benefit of our investments can be realized. This position is fully remote with occasional time in Philadelphia office for team events.

The Software Test Analyst partners with various members of the project team to understand requirements, contribute to project planning and status, build test plans, create and run test cases, and log and manage defects. This position has a key role in the project team for ensuring that quality exists in alignment with business needs, requirements, and the provided solution.

As the Software Test Analyst, some of the responsibilities you will be responsible for are as follows:

Learning and practicing agile and waterfall methodologies.
Working with system owners, business application owners, and project team members to develop test plans and test cases.
Providing testing and validation for software development projects of new and existing systems, including COTS and in-house developed applications.
Conducting interviews with, and serves as a point of contact for, project team members to determine criteria for testing and evaluating the functionality and usability of software applications.
Developing, publishing and implementing test plans and test cases.



Required Skills


The selected individual will be self-motivated with strong customer service and team building skills, have an exceptional attention to detail and problem solving skills and a high degree of initiative. Solid communication skills and the ability to work independently with minimum supervision on moderately complex tasks, set priorities and manage multiple deadlines are essential. Must be organized with the focus to sustain a high level of quality and consistency at all times, have a passion for driving change and a desire to improve upon delivery processes and standards.




Required Experience


Qualified applicants will have a college degree and 5+ years of experience with Software Validation and various testing cycles (Functional, UAT, and Smoke) and a minimum of 3 years developing test plans. Knowledge of software development and testing methodologies (Waterfall, Agile) and experience with cloud-based web applications. Experience with a requirements management tool or JIRA is required.

Additional years of experience in the absence of a bachelor’s degree will be considered. Demonstrated technology skills needed including software applications. Must be able to work beyond the standard scheduled hours, as needed. Previous experience working in a law firm or legal environment preferred.

Ballard Spahr is committed to increasing diversity in the legal profession and to supporting the communities where we live and work. People from all backgrounds are valued and integrated into every part of the firm. Diverse candidates including women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, veterans, and individuals with a disability are encouraged to apply.

ABOUT US

GBU Financial Life (GBU) is a member-owned, not-for-profit fraternal benefit society founded in Pittsburgh in 1892. Formed to provide financial security and benefits to its members, GBU is non-denominational and has grown to be a profitable life and annuity insurer with over $4 billion in assets. As Pennsylvania’s largest fraternal, and the nation’s fifth, GBU serves more than 60,000 members across the country with a 46-state sales and marketing footprint which will continue to grow until we are a nationwide provider. GBU partners with a network of 2,000 agents to market and distribute a variety of life and retirement products, including term life, permanent life, and fixed annuities.

GBU stays true to its fraternal roots, commitment, and mission by serving as an active supporter and contributor to well-known charities such as American Cancer Society, American Red Cross, and military-focused initiatives, among others. We are also heavily involved in sponsoring various programs such as scholarships, grants, and other fraternal programs for our members. Giving back to the community and integrating the membership into service-oriented activities is an important part of

GBU’s fabric and culture. GBU’s office and main operations are based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. We employ a staff of around 90 loyal, tenured employees. GBU is financially strong and recently earned an “A-” A.M. Best rating due to our thoughtful investment and long-term financial growth approach. Controlled growth and long-term financial management and investing are core to the company’s success in achieving the strong financial position we have today.

Attracting new talent to GBU to support our enterprise-wide growth goals is one of the many priorities for us as we move forward. As we continue building a best-in-class operations and technology platform, and diversifying our product mix, we are looking to add to our team. You can help us strengthen our foundation by being the next addition to our high-performing team!

OUR CULTURE

GBU is a small, family-oriented company. We have very low turnover, some of our staff has 20+ years’ experience. Attracting new talent to GBU to support our enterprise-wide growth goals is one of the many priorities for us as we move forward. As we continue building a best-in-class operations and technology platform, and diversifying our product mix, we are looking to add to our team!

The Business Analyst I shall be responsible for research and analytics, implementation, and administration involved with improving and maintain processes and systems. This position will assist in creating and maintain a process guide for various divisions, as well as fulfilling reporting needs.

POSITION OVERVIEW

As a Business Analyst, you are a highly effective liaison between clients and the software development team. This role requires you to develop a deep understanding of as-is and to-be business processes and translates them into application requirements. You participate in all phases of the development life-cycle.

You rely upon excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface with clients and document requirements. You are highly effective at managing competing priorities and ensuring that each project’s requirements are documented completely and accurately.

You will be assigned to client projects, client support, product development, and/or internal projects as needed. Candidates who are willing and able to fulfill both the Business Analyst and Quality Assurance Analyst roles are highly preferred.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, surveys, job shadowing, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis
Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal and external customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Business Requirements Documents; Process Flows; Use Cases; User Interface Designs
Establish a trusted advisor relationship with clients and make recommendations of where client workflows have an opportunity for process improvement
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs
Estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate business analysis activities
Work closely with Project Manager / Scrum Master to manage and prioritize product roadmaps, product backlogs, project schedules, critical path, and project deadlines
Support simultaneous projects of varying size and complexity with minimal oversight
Provide various levels of end-user post-implementation support to clients, including troubleshooting, training, and documentation
Other duties as assigned

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Work experience as a business analyst:
Junior: minimum 1-3 years’ experience
Mid-level: minimum 3-7 years’ experience
Senior: minimum 7+ years’ experience
Experience leading discovery sessions with clients to understand current processes, identify needs/wants/pain points, and translate into requirements
Experience with Agile software development and/or hybrid waterfall/Agile development

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
Experience with Organizational Change Management initiatives and methodologies
Six Sigma or other continuous improvement experience and/or certifications
Experience with functional, integration, regression, performance, and load testing
Experience with creating and delivering end-user training or training-the-trainer

Hybrid- Bensalem, PA

We live sneakers, streetwear, and neighborhood culture! All Day! Every Day!

It’s an exciting time to be part of our growing retail company, with US headquarters in Philadelphia, PA. SNIPES is a global sneaker and streetwear retailer with almost 400 doors in Europe and over 300 doors in the US. Key brands include Nike, Jordan, Adidas, New Balance, Puma, Timberland and UGGs. Our mission is to move street culture forward through our communities.

To achieve this mission, we operate as an “entertainment company with a little bit of retail”. Our customer journey starts in our communities where we support, empower, and celebrate in order to earn the right to do business there. We are deeply engrained in our neighborhoods and work with many local partners to provide experiences and tell our stories – be it at food drives, music festivals, skate tournaments, dance contests, basketball games, or in one of our 700 state-of-the-art doors. To ensure our stories have reach, we also regularly work with global partners such as our Chief Creative Office DJ Khaled, Snoop Dogg, Rick Ross, or brands such as Sony PlayStation and Sprite.

We entered the US market in 2019 through two acquisitions and have been extremely well-received by our communities, customers, and brand partners. We completed our third acquisition at the end of 2021, and in March 2022 acquired a fourth company in the US. We are geared up to invest more in our communities, our brand, and points of sale to unlock further growth across the US.

Overview:

Reporting to the Director, Omnichannel Systems, the Jr. Business Analyst, Omnichannel Systems will be responsible for the implementation and support for all systems associated with the movement of product in and out of our Philadelphia distribution center throughout our selling ecosystem while ensuring our ability to support growth and efficiencies.

Participates in all company Omnichannel and Supply Chain project goals and objectives.
Assist with support by identifying, defining, and prioritizing issues; assign accountability; communicates issues to all appropriate parties; drive issues to closure.
Coordinate and execute system interface testing between various systems within the Omnichannel and Supply Chain ecosystem.
Work on and assist in the management of WMS system configuration and data maintenance.
Strong knowledge in Warehouse Management, Merchandise Planning & Allocation, Digital and Store System Domains preferred.

Qualifications

Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners to drive decisions and solutions.
Excellent communication skills: ability to present data findings (both orally and in writing) in a clear and meaningful format.
SQL database query and reporting skills
At least 2 years of previous Business Analysis or Business Systems Analysis experience
Experience with an Omnichannel Retailer - preferred.
Warehouse Management Systems Experience – preferred.
Experience with Manhattan’s Associates Active Scale WMS, Aptos Merchandising and Order Management Solutions a plus – preferred.

Company :
Allegheny Health Network
Job Description :

GENERAL OVERVIEW:

The Cardiovascular Institute (CVI) at the Allegheny Health Network (AHN) is seeking a Research Data Analyst to help advance the academic research mission of the CVI. The primary responsibility of the Analyst will be to extract and organize data from various sources into research data sets ready for statistical analysis. Such data sources include electronic health records from the AHN, CVI-housed cardiovascular registries, and other sources including publicly available data sets. The Analyst will also work with the AHN-affiliated Highmark Health Plan to append insurance claims data to any of the above mentioned data sources. Other research-related tasks as listed below will be required as needed to advance the overall research mission of the CVI.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Working with clinical faculty and other researchers in the CVI on research projects ultimately resulting in publication in peer-reviewed journals and oral/poster presentations at national conferences.
Organizing raw data from various data sources such as electronic health records, CVI-housed clinical data registries, public data sources, and others into analysis-ready research data sets.
Work with the Highmark Health Plan research data team to append insurance claims data to the various data sources.
Perform “preparatory to research” data investigations using any of the above data sources to evaluate feasibility of potential research studies.
Clinical trials recruitment
Patient lists for research studies/recruitment

QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, computer science, data science, analytics, healthcare information systems or closely related discipline from a four-year college or university
3 years in the analysis of business processes and interfaces including, but not limited to interpreting system documentation, data and/or business process modeling, and data flow/context diagramming.



Preferred

Knowledge of various programming languages for extracting data from big data sources such as SQL, R, Python, SAS.
Appropriate educational background including a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, epidemiology, or other relevant subject area.
At least 3-5 years’ experience with the various programming languages.
Experience working in the medical research environment.

The Business Process Team is responsible for developing and improving business processes by eliminating defects, enhancing quality and introducing process innovation that can impact results, enhance profitability while achieving and maintaining optimal levels of process performance and ensuring business process outcomes are in harmony with an organization’s strategic goal.

Business Process Analyst

Role Description

Analyze and design business processes in collaboration with various IT and business groups including company stakeholders. Perform concise analysis to reduce complexity, increase process efficiency and effectiveness, and enable speed of operational processes.

The role will require engagement with team members to inspire and empower them to provide input into process change and encourage them to embrace the new process once it is implemented.

Duties and Responsibilities

Support IT and business groups in defining, interpreting, and implementing processes enhancements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop business process requirements.
Assist in planning and scheduling process improvements and resource allocation.
Assist in making business decisions relating to system implementation, modification, maintenance, etc.
Assist with the analysis and preparation of recommendations that will drive greater productivity, reduce waste, or eliminate duplication.
Work with operational team members to understand processes, root causes and outcomes.
Evaluates, designs, executes, measures, monitors and controls business processes.
Challenge existing processes and implement changes when needed.
Develop initiatives and best practices for continuous business process improvements.
Track and communicate status of business initiative projects to Business Process Manager, management, and internal customers.
Develop and maintain business process documentations that will be used as reference for preparing test cases, training documents, etc.
Skills and Specifications
Proven strong communication skills – written, oral, interpersonal.
Effectively interpreting and understanding client’s requirements.
Experience developing the voice of the internal customer to accurately relay their expectations.
Ability to evaluate problems and identify a unique approach to manage the project.
Ability to multi-task and deal with ambiguity.
Ability to deal conflicts in a cross functional environment.

Job Title: New Business Analyst (Conflicts Analysis and Clearance)
Job Description:
Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, one of the world’s leading global law firms with offices in strategic hubs of commerce, law, and government across North America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East, is seeking to hire a New Business Analyst in the Client/Matter Administration Department. Reporting to the New Business Manager, this position will focus efforts on assisting Partners, Associates, and support staff in identifying potential conflict issues and New Business-related information.
This position will reside in the Philadelphia office with a hybrid in-office/remote working schedule.
Key responsibilities:
Processes new client and matter reports associated with proposed new business.
Performs conflict analysis on all proposed new client representations and facilitate proper communication and coordination of issues related to New Business Intake.
Proactively communicates with Firm Attorneys and support staff in each office to understand conflicts of interest issues and independently reviews, researches and resolves conflicts issues related to firm new business.
Composes written and verbal correspondence with Attorneys and other support staff.
Answers telephone and email inquiries for new business status requests.
Proofreads and re-checks material to confirm accuracy.
Performs research, locating material from various sources inside and outside the Firm.
Enters ongoing status information and maintains on-line documentation in database.
Ensures compliance with ethics related to firm policies and procedures.
Works as a team member with the other assistants in the New Business department.
Experience & Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university required and two years’ experience preferably in a professional services setting.
Excellent project management and research skills.
Ability to concentrate clearly on highly detailed information, to identify conflicts of interest questions and resolve them in a consensus environment and to keep confidential information regarding Firm New Business matters.
A strong knowledge of MS Office products, and Internet research methods.
The successful applicant will also have excellent organizational skills; effective written and oral communication skills; the ability to take initiative and contribute new ideas; the ability to interact effectively with all levels of Firm management and staff; the capability to exercise sound judgment and work well under pressure; and the flexibility to adapt to changing priorities.
Flexibility to work overtime is required.
Qualified candidates must apply online by visiting our website at www.morganlewis.com and selecting “Careers.”

Job Title: Business Analyst

Location: New York City, NY / Pittsburgh, PA

Job Type: Full-time







Job Description:


﻿




** Need payment experience in Banking domain**







Roles and Responsibilities:







1. Analyzes, defines and prioritizes the business requirements, functional specifications and operational architecture for up to and

including highly complex strategic, global programs.

2. Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and

implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project.

3. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design

and use case documents.

4. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a given large, strategic, multi-year project.

5. Participates and provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation.

6. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation.

7. Tracks scope and change throughout the remainder of the initiative utilizing formal requirements management principles,

including change control and requirements traceability.

8. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that

span multiple, global business and technology areas.

9. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of

expertise.

10. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in

the future.

11. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives.

12. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their

business results.

13. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6-10 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus and prior experience in the liquidity domain is also a plus and preferred.

Our team members are at the heart of everything we do. At Cencora, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures, and every person here is essential to us being able to deliver on that purpose. If you want to make a difference at the center of health, come join our innovative company and help us improve the lives of people and animals everywhere. Apply today!
What you will be doing
Individuals in the Business Analysis role are responsible for serving as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization. They collect, analyze, develop, document, communicate business requirements, and support user testing to achieve business goals. Business Analysts continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, deepen client relationships, and effectively manage customer expectations. Based on breadth and depth of understanding of business needs and processes, they collaborate with IT professionals to determine if solutions currently exist (internally or externally) or whether new solutions are feasible. They take a broad perspective to determine how such solutions will impact existing work processes and systems, and how to manage the integration. Business Analysis professionals are responsible for proactively identifying technology opportunities that impact corporate business strategies and performance. Business Analysis professionals educate project team members on business unit goals and objectives and educate the business on the value of information technology. They also display innovation in identifying, proposing, and overseeing the execution of business solutions. Through adaptable communication skills and the ability to translate between technical and business language, they work collaboratively, negotiating requirements across multiple groups. Business Analysts must have a solid understanding of the clients existing business processes, the key drivers and measures of success for the business, and the short- and long-term direction of the business and related technologies.
The Business Solutions Analyst Lead requires a thorough working knowledge of Accounts Payable business processes including invoice processing for both purchase order and non-purchase order related invoices, invoices received from third-party applications, payment processing for checks, eft and international forms of payment, various US and International tax reporting requirements, and managing invoice price and quantity variances. Working knowledge of SAP ECC and S4 platforms is required with experience in both the MM and FI modules.
Establishes and maintains liaison relationship with business partners and IT organization in order to provide effective technical solutions.
Conducts data gathering and analysis to understand business strategy requirements.
Contributes to the business short-and long-term planning sessions and provides direction to ensure understanding of business goals and direction.
May provide direction for short-and long-term planning sessions and provides direction to ensure understanding of business goals and direction.
Provides input from a business and IT perspective.
Assesses client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to assist in identifying business priorities and advices on options.
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Analyzes customer’s operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities for improvements.
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.
May provide factual content to feasibility study for standard development projects and enhancements.
May provide assistance in business case development (i.e., research, data collection).
May develop user test cases and system integration testing and validates test results during testing.
May review and approve test plans and monitors testing process to ensure that business results are adequately tested with minimal risk.
May execute test cases.
May ensure test strategies involve appropriate integration and process components.
Investigates problems and develops recommendations for resolution.
Identifies need for technical assistance to help in problem resolution.
Keeps customers informed of problems, issues, and resolutions.
Analyzes performance metrics to ensure customer satisfaction.
Manages customers’ expectations.
Ensures IT solutions meet customers’ needs.
May meet regularly with team to gather work statuses.

Ensures work, information, ideas, and technology flow freely across teams.

Coaches and transfers knowledge to less experienced team members.
What your background should look like
Bachelor’s degree or in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience. Typically requires a minimum of five (5) or more years of relevant technical and business work experience. Requires experience/in-depth knowledge of business operations and systems requirements processes. Proficiency in IIBA principles and practices.
Minimum of five (5) years' relevant technical or business work experience.
Requires a thorough working knowledge of Accounts Payable business processes including invoice processing for both purchase order and non-purchase order related invoices, invoices received from third-party applications, payment processing for checks, eft and international forms of payment, various US and International tax reporting requirements, and managing invoice price and quantity variances.
Working knowledge of SAP ECC and S4 platforms is required with experience in both the MM and FI modules.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team / group setting.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.

Job Description:


Primary Role:

We are seeking a business analyst to provide expertise in Oracle supply chain and operations technologies. The candidate will have a background in information technology and knowledge of order management, fulfillment, and logistics. The business analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirements; design and test efficient IT solutions; and ensure seamless integration with existing systems. Primary systems for this role include Oracle Supply Chain Management, RF-Smart, and TraceLink.

Duties:

Requirements Gathering
Works closely with business teams to understand their needs and translate them into effective technical requirements.
Process Analysis and Design
Analyzes existing supply chain processes to identify areas for improvement and automation.
Designs and documents efficient IT solutions that align with business objectives and enhance supply chain operations.
Solution Development
Ensures that proposed solutions meet the business requirements and are technically feasible.
Collaborates with technical resources and solution architects to create effective solutions.
Testing and Quality Assurance
Develops test cases and end-to-end scenarios and performs thorough testing to validate the functionality and reliability of IT solutions.
Collaborates with business teams to facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure solutions meet business expectations.
Implementation and Support
Assists in the implementation of IT solutions, ensuring smooth deployment and minimal disruptions to ongoing operations.
Facilitates post-implementation support and troubleshooting to resolve any issues that arise.
Provides oversight over user access and security roles in alignment with organization policies.
Documentation and Training
Prepares detailed documentation, including change requests, SOPS, and work instructions related to new functionality.
Conducts training sessions for end-users to ensure they understand and utilize the implemented solutions effectively.
Project Management
Can act as a project manager on simple projects and enhancements.
Data Analysis
Analyzes supply chain data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for optimization.
Provides insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making processes.

This role can be hybrid (office and remote) but must be in Eastern Pennsylvania to facilitate being in the warehouse and production areas as required.

Embody the Myonex Core Values:

Be a Great Team Player
Be Customer Focused
Learn & Grow
Find a Way



Experience and Skills:

Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related experience.
Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience with Oracle Fusion Supply Chain and Manufacturing or similar line of business solution.
Experience with operational technologies including hand-held scanners, printers, and integrations with couriers.
Experience working with 3rd party support (both application management services and Oracle support).
Demonstrated understanding of the software implementation lifecycle and support.
Experience with healthcare, regulated industries, computer systems validation, and GMP is strongly preferred.
Experience with drug industry serialization platforms like TraceLink is nice to have.

Skills/Qualifications:

Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills and adept at conflict resolution
Effective written communications
Excellent organization and time management skills
Business knowledge and demonstrated ability to learn new industries and technology

Job Description

The Business Operations Analyst II is the lead for the development and implementation of reporting and order analytic tools to support departmental and business activities. This position is responsible for monitoring and initiating business change processes and work flows to align order fulfilment best practices between domestic and global teams. This position will report and analyse departmental key performance indices, service level agreements, liaison with internal and external groups to improve data, and rectify system deficiencies. The incumbent will lead supply allocation fulfilment projects and manage product registration order releases to ensure these activities are compliant with international and domestic regulatory requirements. The position is the overall lead to perform root cause analysis, reporting activities and provide improvement strategies to optimize domestic and global order-to-cash and fulfilment activities between working groups such as but limited too; Supply Chain and Logistics, Olympus Business Service America groups, Sales and Marketing Organizations and International Business Centers. All tasks must be performed with accuracy and integrity for proper application of sales revenue, ensure JSOX compliance and international regulatory order requirements are met.

Job Duties
Perform analyses on core area data to ensure order fulfilment activities are being met within the assigned product and customer deliverables.
Manage and provide current open order data to communicate shipment dates, supply constraints, holds, and errors to domestic and international stakeholders.
Perform root cause analyses and drive solution activities to completion.
Responsible to track, measure, monitor, research and report on key performance indices and service level agreements.
Develop and implement order fulfilment and order management work instructions and procedures.
Responsible for the execution of supply allocation against approved priority orders.
Collaborate and work with International Regulatory group to ensure order releases are compliant with international regulatory requirements.
Manage, coordinate, and action inquiries through group email boxes.
Perform ad hoc reporting and analyses between multiple companies and systems.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Job Qualification

Required:

Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Supply Chain or Business required.
Minimum 5 years of related experience is required within Business Operations, Supply Chain or Customer Operations.


Preferred:

Utilizing ERP systems, SAP preferred.
Leading projects to completion.
Analyzing data to optimize processes, monitor performance and create metrices.
Spreadsheet, Database, and BI Reporting system skills
Well-versed in PowerPoint, Graphs and Tables.
Intermediate to Advance Excel skills.
Manage, Organize, and Interpret large data sets.

Gather and present relevant feedback

Development and other technical team collaboration.

Detail, track, discuss, reassess bugs/issues sent back to development and/or partner using Azure DevOps

Work with business/technology consultants and other project team members to understand requirements
Assist in maintaining the design and integrity of internal processes and supporting systems
