At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!
What You Can Expect At BBH:
If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.
Join us as a Senior Systems Business Analyst in our Investment Management Systems organization!
The Sr. Systems Business Analyst provides strategic technical analysis to business partners, and acts as a liaison between technical and business user groups. The focus of this position is to work closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of the Investment Management business strategy, processes, services, roadmap, and the context in which the business operates.
The Senior Systems Business Analyst is responsible for defining and documenting business systems requirements and ensuring technology solutions enhance and support the business operations. Identify technology alternatives and recommends system solutions to business and technical audiences. Also, identify opportunities to improve efficiency. Responsibilities will include a full range of activities from leading small to mid-size projects to assisting other project managers on larger more complex projects related to operational business functions that affect both internal and external clients. The Senior Systems Business Analyst participates in all phases of the systems development life cycle – from project scoping, planning and requirements definition to issues resolution, testing, training, and implementation.
Responsibilities include:
Develop clear, concise methodology documents, which require proficiency in interviewing skills, workflow analysis, dataflow diagramming, screen design, etc.
Review and assist in development of project plans, project workflows as requested by Project Manager.
Facilitate the definition of functional requirements by working with programmers and users in prototyping and design sessions.
Translate system workflows into system configuration
Translate and present project concepts into effective visual images which clarify design elements and issues for both business and technical audiences.
Ensure methodology is followed for project; provide meaningful feedback in accordance with departmental standards and guidelines.
Identify, mediate, resolve, and eliminate miscommunications between business and technical project team members.
Provide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers, and others; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results
Stay current with business needs and strategies and manage relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others updated on project results
Support and align efforts to meet business needs
Understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders
Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; determining daily priorities; following proper escalation paths
Works to self-manage projects to budget/estimate and hit deadlines set forth by project leads/managers
Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process
Participate in development of test strategy, test plans and test cases
Participate in test execution and document results
Utilize Jira to organize, track, and update progress on projects throughout their entire life cycle.
Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)
Research and evaluate new technology solutions and present recommendations for improved system operations.
Support system conversions, upgrades, enhancements
Requirements & Qualifications include:
Financial Services experience, especially in Investment Management, or alternatively Private Banking / Wealth Management
Experience in designing and/or supporting data management or client reporting/sales enablement tools strongly recommended
BA/BS degree and/or related work experience.
5+ years of experience documenting specifications, preferably at a financial services company.
Full understanding of the business model or the area(s) supported.
Very Strong Analytical skills required
Must have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business
Strong time management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skills
Knowledge of all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle required – preferably agile or related iterative models
Data analysis – Must have proficiency with SQL, Microsoft Excel
Ability to create presentations using software such as Microsoft PowerPoint.
Exposure to project work and project planning, as well as project management software.
Interviewing skills.
Written and oral communications skills
Problem solving/analytical skills
A technical/programming background a huge plus as this role requires a strong partnership and constant coordination with development team to agree on timelines and scope of work

Overview:
Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector solutions implementation and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,500 professionals in more than 60 offices worldwide. PCG’s Education practice offers consulting services and technology solutions that help schools, school districts, and state education agencies/ministries of education to promote student success, improve programs and processes, and optimize financial resources. To learn more, visit http://www.publicconsultinggroup.com/education/.
Responsibilities:
PCG is currently seeking a Business Analyst to work with our Harrisburg, PA team. For the right motivated individual, there is an excellent opportunity for career development and advancement. Business Analysts work in a deadline-oriented, fast paced environment as part of a growing team consisting of consulting and operations staff. This position revolves around technology, policy and financial management functions. Business Analysts are vital in achieving stated business objectives. Responsibilities include leading current projects and working with project managers to develop new business in a fast-paced and demanding environment. The team's goal is to provide superior service to large school districts in the areas of special education management systems, data warehousing, federal claiming, and other school based revenue programs. Consultants play a key role in assisting in the development of the firm's growing Education Services practice area.

Specific Responsibilities:
Supporting project managers across multiple projects and clients and working with various project teams.
Providing daily client and project support either onsite or via phone/email (as project experience and knowledge is gained).
Supporting financial analysis and funding assessments for various clients including cost allocation plans, cost reports, and setting rates for public services.
Learning PCG’s web-based technologies and supporting the project team through the customization process, implementation, training, and ongoing operational efforts.
Supporting proposal development teams, including writing sections, coordinating efforts and preparing proposal submissions.
Developing presentations for and attending conferences/seminars.
Preparing and presenting written status reports. Supporting the team completing assessment documentation and recommendation reports for clients.
Conducting policy and other research to support the project team and assist in preparing information briefs for both internal and client-facing use.
Defining, documenting, and improving business processes.
Gathering and analyzing a variety of data, including both financial and written policy/procedure information.
Learning and performing tasks related to sales and marketing.

Required Skills:

Commitment to exceptional client service and confidently lead.
Creative problem-solving ability and a consultancy mindset.
Dedication to accomplishing goals and challenges presented by clients and management.
Ability to interact with various levels of management and with clients.
Flexible, self-starter possessing intellectual curiosity.
Ability to move multiple projects forward within a specific timeline and budget while working at a detailed level.
Strong analytical and financial data analysis skills.
Attention to detail and ability to work with large data sets with accurate results.

Solid organization and time management skills. ? Research and project management capabilities.
Demonstrated expertise in MS Office products, particularly PowerPoint, Access, Excel and Word.
Ability to speak Spanish a plus.

Previous supervisory experience of several subordinate preferred.
School system experience in the areas of administration, information technology, and finance or business operations is highly desirable.

Carmeuse started out as a small family-run business in Belgium.
Today it’s a leading global producer of lime, high calcium limestone and dolomitic stone. Its products are essential to energy producers, environmental services, construction and manufacturing.
With over 90 production facilities spread across almost every continent, and over 4,500 employees working at Carmeuse every day, the company’s most treasured resources are its people.



Carmeuse is dedicated to maintaining a workplace that fosters equal opportunity and creates a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity. The information received will be processed by Carmeuse and then directed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure the proper consideration of the application or hiring process.



You will be part of Carmeuse Americas, a Rock-Star team of 2500 workers and employees bringing with them their own culture and specific needs. The Americas headquarters are located in Pittsburgh, PA and have over three dozen production facilities across the Eastern U.S., Canada, Chile, Brazil, and Colombia.

Overall Purpose

This position is responsible for the management, documentation, implementation, project management and maintenance of the company’s ERP business applications. Mission critical applications supported include Epicor Prophet 21 and others. This position works closely with business leaders, Developers, and system users in identifying, evaluating, and changing existing applications as well as implementing new applications. This position is also responsible for defining and maintaining project standards which includes resource allocation, all phases of a development life cycle, i.e., gap analysis, feasibility study, requirements, analysis, design, testing, and implementation planning.

Key Responsibilities:

Acts as the key liaison across all functional areas and provides recommendations for improved system processes, including business units, information technology and outside vendors.
Develop information systems strategies with business users, define business objectives, and identify cost/benefit impact to the company of proposed projects.
Responsible for researching, analyzing, designing, proposing, and delivering solutions that are appropriate with best practices and align with business requirements.
Review and make recommendations on existing platforms for continuous improvement, enhance and resolve performance issues associated with software and system architecture.
Provide technical expertise and troubleshooting for issues that disrupt critical business processes and provides analysis on required remediation that addresses root cause.
Responsible for creation and maintenance of system documentation, system standards, policies, and SOPs for existing and new systems.
Analyzes user project proposals, identifies omissions, errors in requirements, and conducts feasibility studies; recommends optimum approach and develops systems and/or applications design for approved projects.
Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software’s business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments.
Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation.
All other duties as assigned.

Functional understanding of Epicor P21 modules: Wireless warehouse management system (WWMS), Finance & Accounting, Purchasing, Inventory Management, Order to Cash, and Warehouse Management

At Krystal Biotech, Inc., we bring together the brightest and most eager minds to relentlessly pursue the discovery, development and commercialization of gene delivery medicines for patients with serious and life-threatening genetic diseases. Founded in 2016, Krystal is a leader in gene therapy. Krystal received U.S. FDA approval for the first-ever redosable gene therapy treatment, VYJUVEK™, for the treatment of Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa. Krystal continues to leverage our proprietary platform to develop new treatments across a robust clinical pipeline. Located near Krystal’s headquarters are two state-of-the-art GMP facilities.

Krystal Biotech is based in Pittsburgh, PA which is home to our two state-of-the-art GMP facilities. Additional offices are situated in Boston, MA and in Zug, Switzerland.

Who We Are

At Freshpet, our goal is to change the way people nourish their pets forever. We strive to strengthen the bond between people and our pets so that we both live longer, healthier, and happier lives while being kind to the planet. We believe that if we can create fresh, real foods that pets love and help them live healthier lives that their pet parents will also enjoy the many benefits of a rich life shared with a pet.

We started off with a mission to change the way pet parents feed dogs and cats, but we also wanted to be a company that had a thoughtful approach to how we operate. We wanted to do things differently, make great products but be gentle to the planet, good to the people who touch our business, and leave a positive impact with everything we do. We work hard every day to ensure that the original vision is met, starting with making the highest quality foods in our kitchens to running our business with integrity, transparency, and social and environmental responsibility. IT’S AMAZING WHAT CAN HAPPEN WHEN YOU START COMPLETELY FRESH!

What You Will Do

As the BI Analyst, you will support and work with Freshpet leadership teams to develop functional requirements, design reports, implement dashboards, and support the data engineering team for the Microsoft Power BI platform. You will successfully evangelize business intelligence throughout the organization to align with and support data visualization and analytics solutions that involve web, reporting and dashboarding.

How You Will Make an Impact

Collaborate with both executive leaders and management teams to define reporting metrics, dashboards and KPI’s heavily driven by business goals, mid-term plans, and reporting against long-range goals
Consolidate requirements from multiple departments to define standard reporting measures and definitions to enforce organization-wide reporting consistency
Define standard templates and reusable components for reports and dashboards, collaborating with data architects and leadership to create and maintain a data catalog
Transform raw data into actionable information to facilitate informed decision-making for stakeholders across sales, manufacturing, logistics, supply chain (forecasting) and finance
Learning and understanding the application, and use of, Microsoft D365 at the manufacturing floor level
Learning the theory and application of D365 processes as it applies to integration of the manufacturing execution systems (MES) or RF Smart
Assist in building and supporting learning models, including providing written guidance and implementation plans. Conduct demonstrations and provide one-on-one technical assistance as needed
Utilize automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Identify and resolve coding errors, remove corrupted data, and address related problems
Perform data analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
Review reports and performance indicators to filter data and identify and correct code problems
Development and Maintenance dashboards associated with PowerBI/MES Systems
Learn the theory of operation for both roasted meals and rolls for better data interpretation/understanding
Contribution and Chartered membership of the Focused Improvement Pillar
Develop Standard dashboards within the Daily Management Systems

What You Will Bring

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred or combination of education and relevant work experience
5+ years of experience in developing and administering Microsoft Power BI solutions
Experience in the manufacturing field preferred
Proficiency in preparing reports for management that highlight trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Experience using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets for diagnosis and prediction purposes
Familiarity with business functions to assess and compare business performance over time
Knowledge of consumer goods industry, information architecture, user experience, and ISAE compliance
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Effective communication skills in both verbal and written forms
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Demonstrated experience in designing and developing customized reports, dashboards, and scorecards using Power BI/MES Systems

What We Offer

At Freshpet, we offer a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental and vision insurance, basic and optional life insurance, short- and long-term disability protection, flexible spending accounts, and a 401(k) plan with company match, paid parental leave, pet insurance, tuition assistance, a generous PTO plan and so much more!

Job Description: Power BI Developer/Analyst

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Power BI Developer/Analyst who has a background in a call center environment and possesses a strong aptitude for data analysis. As a member of our team, you will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights to support strategic decision-making.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the operations team to understand their requirements and goals and translate them into effective data-driven strategies.
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights for the call center operations.
Extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Analyze call center data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, and provide recommendations for process improvements and optimization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics to measure call center performance.
Conduct regular data analysis to monitor and track call center performance against established KPIs and goals.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging trends in data visualization and analytics to continuously improve data reporting capabilities.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Power BI Developer/Analyst or similar role, preferably in a call center environment.
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX calculations, and report/dashboard design.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to convert complex data into actionable insights.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
Familiarity with call center metrics, operations, and processes.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver high-quality work within tight deadlines.
Experience with other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, QlikView) is a plus.

Join our dynamic team and contribute to the success of our call center operations by leveraging your data analysis expertise and Power BI skills. Apply now and help shape our strategic decision-making processes based on data-driven insights!

Company Summary Statement : As one of the largest investor-owned utility companies in the United States, PPL Corporation (NYSE: PPL), is committed to creating long-term, sustainable value for our 3.5 million customers, our shareowners and the communities we serve. Our high-performing regulated utilities — PPL Electric Utilities, Louisville Gas and Electric, Kentucky Utilities and Rhode Island Energy — provide an outstanding experience for our customers, consistently ranking among the best utilities in the nation. PPL’s companies are also addressing challenges head-on by investing in new infrastructure and technology that is creating a smarter, more reliable and resilient energy grid. We are committed to doing our part to advance a cleaner energy future and drive innovation that enables us to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 while maintaining energy reliability and affordability for the customers and communities we serve. PPL is a positive force in the cities and towns where we do business, providing support for programs and organizations that empower the success of future generations by helping to build and maintain strong, diverse communities today. Overview:
The Business Analyst plays a dynamic role responsible for supporting project and product delivery teams with direct reporting to the Manager, IT Business Analysis. The Business Analyst performs various functions based on both user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. The Business Analyst serves as a team member for the documentation of requirements which can take the form of epics, features, user stories, and acceptance criteria for prioritized system and feature development. The Business Analyst is a collaborative team player with a growth mindset and an interest in devising or modifying procedures to solve the complex business systems and industry requirements of our business, users, and customers to help build the digital utility of the future.
Responsibilities:
Interacts and effectively communicates with internal clients to understand functional requirements that potentially lead to user stories and acceptance criteria.
Organizes and facilitates meetings with Business, Design, Dev Team, and other groups as needed.
Develops, refines, and documents requirements in the form of epics, features, user stories and acceptance criteria for prioritized feature development.
Supports the team with current and potential system inputs, processes, and outputs including interface mapping and documentation of business processes – “As Is / To Be” State.
Consulted on functional testing of system modifications.
Ensures traceability on project work including capturing requirements; tracking test cases linked to requirements; and may support capturing defects and linking to root cause as part of User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Supports testing activities prior to release, assuring we built what aligns to agreed features and capabilities.
Assists with training documentation and supporting product details for the business.
Collaborates with the Design Team in the Discovery Phase of Agile Playbook related to user requirement activities.
Participates in the development and implementation of programs intended to strengthen internal controls or improve client service and/or support.
Provide RFP support in terms of gathering high level requirements, mapping flows, and providing demos.
Assist with and support business case development including business analyses or feasibility studies associated with technology initiatives.
All other duties and projects as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required and minimum five or more years professional work experience in business analysis required.
Incumbent must be competent to work phases of systems analysis and consider the business implications of the application technology to the current business environment.
Incumbent must effectively deal with rapid technological and business change while maintaining enthusiasm, displaying sound judgment, and utilizing common sense.
Strong problem solving and analytics skills to be able to develop technology solutions that solve business problems quickly.
Ability to collaborate with internal and external teams to unblock critical issues during product development.
Preferred Qualifications


A successful academic or work background indicating a demonstrated ability to absorb information, apply conceptual skills in practical applications, and achieve desired results in a highly technical, operating environment.
Knowledge and expertise across multiple spectrums of large-scale business operations, preferably in the Utility Sector.
High empathy and self-awareness – easily sees and values other perspectives.
Excellent communicator both oral and written, with strong documentation skills to articulate business and technical process flows.
Experience in the use of Project/Product tools and methodologies.

ABOUT DYNAMICS

Dynamics Inc. is a mature high-tech start-up that designs, manufactures and markets intelligent powered payment devices. We focus on introducing fast-cycle innovation to top bank card issuers and our signature innovation is the world's first fully programmable magnetic stripe used in our next-generation payment cards that utilize all three industry transaction methods: swipe, pin & chip and tap. Recently, we have integrated powered card technology into fully interactive, client facing websites and back-end processing systems.

Dynamics believes a great company culture comes from hiring the most talented, team-oriented people that work well together in a fast paced environment. Join the start-up team at Dynamics as a key player in creating the future of payments and card technology.

Business Analyst / Project Manager

Dynamics is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join its growing Software Team. This client-facing member of the department is responsible for maintaining regular communication with clients and partners, filtering requests for future facing ideas, working through high-level concepts and guiding clients and partners into solutions.




Team Management – Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; and mentoring and developing team members



Product Owner Support – Support the Product Owner in managing customer expectations for project deliverables, managing stakeholder communications, and helping to implement an effective system of project governance



Process Management and Improvement – Define and manage a well-defined project management process and champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for Agile Project Management



Team building – promote empowerment of the team, ensure that each team member is fully engaged in the project and making a meaningful contribution, and encourage a sustainable pace with high-levels of quality for the team



Qualifications
Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment
A proven track record of successfully implementing software or web development projects using Agile methodologies including 5+ years of experience as a Project Manager managing large, complex projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams. PMP preferred
Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred
Balanced business/technical background:



Skills Required:
BA or BS or equivalent experience is required; MA or MS is a plus
Strong interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building
Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands
Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence
Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met
Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate tools:
Agile Project Management tools such as Jira/Greenhopper, Rally, or equivalent
Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office Tools
Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level
Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view
Strong SQL experience (MySQL) desired.
Experience with wireframing and/or designing user experiences is a plus.
Prior eCommerce, social/community or gaming experience a plus.

Overview
Vice President, External Reporting
Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 239 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.
We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Business Analyst- External Reporting to join our Regulatory Reporting – Change Management team. This role is located in Pittsburg, PA or New York City, NY- HYBRID

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:
Business Technology Liaison - Analyse, defines and prioritizes business requirements and functional or operational specifications for moderate to large projects of increasing complexity.
Provides consultation to all areas of IT and business management for the application of Regulatory reporting to support business opportunities and planning, implementation of cross-functional applications.
Participates in and provides guidance on development of functional requirements and user documentation and testing.
Uses broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.
Discusses and negotiates technical requirements and multi-departmental solutions, designs and implements innovative efficient auditable processes, and documents results for all levels of management. Identifies and communicates meaningful issues to management as part of the reporting process and suggests options to address and remediate.
Coordination with cross functional team, stakeholders, and technology team.
Works with senior management to ensure that the appropriate external reporting policies, methods, standards, processes, reporting and training are developed, applied and understood by impacted stakeholders.
Extensive knowledge of regulatory reporting processes and knowledge of compliance in regulatory bodies. Recognized throughout the organization as the external reporting point of contact for a particular business/business partner areas.
Leverages the most complex regulatory reporting techniques to achieve business objectives. Manages all activities related to the development and production of external reporting. Plans and implements policies, procedures and reporting activities across multiple businesses and locations.

To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:
Bachelor‘s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Banking experience is highly preferred.
7 – 12 years of experience of performing a senior Technical Analyst role on large regulatory or business change Programs within global financial institutions.
Ability to interpret complex business objectives and translate them into clear business requirements.
Hands on experience in SQL and writing queries for complex data analysis.
Experience with Regulatory reporting tools (Axiom, OneSumX) preferred.
Experience with Python/Bigdata technologies preferred.
Confidence in dealing with a wide range of senior stakeholders.
Experience of collaboration and consensus building
Experience in external reporting and/or internal audit preferred.

Job Summary
Responsible for analyzing, organizing, and developing requirements that drive the development of technology products and services. Working closely with Product Managers and Product Development, this position focuses on ensuring that products being delivered provide meaningful value to users and customers, additionally partnering with Product Readiness and Product Operations to ensure adoption and efficiencies. The Business Analyst will also review business processes, assist with root cause analysis, and provide process recommendations. Frequent independent judgments are essential. The incumbent is also required to perform all tasks in observance of Rite Aid’s brand and strategy and adhere to our core values and service attributes.
Job Responsibilities
Gain a deep understanding of initiatives, their business problems and solution design, in order to act as a translation layer to the development team, enabling execution and adoption.
Serve as the subject matter expert for products within assigned product line(s), providing input into the product roadmaps and business cases being developed for new initiatives.
Work closely with Product Managers and Development to coordinate development efforts to address requirements identified in strategic initiatives and projects.
Work with business owners, Product Managers, and Product Readiness to ensure proper requirement documentation, including those required for system acceptance and adoptability.
Manage the assigned product backlog, ensuring the best next thing is queued for development based on strategic priorities as set by leadership, and working with Product Operations to manage maintenance and support request development.
Provide input into product release strategy and planning, including potential impact to timelines and clarification of user needs.
Participate in business and industry workgroups, driving meaningful input into product roadmaps.
Assist Product Operations to complete root cause analysis and identify corrective actions.
Work with internal departments and/or customers to evaluate and recommend opportunities for configuration and supportability of products.
Adhere to both internal and industry best practices and productivity metrics.

Position Summary
This position is within the Platform Enablement Team (Reporting and Analytics Train) which is building the strategic Medicare platform, Medicare NextGen. We are looking for a Report Developer that will work with key business partners to define requirements, complete data modeling, development and work very closely with partners to ensure the final product meets their needs. This role is responsible for developing reports to meet business end user needs off of data marts associated with the Medicare NextGen platform.

The report types can vary from operational reporting, regulatory, statutory and compliance.
The main data sources used for these reports are Health Rules Payor Data Warehouse.
This individual will work with other resources on the team that will assist with defining requirements and coordinating meetings with key end users.
Training on the data model and tools used to extract data will be completed by an existing report developer.

Required Qualifications

3-5 years of data interpretation and analysis experience.
Extensive experience with databases as well interpretation and manipulation of related data.
Healthcare background.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
The ideal candidate would have the following expertise and experience: MS Excel; Oracle SQL query language; Excel VBA code; MS Access; SAP Crystal Reporting

SAS Experience a plus
Education B.S or Equivalent work experience

Overview:
Spring EQ was founded to help homeowners unlock the value of their home by providing visibility to its worth and provide quick access to that equity. By surrounding ourselves with some of the brightest, hard-working minds in the industry, we constantly improve the loan experience for our customers.
At Spring EQ, we;
Strive to make every customer interaction a great one

Spring EQ is seeking a Software Quality Assurance/Business Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. This position will be an active member of the Information and Technology team at Spring EQ and will report directly to the Senior Vice President of Information Services. This position will play a key role in the enhancement of our CRM and loan origination platform. This critical role requires a passionate and detail-oriented individual pursuing a career in the FinTech industry.
Responsibilities:
Problem Solving – This position will be responsible for learning the Spring EQ process flow as it relates to the technology used by each role/process, then applying this knowledge to design and document the best way to test these systems and solve new business opportunities.
Documentation & Data Collection - This position will document test cases and business requirements for application changes. Documentation primarily falls into one of three types:
Test Cases – Detailed documentation of testing scenarios that this role and the QA team members will use for performing new functionality testing as well as regression testing.
Test Results/Defects – Detailed documentation describing failed test cases and the associated scenarios.
Business Requirements - User-friendly guides to communicate system changes to developers, and documenting business process flows, or technology data flows used by developers to program the required changes.
Testing – This position will be responsible for testing the product returned from the developer to ensure the product that is returned meets the documented requirements, while also performing detailed regression testing to ensure no defects were introduced in other parts of the application.
Application Support – This position will provide Tier 2 application support to any users experiencing system issues, or users who have questions about system functions.
Collaboration – This position will work with third party vendors and internal developers to explain system defects and to collaborate on system designs involving third party products interfacing with applications from the Spring EQ technology suite, including work with third party vendors to troubleshoot potential issues related to the interfacing of data between Spring EQ and their products.
Configuration – This position will assist in configuration and post implementation activities in our monthly production releases.
Additional ad-hoc duties will be completed as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s Degree Required.
5 years experience in a similar role desired
2(+) years prior work experience in a similar role in the financial services or lending industry a plus
Experience with project management and documentation related to software development
Due to the nature of the work and need to minimize impact on production while changes are made, this position requires flexibility to work several late night and/or weekend availability each month.
Strong communication skills, oral and written
High attention to detail, analytical mindset
Ability to cross over from the business to technology requirements
Solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Ability to multitask, problem solve and efficiently manage time.
Prior experience building Excel spreadsheets and PowerPoint.
Prior experience writing SQL queries is a plus.
Knowledge of Quality Assurance software and process is a plus.
Knowledge working with any Mortgage Loan Origination Systems (Blue Sage preferred, but not required).
Experience performing QA testing on browser-based applications.
The ideal candidate will have a self-starter mentality with the ability to solve open ended business challenges.
The ideal candidate will enthusiastically contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
We worked hard to stay updated with the industry technology, therefore we need our employees to be able to learn new computer systems quickly.
Time is money – At Spring EQ we recognize the importance of working with a sense of urgency. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Spring EQ values personal excellence, integrity and accountability – we need candidates who demonstrate these qualities in their everyday lives.

The Utilization Management Operations Business Analyst develops solutions to business problems and opportunities for all customer service applications used by Utilization Management. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Adept at defining problems, collecting, and processing data resulting in solutions.

Understanding of Workforce Management concepts and methodologies as well as experience with Workforce Management tools such as Verint.
Healthcare experience strongly preferred.
Familiarity with Facets, JIVA or other similar customer service applications a plus.

Vanguard’s Institutional Marketing team is looking for a Product Owner to lead the implementation and ongoing enhancements of our customer data and identity resolution platforms. The CDP/IDR Product Owner is responsible for optimizing the value and use of the Adobe Real Time CDP and IDR platforms by defining and prioritizing the features and functionality with our digital marketing, marketing technology and technical development teams. This position will also partner with a digital marketing team to enable omnichannel activations, analytics, personalization, retargeting, and remarketing strategies to position the organization for continued advancement of marketing effectiveness given the changing dynamic landscape of digital marketing.

A successful candidate will have marketing technology experience, will be results oriented and a creative problem solver who thrives on learning and team collaboration. This individual will lead the strategic vision and roadmap for a product or products within a specific business area, demonstrating a deep understanding of the product(s). Products may have enterprise-wide implications.

This role:

Build the overarching strategy and high-level plan for CDP and IDR implementation, ingestion from multiple data sources, customer profile synthetization into traits and audiences, journey orchestration and integration with downstream system in partnership with Marketing and IT.
Act as the Product Owner representing Vanguards Institutional marketing team for utilization of the customer data and identity resolution platforms. Maintain and prioritize a backlog of features for implementation.
Contribute to the creation of a robust segmentation and testing strategy aimed at personalizing the consumer experience (marketing teams will own the customer journey strategy and segmentation criteria).
Ensure the highest quality, performance, delivery, and availability standards are met. Manage multiple, concurrent initiatives in various phases of ideation, execution, or delivery.
Bring best practices and strategy for consumer data journey and overall orchestration by working with both internal resources, including the Marketing Technology Team, IT and outside professional services, as necessary, to execute omni channel use cases.
Work with Marketing Analysts, Data Engineering, Data Science and other cross functional teams to define requirements for data and analytics solutions.

Regularly present and communicate findings to senior leadership in a clear and compelling way.

What it takes:

Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required.
Minimum of 3 years of related work experience including experience with multiple components of the marketing technology stack including personalization, segmentation, campaign and data orchestration, etc. is required. At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering
Experience leading the implementation and management of Adobe’s Real Time CDP, or similar platforms such as, Segment, Tealium, Amperity and SAP.
Expert in leading components of large scale, high volume, real-time customer centric applications and digital infrastructure.
Understanding of related technologies, such as data management platforms, data lakes, and marketing automation tools.
Curious and shows high level of comfort in situations of ambiguity.
Proven track record working with diverse cross-functional teams and vendors. Adept at guiding groups with divergent opinions towards a unifying decision, drawing upon data to ground decision making.
A structured problem solver who can use technical aptitude, cross functional communication skills and results focus to align a broad set of stakeholders on solutions.
Comfortable thinking big and connecting the dots to align our product direction with the strategic goals of our business.
Can communicate complex ideas clearly, regardless of audience.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

The Graduate School at Penn State is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to join their team. This position will play a critical role in the implementation of Salesforce and ongoing Enterprise Constituent Relationship Management (ECRM) initiatives.

About the role: The individual in this role will ensure that ECRM projects are properly supported through requirements gathering, process documentation, stakeholder analysis, communication plans, risk assessments, process mapping, gap analysis, and project planning. This position will have the opportunity to evolve into Salesforce Administrator responsibilities as experience and expertise is gained.

Reporting to the Executive Director of Graduate Operations and Administration, this is a client facing role and will work in partnership with the Graduate School technology team and the Penn State ECRM Program Office and work closely with various graduate offices and academic units. The position will be instrumental in understanding the current capabilities and needs of the users, identifying gaps in the current processes, and enabling desired future capabilities to derive efficiencies, and benefits.

This position has the potential to be performed as a hybrid of remote and on-site working, or fully remote within the United States. Standard working hours are in the eastern time zone.

Responsibilities: Primary duties include the following:

Evaluate, analyze, and maintain CRM system(s); serve as a liaison between technical staff and user groups.
Lead and facilitate meetings with stakeholders to gather requirements and analyze information about critical business processes. Identify gaps and/or necessary changes.
Analyze requirements to define scope, objectives, and feasibility; modify and configure CRM to meet business needs and stakeholder requirements.
Develop and execute test plans and validation of related IT solutions, as well as other quality assurance measures; conduct testing such as user acceptance, performance, security, usability, etc.
Maintain relationships with vendors, work with vendors on bug fixes, new features, and proper use of products.
Collect user feedback regarding system performance and work with team to prioritize configuration requests.
Support, develop, and deliver communications and training to users and stakeholders. Develop and provide training, demonstrations, and regular communication to end-users.
Develop and maintain documentation, including visual diagrams, process models, process maps, for current and future state processes, organizational structure, data structure, and system architecture.
Provide advanced customer service and functional support to end-users in area of expertise; assist with implementing “workarounds” when system issues affect operations.
Design, implement, and analyze reports to determine the overall trends of the organization. Conduct Total Cost of Ownership analysis.
Compile and write Business Case/Justifications
Handle fundamental Salesforce administrative functions including routine tasks such as user account maintenance and workflows.
Stay current with Salesforce releases, features, and best practices through continuous learning and certifications.
Contribute to change management efforts to facilitate a smooth transition to Salesforce solutions.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Education, Experience and other requirements:

Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree preferably in information technology (or a related field) and 6+ years of relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Demonstrated experience in gathering requirements and translating requirements into functional design specifications, use cases and business process flows.
Proven track record of effectively building relationships with stakeholders.
Must be adaptable to change and be able to handle multiple projects or initiatives.
Must be a creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze data and derive insights from reports and dashboards.

Preferred Qualifications:

Hands-on Salesforce expertise and/or certifications.
Experience in an agile environment.
Experience in higher education CRM implementations.
Experience with SQL or scripting languages a plus.

Job Title: Power BI Analyst

Job Summary:
Forward Thinking Technology Solutions is seeking a talented and experienced Power BI Analyst to join our team. As a Power BI Analyst, you will be responsible for working with our management team to understand their data needs, designing, and developing reports and dashboards using the Power BI platform, and providing valuable insights to drive data-driven decision-making. You should have a strong understanding of data analysis, data wrangling, visualization techniques, and the ability to effectively communicate complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Roles and Responsibilities:

Transform and manipulate raw data from excel, Jira, and other data sources to create meaningful insights.

Develop and run a variety of ad-hoc analysis on key driver performance.

Develop, maintain, and manage advanced reporting, dashboards, and other Power BI-based solutions.

Escalate data issues needing process re-engineering.

Work on continuous improvement opportunities to increase accuracy revolving data entry.

Audit data on a regular basis to ensure data integrity and quality.

Work to identify and solve problems of a diverse scope where analysis of the data will require evaluation of many identifiable and non-identifiable factors.

Support documentation processes within Business Intelligence.

Perform data quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify process improvement opportunities.

Compile statistical reports and information. Conduct research, analyze data, and prepare recommendations.

Leverage business analytics and visualization techniques to make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable to drive business decisions and clarify management objectives.

Participates in additional tasks as assigned.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Power BI Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, including report and dashboard development, data modeling, and DAX language.
Solid understanding of data analysis techniques and statistical concepts.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.

Preferred Qualifications:
Microsoft Power BI certification.
Experience with other data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikView.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling.

Job Overview:

The role of Business Intelligence Analyst (BI) will be responsible for the front end of all reporting related functions within the IT Department. The role will be responsible for identifying business intelligence, reporting, data analysis, data mining, patterns discovery, and data visualization. The BI Analyst interacts with business and IT teams at all levels to ensure reliable, accurate, relevant, and appropriately processed data is available for business decision making. The BI Analyst is responsible for the creation of documentation to educate users on data analysis, the automation of canned reporting, and to provide ad hoc self-service processes whenever possible. The role requires a strong view of PHMC’s change management process to ensure the delivery of tangible results and innovation to PHMC’s business community. The role also requires the ability to define tactical plans to meet data security and quality benchmarks set by the DBA.

The BI Analyst must have data modeling exposure and the ability to analyze functional business processes and functional business requirements to help PHMC IT develop BI and data warehouse (DW) strategy. This requires working with several teams to gather and cleanse disparate, and dirty data to produce high quality results. Participates in special projects and performs additional duties as required by management.

This role will work with application developers, systems, and business analysts, as well as network and systems administrators and the information technology management team. The role requires excellent analytical skills, time management skills, the ability to prioritize and multi task. Most important is the ability to make effective and timely decisions in alignment with departmental direction as required.

Work Schedule:

This is a full-time exempt position with a regular work schedule of five days and 40 hours/week. Work Hours described as Monday through Friday, 8:30am – 5:00pm. This position may be required to work some evenings and Saturdays during peak periods. Work primarily performed at 1500 Market Street, Philadelphia, PA.

Responsibilities:

Provides subject matter expertise for key BI core functions
Provides design support for the development of business intelligence solutions
Works on highly complex, cross-functional, and enterprise IT and BI solutions
Initiates BI technical process from inception, design, development, testing, and delivery of BI solutions. Participates in BI projects management and review
Gathers, validates, and assesses business requirements for an adequate BI solution
Will participate in BI tools research, frameworks, and mechanisms for data analytics
Stays abreast of BI products/tools and of business strategies and direction
Adheres to current BI standards and provides recommendations to improve or develop new standards, policies, and procedures
Designs, develops, and delivers end-user training and training materials

Contributes to knowledge sharing in BI, the tools, frameworks, and known best practices

Keeps IT management and others informed about work efforts and challenges that may affect normal work progress

Skills:

Self-directed, the ability to work independently, and being highly-motivated while bringing an entrepreneurial spirit to Information Technology operations
Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment
Ability to stay focused and complete tasks in a timely and accurate manner, respecting operational and organizational goals and processes
Detail-oriented, dependable and trustworthy as this role may require contact with complex and sensitive documents and/or information
Highly organized individual capable of defining project and driving though to delivery against defined plan
Skilled at risk and issue management
Effective communication skills, able to engage at all levels of the organization while operating under pressure and deadlines

Experience:

3 years or more of experience in BI analyst position
High level of proficiency in Business Intelligence functions
Excellent organizational and time management skills, attention to detail to produce accurate work
Good communication skills
Knowledge in the following technical tools required: SQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI, QLIK, or Tableau
Advanced knowledge in EXCEL preferred
Healthcare setting experience preferred
Quantitative research, statistics, R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS is a plus

Typically requires 3 or more year of BI Analyst or Business Analysis or related technical experience

Summary:

As part of the Applications and Data Services – Student Collaboration Center team, the Sr. Business Analyst will be a member of the team responsible for the support of the University’s Student business software applications and integration with external systems and services. They will need to work closely with the administrative units, understanding their requirements, configuring software to meet their needs, providing technical support, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring smooth communication and training related to the software product. They will also need to collaborate with the development teams to provide feedback and recommendations for product enhancements. Working independently or as part of a supportive team, the qualified candidate will need to develop best-practice technical solutions that enable new functionality, create efficiencies, and enforce University Policies in support of student service offices University wide (Bursar, OWLcard office, Student Financial Services, University Housing, etc.).

The selected candidate will be working in a university setting with exposure to multiple technologies, including Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, SQL server, database object creation, .NET, etc. Experience with Banner or other ERP systems is a plus. Performs other duties as assigned.

· Gathers functional requirements and writes specifications and process documentation.

Develops ad-hoc data extracts and reports using Oracle SQL
Provides end-user training relating to Banner Student and other ancillary applications.
Provides leadership and direction to technical developer staff on Banner Student processes.
Ability to work on and lead multiple projects including coordinating multi-faceted implementation teams.
Work with vendors to install/upgrade software on Windows servers.
As a product owner support and document disaster recovery testing, participate in internal audit assessments and remediations, maintain system configuration data, apply start of semester procedures, perform user maintenance, apply overall product support to users.
Ability to analyze and identify specific business problems and determine the appropriate technology solutions needed to design/build robust standalone or integrated applications, interfaces, programs and functions.
Comply with Change Management procedures and work with other IT and Functional departments to ensure security, database and networking standards are maintained.
Regularly communicate and maintain effective working relationships with peers, clients and members of the university community.
Serve as a technical/support resource and contribute expertise to develop a body of knowledge within and between project teams.
Ability to work independently as well as a member of a team and ensure projects are completed within specified time frames.

Click here to learn more about the benefits of working at Temple University.

Required Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree and at least five 4 years of related IT experience. Management and Experience with ERP technology a must. Experience with Banner or other enterprise level application development. Demonstrated experience with Oracle PL/SQL and SQL server. Experience with version control software like GITHUB. Experience with agile and waterfall project management methodology. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Required Skills & Abilities:

Familiarity with Student application support/development.
Demonstrated understanding and technical grasp of relational database design/normalization, testing methodologies and software development lifecycles.
Familiarity with installing/upgrading software on Windows servers and following best practice protocols.
Strong analytical and testing skills
Strong knowledge of software architecture
Demonstrated ability to elicit and document user requirements and to document completed applications.
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills along with the ability to relate to a diverse group of management and staff.
Strong interpersonal skills; able to build strong relationships with clients and team members.
Ability to lead and deliver major project initiatives on time and as expected.
Take initiative to learn the environment, understand the tech stack, internal ITS processes and procedures.
Suggest improvements to existing applications.
Be able to apply time management skills and manage your own projects with minimal supervision.
Document and share status of projects.

Preferred:

Familiarity with Student application support/development.
Experience with researching and diagnosing data inconsistencies and specifying appropriate audit reports.

This position is assigned a hybrid work arrangement (on-campus and remote), the duration of this hybrid work arrangement is at the discretion of Temple University and the Department.

Description

Business Analyst I

Locations: IN-Indianapolis, MA-Hingham, ME-South Portland, NY-East Syracuse, PA-Harrisburg, and TX-Denison.

Elevance Health supports a hybrid workplace model with pulse point sites (major office) used for collaboration, community, and connection. This position has an on-site requirement of 1-2 days/week. Candidates must reside within 50 miles or 1-hour commute each way of a relevant Elevance Health location listed above.

The Business Analyst I is responsible for assisting with the translation of business needs into application software requirements. This is the entry-level in a career progression.

National Government Services (NGS) is a proud member of Elevance Health’s family of brands. We administer government contracts for Medicare and partner with the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to transform federal health programs.

How you will make an impact:

Participates in developing and/or modifying requirements, business design specifications, user training and documentation.
Researches and documents business issues.
Translates business requirements to technical staff to ensure that requirements are incorporated into system design.
Tests and documents solutions.
Serves as liaison between users of the software and technical staff.

Minimum Requirements:

Requires a HS diploma or equivalent and minimum of 5 years related health care experience that includes work flow design, data analysis, and/or systems automation and testing; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
This position is part of our NGS (National Government Services) division which, per CMS TDL 190275, requires foreign national applicants meet the residency requirement of living in the United States at least three of the past five years.

Preferred Skills, Capabilities, and Experiences:

BA/BS degree preferred.
Understanding of business processes and systems capability strongly preferred.

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $23.35/hr to $35.02/hr.

Locations: New York

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company. be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Be part of an Extraordinary Team

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

Elevance Health operates in a Hybrid Workforce Strategy, providing various levels of flexibility while also ensuring that associates have opportunities to connect in-person. Unless in a designated virtual-eligible role and specified as primarily virtual by the hiring manager, associates are required to work at an Elevance Health location at least once per week, and potentially several times per week. Specific requirements and expectations for time onsite will be discussed as part of the hiring process. Candidates must reside within 50 miles or 1-hour commute each way of a relevant Elevance Health location.

The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. Job Details

Description

Job Summary




As a key member of the Independence Health System Business Intelligence and operations team, the Business Analyst is responsible for innovative reporting analytics for dedicated service lines. Focused holistically on the service line, the Analyst is responsible for clinical, operational, and financial insights. By collaborating with the Business Intelligence and Finance teams, the Analyst will utilize data derived from data models to support and enhance the strategic initiatives of the service line. The Analyst will work closely with key stakeholders to identify problems and deliver effective solutions to analyze data in innovative ways. Qualified candidates will apply creative and outside-the-box solutions to address service line needs and develop data-driven solutions. Further, the Business Analyst is responsible for partnering with the Service Line leadership to deliver insights to improve the service line.




Essential Job Functions




Provides expert analytical, financial, and project management support to for service line administrators and chairs.
Uses data models to create actionable insights to improve clinical, operational, and financial outcomes of the service line.
Works collaboratively with key stakeholders and Business Intelligence and Finance to scope, design, and implement ad hoc and routine analytic solutions to solve business needs.
Learns service line operations and proactively promotes analytic solutions to identify or solve problems.
Assists the service line leaders in managing the holistic financial picture, including variance explanation, budgeting, long-range planning, margin analysis, and business planning.
Creates presentations to effectively communicate the findings of detailed analytics, including review of assumptions and techniques used to generate output.
Innovates on efficiency of report generation, utilization continuous improvement techniques.
Actively pursues the use of data to make key organizational decisions, including providing non-technical audience with correct data concepts.
Maintains project planning tools and concepts.
Monitors operating performance against regional and national benchmarks.
Behaves as an agent for transformation including utilization of continuous improvement techniques to improve organizational reporting techniques.
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets results, trends, or patterns in complex data sets.
Collaborates with Business Intelligence data owners to connect cross-functional data to create a service line balanced scorecard.
Provides recommendations for operational or financial efficiencies and process improvements. Assists in change initiatives.
Interprets, researches, and analyzes findings to explain strategic or tactical implications on operations.
Designs and performs reports, visualizations, and statistical analyses – and being able to articulate the analyses to a non-technical audience
Collaborates with other departments to implement improvement initiatives.
Provides analysis and recommendations on financial implications of range of strategic and operational alternatives.
Develops variable sensitive models and management tools.
Other related duties as assigned.



Required Qualifications




Bachelor’s Degree with an emphasis in Business, Finance, Data Sciences, Healthcare Management, or related field.
One (1) to three (3) years of experience in business intelligence, finance, analytics, strategy, or other applicable analytical roles.
Superior computer skills and relevant software experience.
Excellent Microsoft Office skills in all applicable programs, including Excel and PowerPoint.
Expert investigational skills, shows attention to detail, accuracy and ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks.
Strong leadership ability, organizational skills, critical thinking skills, sound judgment, and knowledge of legal aspects and liability of hospital practice.
Ability to work independently and lead complex projects and activities.
Demonstrated ability to present and communicate complex and/or controversial topics and concepts to a wide and diverse audience and leadership teams.
Solid customer-service skills; anticipates, understands, and addresses customer needs in a timely manner.
Knowledge in operational financial concepts.



Preferred Qualifications




Master’s Degree with an emphasis in Business, Finance, Data Sciences, Healthcare Management, or related field preferred.
Experience in Healthcare setting.
Experience in Tableau or other data visualization software.
Experience in advanced analytics.
Experience in SQL reporting.
Advanced project management experience.



License, Certification & Clearances




Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA), OR Healthcare Financial Management Association (HFMA) member preferred.
Act 34-PA Criminal Record Check from the PA State Police system




Supervisory Responsibilities




This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities, but does serve as a coach and mentor for other positions in the department.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work




Incumbent will be scheduled based on operational need (rotate shifts, standby, on-call, etc.).
Travel may be expected locally between Independence Health locations.



LEAN




Actively promotes a Lean work culture by performing team member duties to encourage consistent use of LEAN principles and processes, including continually seeking work process improvements. Recognizes the necessity of taking ownership of one’s own motivation, morale, performance and professional development. Strives for behavior consistent with being committed to Excela’s missions, vision and values.
