Job Details

Description

Job Summary

The Business Process Analyst is responsible for researching, analyzing, documenting, and recommending changes to the organization’s business processes to improve operational efficiencies, quality, service, and profitability. Lead process reengineering efforts, defining new process models that align with industry beset practices and organizational goals. This challenging role is a platform for career growth. It offers the successful candidate broad vision of the inner workings of a premier energy and industrial Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) company serving diverse markets and poised for substantial growth to meet the growing demands of the energy infrastructure.

Job Responsibilities:

Actively supports the Company’s commitment to safety, delivering the best, and its Core Values.
Represents the Company at all times with high moral standards while adhering to the Company’s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
Evaluates employee needs, internal workflows, and business processes. Conducts meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts to collect information/data regarding ineffective or inefficient processes.
Performs Root Cause Analysis on processes with issues requiring deeper evaluation using standard methodologies (e.g., 5-Why, Fishbone Diagram).
Collects and studies operational and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Creates flowcharts, process maps, and diagrams as a method of visualizing ongoing processes to detect internal inefficiencies within the scope of a given workflow. Analyzes business processes and workflows with the objective of finding out how they can be improved or automated.
Assesses business requirements and makes evidence-based recommendations to support process improvements. Draws inferences from process details and links these inferences to the big picture by considering business objectives in identifying process improvements.
Monitors detailed business analyses and collaborates with business and IT leaders to create and document new processes.
Designs and prepares documentation, training materials, and communications supporting new processes.
Interprets complex data and business metrics for relevant stakeholders.
Researches and conducts site observations to identify the equipment, methods, and personnel needed for effective processes.
Examines emerging business best practices and technological developments to automate and streamline processes to help the organization perform more efficiently.
Reviews and edits others’ process documentation for any function in the enterprise.
Performs other duties as required or assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, Management, or a related field, or equivalent combination of education/experience in lieu of a degree.
4+ years’ experience in process analysis and improvement, preferably in the Construction industry.
Ability to conduct and interpret quantitative and qualitative analyses.
Demonstrated proficiency creating process description tools such as flowcharts, work instructions, and procedures using tools such as Visio and Microsoft Office.
Demonstrated aptitude for information flow and interfaces between company functions in a digital environment.
Understanding of process modeling techniques and methodologies (e.g., BPMN, Lean, Six Sigma).
Ability to make an organizational assessment, identify and implement improvement opportunities.
Effective organizational and problem-solving skills utilizing empathy, patience, and persistence in achieving results without authority.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.
Ability to travel domestically between 10% and 20%.



In addition, full-time employees are offered a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, disability benefits, life and AD&D insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP), a 401(k) plan with company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), a robust wellness program and adoption assistance. Some employees may also be eligible for paid time off, tuition reimbursement and a performance or safety bonus program.

Description:

Position Summary:

The Business Development Analyst will be responsible for supporting Electrical & Industrial divisional staff in managing AD’s business development pipeline process for prospective members, competitive analysis, and target merger opportunities. The individual will be responsible for supporting divisional executives in evaluating the competitive landscape and identifying, tracking, and maintaining pipelines, dashboards and reports on new member prospects and possible mergers for AD.

Activities will include summary reports to senior management, centralizing the storage of competitive intelligence, participating in the development of and organizing business development and M&A collateral materials, triaging sales leads submitted via AD’s website, providing follow-up support throughout the sales process as needed, and ensuring a smooth transition of newly recruited members to divisional staff for new member onboarding.

In addition, the business development analyst will support outreach activities by the member engagement team for prospective members and manage the overall pipeline for each division.

This role will support all E&I divisional staff and work closely with the corporate business development team as needed.

Primary Responsibilities:

Conduct competitive landscape analysis and establish target pipeline across the Electrical & Industrial Business Unit.
Research, collect, and analyze data regarding prospective members.
Collaborate with divisional staff and corporate marketing to develop and maintain collateral used for prospective members and merger activities.
Continually improve and evaluate recruitment ideas, opportunities, data partnerships, and delivery of AD’s value prop to source new members.
Track targets / funnel and progress (such as questionnaires, proformas, etc.).
Design, build, maintain and update dashboards using AD’s CRM software tool and other pipeline tracking tools.
Effectively communicating the AD value prop via presentations, intro calls, and communicating regarding the scheduling of meetings, follow-up on action items and checking in on the decision progress by navigating long sales cycles; predominantly for small and medium targets.
Develop and deliver business development and potential Electrical & Industrial merger reports to Director of Corporate Development, divisional executives, and other senior managers, as needed.
Serve as the primary point of contact for any prospective new member web inquiries and/or leads. Utilize discretion and collaborate with the divisions in evaluating prospective members and their appropriate candidacy for membership to AD.
Centralize the storage and reporting of competitive intelligence. This includes comparing AD advantages and key selling points versus competitive buying groups.
Partner with Corporate marketing and divisional staff to develop and update sales presentations, prospect engagement campaigns, and provide information to staff such as slide decks, recruiting and merger collateral materials, etc.
Assist in the coordination of business development process best practice sharing across divisions.
Effectively leverage data to track key performance indicators, identify trends, and ensure business development projects align with company priorities.
Perform other related duties as requested.
Requirements:

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong organizational skills and attentive to detail
Comfortable with analyzing data and providing actionable insight to leadership
Sales-oriented and achievement motivated
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively present and share information to multiple levels throughout the organization
Ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently
Resourcefulness in solving problems
Excellent interpersonal, customer service and follow-up skills
Goal and results-oriented; Hands on results driven, self-starter
Collaborative team player that can work across multiple functional disciplines

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, Public Relations or some other relevant field
A minimum of 1-2 years of experience supporting a sales or commercial team
Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Experience using Salesforce or other CRM software tool

Additional Comments:

The position is based out of our corporate office in Wayne, PA, where we have a hybrid work schedule (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays in office with Mondays and Fridays remote); typical hours are 8:00a – 5:00p M-F
Occasional local and air travel estimated at 10% - 15%

The Operations team supports the entire FS family of funds providing trade support, derivative processing, shareholder accounting, security reconciliation and oversight, and counterparty and credit event management. The team works closely with internal and external stakeholders, including banks, sub-advisors, custodians, fund administrators and transfer agents to ensure accuracy and execution across daily trades, positions, cash, shareholder trade processing and corporate actions.

The Portfolio Operations Analyst will work within Investment Operations supporting Trading and Investment Management. Responsibilities include supporting trading operations via trade processing, confirmation, and settlement and supporting portfolio management via portfolio reconciliation and reporting.

The successful candidate is expected to:

Process transactions as directed by the trading desk.
Ensure correct setup of securities in the Security Master, working closely with the Data Management, COO, and Investment Management teams.
Confirm trades with counterparties.
Reconcile positions with custodians and fund administrators.
Provide oversight to outsource vendors across various Operations functions.
Maintain internal books and records and resolve breaks between internal systems and custodians and administrators.
Work with the technology teams on design, testing and implementation for different application modules and reporting solutions.
Review existing processes, identify, and recommend areas of improvement to reduce risk and improve efficiencies across the team.

Job Profile

Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success.

As a Business Systems Analyst Consultant within PNC's AMG Operations organization, you will have the opportunity to work remotely from home.

This is a remote position. Work may be performed from a quiet, confidential space in a home location, approved by PNC. This position may not be available in all geographic locations.

This role will be responsible for advancing large strategic initiatives and the ideal candidate will meet the following qualifications:


Salesforce experience and/or knowledge and understanding of CRM is a plus
Salesforce Configure/Price/Quote (CPQ) experience is a plus
Salesforce Admin Certification preferred, but not required.
Agile experience required
Exposure to Sales and Servicing functionality on a CRM platform is a plus.
Experience partnering with Business & IT to solicit requirements and implement business solutions into operations.
Demonstrates current business analysis methods using agile methodologies and strategies.
Prior experience preparing requirements, specifications, business processes required.
Prior experience with relational databases, data migrations & ETL jobs is a plus
Assist the agile crew Product Owner in defining, estimating, and prioritizing requirements
Assist building the Product Backlog, writing user stories, completing reviews and retrospectives.
Designs, prototypes, configures, and tests new or enhanced features on the Salesforce CRM platform
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, critical thinking, and the ability to own your area of responsibility with directional oversight.
Job Description

Provides solutions for IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities, planning and implementation of cross-functional applications.
Participates in identifying, evaluating, and configuring systems that are cost effective and meet business requirements .
Monitors client experiences and feedback on the use of business applications; Enhanced system productivity, as needed .
Provides senior level consulting services to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results .
Analyzes, defines and documents clients requirements, and revises existing systems logic challenges, as necessary .

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Business Assessment – Knowledge of the activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities; ability to assess the benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications.

Business Process Modeling – Knowledge of the activities, tasks, deliverables and techniques for documenting current business processes; ability to identify problems, opportunities, and re-engineering processes for improvement.

IT Environment – Knowledge of an organization's IT purposes, activities and standards; ability to create an effective IT environment for business operations.

IT Project Management – Knowledge of and the ability to plan, organize, monitor and control IT projects ensuring the utilization of technical resources to better achieve project objectives.

Requirements Analysis – Knowledge of methods and techniques to elicit, analyze and record required business functionality and non-functionality requirements; ability to analyze these requirements to ensure the success of a system or software development project.

Technical Writing/Documentation – Knowledge of the technical language and writing approach, and the ability to write paper-based and on-line technical reference documentation (guidelines, standards, procedures, processes, applications, etc.)

Workflow Analysis – Knowledge of and ability to manage IT work activities, processes and progress within a system to improve organizational efficiency and effectiveness.

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 3+ years of relevant / direct industry experience. Certifications are often desired. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education, job specific certification(s), and experience (including military service) may be considered.

Education

Bachelors

Position Overview:

The Sales Tax Analyst is responsible for managing and executing all aspects of sales tax compliance and research within our organization. This role involves ensuring the accurate calculation, reporting, and filing of sales tax across various jurisdictions, staying updated on tax laws and regulations, and assisting with tax audits. The Sales Tax Analyst plays a key role in minimizing tax liability through informed application of tax laws and regulations, and effective tax planning.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and file timely and accurate sales tax returns in multiple jurisdictions.
Review and reconcile sales tax accounts and ensure accurate general ledger entries.
Analyze and interpret sales data to calculate tax owed and ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Stay informed of changes in tax laws and regulations and assess their impact on the company's operations and tax compliance.
Collaborate with internal departments, such as finance and legal, to understand business practices and identify tax-related issues.
Assist in managing and responding to sales tax audits, including gathering and preparing necessary documents and data.
Research tax issues and provide guidance and recommendations on tax matters to internal stakeholders.
Develop and implement tax compliance policies and procedures to streamline processes and ensure accuracy.
Provide training and support to other staff members on sales tax issues and processes.
Work with external tax advisors and consultants as needed.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field; CPA or advanced degree in taxation is a plus.
2-4 years of experience in sales tax, tax compliance, or a related field.
Strong understanding of sales tax laws and regulations.
Proficiency in tax software and Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Capacity to manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Business Analysis and Insights
Job Description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

The role involves comprehensive analysis to ensure the accuracy of information through the creation, maintenance, and evaluation of data. This includes comparing data with third-party information, budgets, or actual results, researching risks or compliance concerns, and evaluating financial data, key performance indicators, and metrics. The position also entails the organization of data-driven analysis and insights to support business strategies. This involves serving as the analytics subject matter expert, reporting data-based insights consistently, and collaborating with internal and external partners to establish a cohesive strategy for utilizing data-driven insights. The job also includes providing customer service and reporting in the designated area of responsibility, supporting key business processes, and serving as an information resource.

Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Evaluation:

Create, maintain, and evaluate data.
Compare data with third-party information, budgets, or actual results.
Analyze and research risks or compliance concerns.
Utilize financial models, plans, and tools for analysis.

Business Strategy Support:

Evaluate ongoing analytical needs.
Serve as the analytics subject matter expert.
Report data-based insights uniformly.
Collaborate with internal and external partners for strategy development.

Customer Service and Reporting:

Provide reports and communicate results.
Support key business processes.
Serve as an information resource for stakeholders.
Resolve issues, answer questions, and provide documentation.

Efficiency and Compliance:

Establish timelines, workflows, and requirements.
Support and develop training.
Manage and verify functionality of key processes and controls.

Support for Customer Requests:

Utilize analytical tools for customer needs.
Extract and consolidate relevant data for reporting.
Analyze best delivery methods and identify root causes.

Values and Culture Champion:

Model Walmart values and foster a positive culture.
Uphold the highest standards of integrity, ethics, and compliance.
Act as an altruistic servant leader.

Embrace Change - Curiosity & Courage:

Demonstrate curiosity and a growth mindset.
Foster an environment supporting learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking.
Exhibit resilience in the face of setbacks.

Digital Transformation & Change:

Seek and implement continuous improvements.
Encourage the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.

Deliver for the Customer - Customer Focus:

Put the customer first in all plans.
Apply an omni-merchant mindset and EDLP/EDLC business models consistently.
Adopt a strategic thinking approach considering data, analytics, and customer insights.

Focus on our Associates - Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: - Identify, attract, and retain diverse and inclusive team members. - Build a high-performing team embracing diversity in all forms. - Support diversity goal programs actively.

Collaboration & Influence: - Build strong relationships with team members and business partners. - Work collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives. - Communicate with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action.

Talent Management: - Create discipline and focus around developing talent. - Promote an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work. - Empower associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company. - Regularly recognize others' contributions and accomplishments.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field OR 2 years' experience in data analytics, project management, business, or relevant area.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Analytics - Big Data, Data Analysis and Insights, Statistical Programming Language

Primary Location...

Company Overview

Envision Healthcare is a leading national medical group focused on delivering high-quality care to patients when and where they need it most. You’ll find clinicians and clinical support professionals across the nation who are proud to call Envision home. Summary

The RCM Business Analyst III role is to identify and formally document business requirements for existing and new business application initiatives. The Analyst III has a full understanding of business processes and the underlying business need filled by the process. The Analyst III demonstrates advanced skills and is recognized as a leader by peers and throughout the organization.

Responsibilities:

The Business Analyst role will be responsible for developing standardized reporting and quality assurance processes in support of operations related to recently passed medical billing legislation, As such, the work is high visibility and high impact, and will require partnering cross functionally across business, legal, and policy teams.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Management of CRM (Salesforce) to ensure data integrity.
Preparation and analysis of reports for use by legal counsel and in negotiations.
Development and management of quality assurance and data integrity.
Partnership with automation team to develop automated aspects of reporting and QA processes.
Support in ad hoc analysis as assigned.
Troubleshooting spreadsheets, including use of Excel functions such as lookups and pivot tables to manage data reporting and analysis needs.
Adherence to all company policies and procedures.


Non-Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Flexibility and adaptability to shifting priorities
Commitment to deadlines
Eagerness to meet or exceed established standards for productivity and quality
Willingness to learn new tools and skills
Strong attention to detail
Interest in Healthcare, Healthcare policy, analysis, and business
Strong written and oral communication skills
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Education/Experience

Bachelor's Degree from four-year College or University; STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) or business focus (Finance, Economics, or Business Degree) preferred
One or more years’ experience in an analytical position (healthcare, banking, accounting) preferred preferably in a role requiring some use of Excel.

Knowledge and Computer Skills

To perform this job successfully, the candidate should have knowledge of:

General proficiency in all Microsoft Office Products including but not limited to: Microsoft Teams, Word, PowerPoint
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including functions and pivots)
Familiarity with logical functions
Following skills are a big plus: Microsoft Powerquery, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft PowerAutomate
Willingness to learn and become proficient in other programs, e.g. Tableau, Billing system, Salesforce

If you are ready to join an exciting, progressive company and have a strong work ethic, join our team of experts! We offer a highly competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

Quality Assurance: Test Strategies & Methodologies, Test Planning, Functional & Automated Testing, Risk Based Testing, Defect Management

Utilizes technical guidance received from leaders and higher-level peers to address complex problems and projects.
Effectively communicates with customers, team members or other stakeholders to ensure successful outcomes.
Participates in the execution and implementation of solutions.

Every day, SIG participates in millions of trades on exchanges around the world. Our operations team manages the infrastructure that allows these trades to move forward with speed and accuracy. How do we aggregate and analyze trading data to help make better future decisions? How do we ensure that we correct any trade breaks that would expose the firm to financial risk? How do we constantly improve the efficiency with which we complete the lifecycle of a trade? This is where our Operations Analysts come in.

The six month Operations Analyst development program will prepare you for a full-time Operations Analyst position at SIG. Throughout the program, you will rotate across various trading desk and business areas at SIG to deepen your understanding of the firm. In addition to providing hands-on experience through daily responsibilities and project work, the program includes classroom training sessions focused on developing company specific knowledge and technical skills to facilitate process optimization. At the end of your rotations, you will be expected to leverage your diverse skill set and knowledge of SIG’s business to maximize your impact as an Operations Analyst. You will be placed on a team that best aligns with your skills, interests, and SIG’s business needs.

We look for people from a variety of backgrounds who have strong problem solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Some of our Operations Analysts come in with a passion for the financial markets, some come in with programming knowledge. All come in with a curiosity and desire to grow and have an impact on SIG’s business.

To learn more about the program and the role, visit https://www.sig.com/team/meet-operations-analyst-program/.

Summary:
The ERP Finance Business Analyst will assist with ERP strategy for Wabtec focusing on the financial ERP applications and integrations. The ERP strategy will include the migration of Wabtec business units to the common ERP application and the assessment to migrate to the ERP cloud application.
The position will work closely with the Finance and Supply Chain DevOps teams, ERP Program Management, Finance IT and the Supply Chain teams to develop short and long range strategic plans.
Duties and Responsibilities:
ERP on-premise strategy focusing on the Financial modules
Creation and maintenance of a 1 - 3-year migration schedule
Creation and maintaining of an ERP implementation approach
Provide scoping, module reviews and migration estimates for ERP site assessments
Assist with pillar application integrations
Maintain financial ERP migration documents and templates
ERP cloud strategy focusing on the Financial modules
Define a plan to move the on-premise instance to the cloud ERP application
Assess options to implement a hybrid on-premise and cloud solution
Assist with integration of financial pillar applications and the ERP cloud application
Maintain financial cloud ERP migration documents and templates
Other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications: (To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.)
Bachelor's degree in a related or equivalent experience
3-5 years of experience in Finance ERPs or in a related area.
Thorough knowledge of business processes and computerized business applications, especially Oracle Applications.
Must be able to travel as required.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Excellent verbal and written communication/language skills required to include the ability to provide written and verbal instructions, and compile and present information clearly.
Good interpersonal skills to work effectively as a team member.
Motivation to provide excellent internal and external customer service
Proven project planning and management experience.
Capable of planning and organizing work and processes; ability to self-direct multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Ability to analyze business situations and problems.
Analytical and reasoning ability for solving problems and good judgment for complex decision-making.
Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts.
Strong focus on Quality

The Krazy Coupon Lady (KCL) is a female-founder-owned publisher on a mission to help shoppers beat MSRP, unapologetically maximize their money, and seize the deal. Our team of shopping experts curates and hand-tests nearly a thousand deals per week, so there is always something new to discover each time you visit our website, app, and your inbox.

You may have noticed that our headquarters are in Boise, ID, but our workforce is fully remote in the following states: Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Indiana, Iowa, Minnesota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Virginia, or Wisconsin. All team-wide meetings are scheduled to be inclusive of U.S. time zones.

About the position.
As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will lead high-impact data projects. You have a passion for uncovering insights from data, excellent communication and collaboration skills, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality insights and analytics to support business operations. To be successful in this role, you must be able to distill learnings into key takeaways, and effectively communicate actionable insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

In this role, you will develop and nurture high-trust, interpersonal relationships with leaders and teams across the business. You enthusiastically initiate collaboration with stakeholders and data teams to solve problems, build new reporting solutions, and commit to delivering against high standards. In addition to utilizing KPIs, business performance data, industry trends, competitor intelligence, and customer information to provide reliable and actionable insights, you will work to proactively identify opportunities for growth and efficiency.

As a senior on the team, you hold yourself to a high standard and you help set the bar. You act as a bridge between non-technical teams and data, able to effectively understand business challenges and requirements. Given a nebulous project, you are able to appropriately scope it, find a solution, then execute. Working closely with stakeholders across KCL, you consistently deliver high-quality results, and you are seen as a leader and valuable contributor to major company initiatives.

This is a full-time remote position with a Monday-Friday work week.
Responsibilities Include:
Drive analytical support and insights to cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product development, and content. Perform routine and ad hoc analyses to inform business decisions, including developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations that effectively communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Develop reports, dashboards, and innovative solutions to effectively investigate trends, communicate key insights, and deliver recommendations to stakeholders.
Contribute to the development of and reporting on Key Performance Indicators for major company initiatives and departments
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all performance-based metrics and reporting by performing detailed data exploration and validation to identify trends, tendencies, and anomalies
Develop and iterate on processes for gathering, summarizing, and distributing relevant insights to business leaders and teams across the companyUtilize data analytics tools to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth
Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas for improvement and develop solutions to address key business challenges.
Ensure a positive end-user experience by building solutions to deliver consistent and easy access to data needed to inform day-to-day and broader strategic decisions; leverage our internal reporting tool, Looker, and educate stakeholders on how to use it
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, and share insights with the wider team.
Additional responsibilities as the department scales
About You:
Minimum 5+ years experience in business insights, data insights or related role
Understanding of dashboard design and data visualization best practices
Expert in both analytics and visualization tools; experience with Looker is a plus
Proficient in SQL; knowledge of Python and/or R is a plus
High-level proficiency in Google Sheets/Excel
Ability to maintain good documentation and record keeping
Strong technical chops, enthusiastic self-learner, and curious
Excellent project management and organizational skills; experience with Asana is a plus
Strong storyteller; exceptional communication and presentation skills
Ability to think critically; must be solutions-oriented with a passion for problem-solving
Proven experience in managing multiple projects
Exceptional attention to detail and an avid team player who enjoys working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Ability to prioritize, work cooperatively, and collaborate with cross-functional teams
Physical Requirements
Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
Hearing: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.
The worker is required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned
About KCL
With our roots in Boise, ID, we’ve grown into a remote company with employees located across the United States. We’re a team focused on hard work, humility, and transparency. We believe in the power of community and the magic of friendship that created KCL so, for us, everything we do is people-first.

Job Brief

Responsible for operationalizing policies and decisions that impact Enterprise Operations through New Business Implementation and RFP related activities.

Your career starts now. We’re looking for the next generation of health care leaders.

At AmeriHealth Caritas, we’re passionate about helping people get care, stay well and build healthy communities. As one of the nation's leaders in health care solutions, we offer our associates the opportunity to impact the lives of millions of people through our national footprint of products, services and award-winning programs. AmeriHealth Caritas is seeking talented, passionate individuals to join our team. Together we can build healthier communities. If you want to make a difference, we’d like to hear from you.

Headquartered in Newtown Square, AmeriHealth Caritas is a mission-driven organization with more than 30 years of experience. We deliver comprehensive, outcomes-driven care to those who need it most. We offer integrated managed care products, pharmaceutical benefit management and specialty pharmacy services, behavioral health services, and other administrative services. Discover more about us at www.amerihealthcaritas.com.

The Operations Business Process Analyst will be responsible for operationalizing policies and decisions that impact Enterprise Operations through New Business Implementation and RFP related activities. This includes, but is not limited to, processes that are created, transformed, or eliminated due to statutory changes, new business/acquisitions, or process improvement efforts.

Core function is to operationalize and manage new business-related activities and materials via policies and procedures including but not limited to the following:

Acts as an internal consultant addressing operational concerns and makes recommendations to streamline processes/campaigns while creating/updating the necessary documents and meeting information keeping quality and performance at the forefront
Track critical outstanding issues and facilitate resolution with all areas.
Track and report overall implementation activities including risk and roadblocks
Uses group and meeting facilitation skills to form consensus when effectively solving problems, and accomplishing tasks
Ensure all business requirements are translated to Business Requirement Document (BRD)
Identification and communication of initial Business requirements, SLAs, and Liquidated Damages to New Business Implementation leadership and functional areas
Establishes ongoing metric and information tracking to ensure successful process implementation
Supports testing and quality checks of requirements to prepare for Go Live
Understand the interconnectivity of task and communicate downstream impacts to stakeholders
Presents analysis, ideas and positions in writing in a clear and convincing manner
Maintain repository of standard RFP responses and program descriptions
Manage departmental SharePoint site
Provides NBI support to operations based on business needs.

Education/ Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in experience required
3+ years successful experience in a Process/Business Analyst role
5+ years experience in a Healthcare environment

Other Skills:

Claims knowledge preferred

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management.

Cardinal Health’s Information Security team is on a tremendous growth journey adding several new team members in our CyberOps, Resiliency, Security Architecture, and IT Risk and Compliance teams. We aim to be a world-class cybersecurity and risk management organization that enables Cardinal Health to be healthcare’s most trusted partner.

We currently have a career opening for an IT Business Analyst.

Responsibilities

Business Analysis is responsible for deeply understanding the business in multiple functional areas and across Business Units, as well as understanding the application landscape and capabilities. They maintain relationships with the business and leverage requirements engineering practices and methods to enable improved business processes to drive business success. They align business strategies and capability needs into business and technical requirements to ensure IT systems enable the desired value.

Leads sessions using variety of requirements gathering methods such as interviews, documentation analysis, surveys, site visits, business models with executives, managers, developers and subject matter experts.
Facilitates the team through the analysis of, and makes recommendations towards, complex business decisions.
Mediates across different IT teams utilizing knowledge of IT and roles and responsibilities within the organization.
Focuses on process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.
Demonstrates excellent listening, communication, and facilitation skills.
Knows and executes best practices for business analysis processes and functions (from an industry and strategic standpoint.
Defines requirements in accordance with SDP/SDLC, management and project/product scope. Ensures problem statements and objectives are clearly defined. Ensures requirements are aligned to project scope, objectives and strategies.

Qualifications

Proven experience as an IT Business Analyst in a corporate environment.
Experience gathering end user requirements and coordinating solutions with a technical team.
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products preferred.
Experience in creating application relevant reporting.

Accountabilities

Work closely with the business, IT and Security Teams.
Provide documentation for new Operational Technology Security applications, processes, and services.
Collaborate with the Security Architecture, OT Security, Network, and Enterprise Architecture teams.
Document Security Architecture standards and patterns into consumable playbooks to be leveraged by IT Solution Delivery teams.
Work to develop an Agile process or modified Waterfall for delivery of defects and enhancements.
Work with IT and Business teams to develop reporting on application performance, customer experience, issue trending, etc.…
Work from Home opportunity

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

PSECU, a high-tech progressive financial institution with more than $8 billion in assets, is seeking a Business Operations Analyst. This position drives change and operational effectiveness throughout Revenue Growth and Lending (RGL). Supports RGL operations through the use of business analysis, project management, and financial analysis.

Benefits: We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and a great work environment. Along with excellent medical and retirement programs and a generous leave package, our workplace offers tuition reimbursement.

Employee Type: Full-time, Exempt

Responsible for the coordination of application and system requirements for all new and existing lending systems and other applications and solutions related to RGL.
Responsible for testing and coordinating testing and production releases with operational areas. Aids in training associated with RGL Systems.
Compare RGL data and processes with industry standards and best practices for operational effectiveness throughout RGL. Disseminate information to operational managers and identify areas of business process improvement to inspire change throughout RGL.
Works with internal and external customers and IT to partner, develop, and analyze business intelligence needs. Provides input to business requirements for the design of solutions. Designs department-wide views and custom reports. May perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms.
Perform quality assurance of departmental work product to ensure adherence to PSECU and RGL policy and procedures by Member Service Representatives and systems, as necessary. Work with operational managers to document and eliminate any deficiencies found during the quality assurance process. Work with operational managers to correct issues from occurring in an ongoing basis.

Proficient with Business Intelligence software, workforce management software and SQL.

Job Description

Description

As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purpose-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge.

Constellation has been the leader in carbon-free energy production for more than a decade, and generates 50% more clean, carbon-free electricity than any other company in America. We're generating power 24/7 with the nation's largest emission-free nuclear energy fleet, providing enough clean energy to power 15 million homes. Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and power a successful career.

Constellation offers a wide range of benefits, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays and sick days; and much more.

Expected salary range of $88,200 to $98,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k).

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

Member of a product delivery team who supports the entire lifecycle of a product(s) and/or system(s). This includes supporting the core platform day to day operating needs, understanding new business needs, architecting, designing and developing solutions, ensuring quality through testing, release management and change management. Collaborate across teams as needed. Independence level: Works under the direction of a Manager or a Sr. Product Analyst.


PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES
Work with other product team members to determine how to achieve team goals through a clear understanding of business needs and expected outcomes (15%)
Deliver application and/or infrastructure solutions to meet expected business outcomes by; 1) assisting in planning work activities, 2) analyzing requirements, designing and building Software solutions, and 3) enhancing, maintaining or supporting existing products and processes to meet team goals and metrics (40%)
Support engagement with business partners and other stakeholders; manage scope and expectations with stakeholders (15%)
Implement continuous improvements associated with the platform to support effortless customer experiences (10%)
Develop and maintain technical capabilities within supporting discipline or function (including best practices) (10%)
Review estimates of specific solutions to ensure time, cost and design meets the needs of the business. (5%)
Participates in strategic product planning meetings for insight on risk, cost vs. benefit, impact (5%)

JOB SCOPE
Utilize understanding of customer's business needs to determine requirements
Applies technical expertise to plan, design, build or support required products and processes
Help other team members learn appropriate theories, practices and principles that relate to their skill set portfolio

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 2 - 5 years of experience in development or business analysis or product management or 6 - 9 years of relevant work experience.
Solid communications skills (written & verbal)
Ability to work with remote team members and/or stakeholders
Ability to build strong relationships with team members and business stakeholders
Solid knowledge of business practices and processes in (add business specific info).
Solid understanding of Agile
Solid problem-solving skills and analysis ability
Experience supporting small IT Projects or sub-teams
Maintain and enhance engagement with business and IT partners

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prosci ADKAR� certified
Agile experience and certifications

Description

You’re driven, resourceful, and above all else – remarkably smart.

In this role, you will support the analytics, insights, and reporting needs for the assigned Deployment Solutions client. As the Business Insights Analyst, you will act as a point person to create analyses that will enhance business insight generation. You will:

Consult with Syneos Deployment Solutions team leadership as well as Sales, Brand, Medical Affairs, Market Access, and Operational client contacts to understand product performance expectations and translate to analyses and tracking metrics primarily delivered in reports and dashboards
Work independently to suggest new analyses and reports on activities, trends, and projections regarding performance, efficiencies, and possible improvements
Communicate insights on targeting, alignments, field team leadership and external strategic partners
Clearly and succinctly communicate analytical findings and insights to clients and internal team members through visualization tools (e.g. PowerBI)

Essential Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative field (e.g., data science, statistics)
1+ years’ experience in the biopharmaceutical industry in commercial operations, market access, medical affairs, or analytics role
Proficiency in programming languages, e.g. SQL, Python, R
Experience across business intelligence tools such as PowerBI and advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Knowledgeable in Veeva and Salesforce.com CRM systems

The annual base salary for this position ranges from $105,000 to $115,000. Actual salary will vary based on various factors such as the candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. In addition, some positions may include eligibility to earn commissions/bonus based on company and / or individual performance.
At Syneos Health, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If your past experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply anyway. At times, we will consider transferable skills from previous roles. We also encourage you to join our Talent Network to stay connected to additional career opportunities.

Why Syneos Health? Here, the work is challenging, and the pace is exhilarating. By joining one of our commercial teams, you’re empowered to succeed with the support, resources, and autonomy that you need. The diversification and breadth of our new and existing partnerships create a multitude of career paths and employment opportunities. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major therapeutic areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. Join our game-changing, global company dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Experience the thrill of knowing that your everyday efforts are contributing to improving patients’ lives around the world.

Work Here Matters Everywhere | How are you inspired to change lives?

Syneos Health companies are affirmative action/equal opportunity employers (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)

Additionally, certain local governments or Syneos Health customers may have vaccine requirements that apply to some of our employees. These employees are required to submit proof of vaccination to Syneos Health and maintain compliance with these requirements.
At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which Our People can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality-of-life balance. The benefits for this position will include a competitive compensation package, Health benefits to include Medical, Dental and Vision, Company match 401k, flexible paid time off (PTO) and sick time. Because certain states and municipalities have regulated paid sick time requirements, eligibility for paid sick time may vary depending on where you work. Syneos Health complies with all applicable federal, state, and municipal paid sick time requirements.

Business Control Analyst (Core Operations)

Start something good. Empower your career.

Employee owners have made Cenlar the nation’s leading mortgage loan subservicer. Our unique culture is defined by our core values of respect, trust, integrity and care. A promote-from-within philosophy, and opportunities for continuous professional growth make Cenlar a great place to launch or boost your career. Consider this opportunity to join our team as a Business Control Analyst.

The Business Control Analyst (BCA) is responsible for supporting the Business Control Manager (BCM). This includes, but is not limited to, performing control tests as part of the RCSA process, working with their business partners to address ineffective controls and control gaps and working with the Issue Management team to address identified issues. This role also assists the BCM in their risk and control initiatives and are mentored for movement into a BCM position.

Responsibilities:

Assists BCM in the continuous monitoring of new issues, Quality Assurance, Quality Control, and Compliance testing to determine underlying control deficiencies/breakdowns
Ensures proactive identification of materialized issues
Works with BCM and Issue Management team to evaluate new issues to determine business response based on business risk appetite and Cenlar Issue Management guidelines
Assists, as needed, with the creation of remediation Management Action Plans (MAP) and MAP activities to address root cause of open issues or linkage to pre-existing MAPs when appropriate
Prepares and processes Risk Acceptance requests
Works with BCM and Issue Management team to ensure closed issues successfully passing AVT Validations and Sustainability. Demonstrates improved controls as a result of closed issues
Updates Cenlar’s risk system of record (ProcessUnity)
Identifies and escalates emerging risks
Assists the BCM to provide control design advice and change management in response to changes in business process, technology, or compliance requirements
Responds to Client requests (Client Audit Support/Client Management) in a timely manner
Supports the BCM with active engagement with internal/external risk stakeholders (Audit, Compliance, Regulatory Change Management, Enterprise Change Management, Issues Management, Oversight & Control, QA/QC, P&P, AVT)
Liaises with Cenlar’s Policies and Procedures (P&P) team to ensure risks and controls are appropriately reflected within procedures
Coordinates management responses into MAPs for submission to auditors and examiners
Liaises with testing partners (QA, QC, Compliance) to analyze root cause of testing results and suggest remediation activity
Liaises with Audit validation team to satisfy evidence requests for validating remediated issues. Coordinates business walkthroughs and any subsequent updates in Process Unity, as appropriate
Assists the BCM and Issue Management team as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, include but not limited to compliance and operational risk. Demonstrate consideration for Cenlar’s reputation as well as our clients, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards

Technology

Evaluates and performs testing of the design and operating effectiveness of Technology controls, updating the IT Business Control Manager and IT Business Control Director with progress and observations
Supports the IT Business Control Manager during Technology Risk and Control Self-Assessments including identifying, assessing and documenting risks and controls and completing testing
Supports the IT Business Control Manager in writing high quality risks and control descriptions as part of creating and editing the Technology risks and controls matrix
Supports the IT Business Control Manager in providing suggestions to management for actions to address Technology control issues
Recommends practical ways of improving the work the Technology business functions do and applying where appropriate

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of relevant mortgage servicing experience
Ability to demonstrate understanding of risk management and internal control principles, including what constitutes effective control design
Ability to analyze and provide a credible challenge of the effectiveness of risk management and internal controls within the Issues Management process
Effective communication skills, both oral and written, and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization
Process improvement and project management skills are a plus

Additional Requirements for Technology

Technology professional certification a plus (e.g., CISA, CRISC, CISM, CISSP)
IT auditing experience a plus
Understanding of IT process mapping preferred
Cloud security risk and control knowledge a plus

Total Rewards:

At Cenlar, you’ll receive an outstanding benefits package that includes paid medical, dental, and life insurance, 401(k), and tuition assistance as well as opportunities for training and professional advancement.

Cenlar is a drug-free workplace and an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer M/F/D/V/SO.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Agency requires the services of a Business Analyst staff augmentation consultant to assist the technical staff in gathering and documenting the system functional and system requirements for new development projects and enhancements to existing applications for agency and Pennsylvania Parole Board (PPB) users.

Agency IT utilizes both waterfall and agile project methodologies. As such, experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologies will be preferred.

Collects, analyzes, and documents business rules, processes, and legislation.
Leads business requirements gathering sessions with business and technical resources for complex system development projects.
Analyzes legislation or other business documentation (i.e. policies/procedures, RFPs, etc.) to determine necessary IT system changes or changes to business processes required to meet the objectives of an agency initiative.
Works with business users to develop and implement improved business processes for their application to an IT system in support of agency program policy.
Works with users to develop or enhance system requirements.
Prepares or reviews detailed functional specifications for complex IT systems development or enhancement projects to be used by developers for system coding.

Troubleshoots system, data, or process problems.

Works with development and database teams to identify opportunities for integration and correspondingly documents any necessary business rules.
Prepares mock-ups to provide visual aids for requirements gathering.

Performs related work as required.

Skills

Experience with writing use cases and requirements documents. Required 5 Years.
Experience with developing business requirements. Required 5 Years.
Experience with developing functional requirements. Required 5 Years.

Susquehanna International Group (SIG) has an opening for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join our compliance technology team in the Philadelphia office. The compliance technology team develops Surveillance, Monitoring and Reporting Tools for the compliance business community. This team is responsible for designing and developing tools for the oversight of SIG’s trading activities across all of our products, including options, equities, futures, fixed income, and many others.

In this role, you will be working with a team of developers, testers, and the compliance business community to develop same day surveillance and monitoring tools. You will also be working on systems that collect data from the many, varied trading systems at SIG, and tools that will allow our compliance users to access this data.

SIG business analysts are
Collaborators who are able to work with desk teams & to assess, understand, implement and provide guidance on requirements
Planners who organize and facilitate the development and implementation of projects; who manage back log deployment and understand a large scale production environment
Great communicators who effectively report on project status to all levels of staff and management regularly to increase project transparency for all participants and stakeholders
Take a holistic view of systems and understand how the hardware, networking, and middleware layers integrate with software components
Willing to assist with testing when required

What we're looking for

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Business Analysis role in IT environment with management of SDLC projects.
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline required or other related discipline
Knowledge of relational databases (such as Oracle, SQL, MySQL) and the ability write SQL queries required
Experience within trading companies or other financial institutions is a plus
Understanding of Big Data tools including Hive and Hadoop
Excellent communication (both oral and written) and organizational skills
Strong planning, estimation, and risk management skills
Knowledge of any scripting (python) or programming languages and/or Business Intelligence reporting tools (such as QlikView) a plus
Experience with agile and/or waterfall project management and software development methodologies
Experience working with project tracking systems required; experience with Jira preferred
Visa sponsorship for work authorization is not available for this position now or in the future.

About SIG
SIG is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.
‌
‌
What we do
We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.


SIG does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of SIG and no fee will be paid

Position Summary: DOH needs a Technical Business Analyst Technical Business Analyst with proven experience in implementing complex technical projects with a large user base (300+ users). Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential for this position. The primary objective of this engagement is to provide functional, operational, basic technical support, and first level triage of tickets raised by the program. Additionally, this resource will work with vendors and QA technical lead to plan and execute software releases for the OQA’s applications. Generally, the contractor will perform the following tasks: - Coordinate with stakeholder teams across business and technical units to provide support to all OQA’s applications. - Provides daily production support, conduct initial/first level triage of the tickets and issues reported by various teams. Coordinate with the OQA’S technical lead in resolving the issues. Additionally, redirect the tickets as appropriate to other teams, as necessary for the QA applications. - Act as a Functional SME for all QA applications. - Act as a release manager for the QA applications. This involves, coordinates application deployments/changes working with QA program and managers. Such changes include downloading the release software from the vendor location, versioning the changes, create tasks in Azure DevOps, work with HHSDC database and web teams to complete deployment. Also notifies the appropriate manager(s) when these actions are taken. - Works with ADA to create a plan, prepare responses to the change control board questionnaire, prepare CCB addendum for each migration to test and production environments. - Work with QA technical SME to plan, coordinate and collect business requirements for the legacy QA applications that require technology refresh. Work with the program and other stakeholders to plan platform migration, create test cases, conduct acceptance testing and support production deployment. - Understand the QA’s business so that the incoming tickets/requests can be prioritized and processed in the order they are received and according to the criticality/severity of the issue. - Review all deliverables submitted by the vendors, work with program and IT teams to plan testing/testing schedules, identify windows for code deployment during testing and coordinate production deployment. - Ability and proven experience in coordinating large scale technical implementations/upgrades across large teams consisting of 300 + users – such as and not limited to – server upgrades, server migrations, system software upgrades, custom software upgrades on both central servers and client desktops spanning across Commonwealth locations. - Maintain technical and user documentation relative to Information Technology requirements for QA applications as needed. - Work with ITM and ADA to create reminders, create HH IT Communication message for emergency and planned outages. - Proactively identify issues that could impact QA’s business and address them. - Identify risks, work with all stakeholders to identify mitigation strategy and address them. - Demonstrates effective communication abilities. - Basic understanding of Microsoft technology – such as - .NET Framework, ASP.NET, VB.NET, IIS, Oracle, SQL Server is required. - Work experience required in using, managing, and organizing work items, work item assignment, updating the Epics, User Stories, Tasks and Bugs in Azure DevOps. - Gain QA’s business knowledge quickly and frequently follows updates published in CMS Govt website. Gather details relevant/that could impact QA applications, work with concerned teams and stake holders to update the applications as per the CMS updates/guidelines. - Manages expectations of the program by providing timely feedback and status updates on work assignments. - Maintains and shares operational documentation in a consistent and organized manner. Skills and Experience: - 5+ Years: Functional, operational, basic technical support - 5+ Years: Production Support - 5+ Years: Release Management - 5+ Years: VB.Net, C#, Visual Basic, Classic ASP, .Net Framework versions and IIS - 5+ Years: Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL - Ability to triage and provide first level of technical support - Familiarization with software development methodologies including Agile Development, DevOps, Waterfall, and Rapid application development - Conduct and coordinate manual testing, ability to understand automated test scripts and have fundamental knowledge of automated testing

Function: Assists Portfolio Management activities within the Business Banking Portfolio, including reviewing and approving mortgage subordination requests, insurance claims checks and collateral release requests. Assists and supports the Business Banking Portfolio Managers.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Assists Portfolio Managers with Modification Requests:
Screens requests for completeness of required information. Request additional information as needed.
Maintains an accurate and current log of requests.
Performs due diligence and make modification decisions within lending authority limits (up to $350,000 Business Banking Lending Authority). Requests above the authority limits are presented to management for concurrence.
Follows through with logging, imaging, fee receipt, and response to the RM and other institutions.
Develops a thorough knowledge of the VOI process and assist the Business Banking Underwriting and Portfolio Management Teams with overflow VOI work, as needed. Spreads personal tax returns in Statement Analyzer and communicate results back to the underwriter
Responsible for Portfolio Management Activities to include:
Works directly with Retail Managers & Business Bankers to assist in the collection and updating and tracking the status of accounts within the Portfolio Management software. This includes credit facility renewals & extensions, delinquency and other account administration activities
Serves as Liaison between Retail Managers, Commercial Lenders and Resource Recovery Department in the approval, analysis, loan structuring and collections of Small Business loans.
Assists Business Banking Portfolio Management with monthly handling of Loan Status Change Form packets, ensuring that appropriate signatures are obtained, packets are scanned, logged, and sent to the appropriate parties. Validate the monthly Risk Rating Changes to the core and present validation for management signoff
Assists in research and testing projects for Business Banking Lending. Perform data entry and report findings to management
Acquires and maintains a thorough knowledge & understanding of all applicable lending laws, and S&T Bank’s Lending Policy to ensure compliance. Completes all assigned training in a timely manner.
Performs all additional duties as required.

Physical Demands

Operates a keypad device, electronic equipment, office equipment: 90% of the day. The primary parts of the body involved in performing these tasks are the fingers, thumb, hands, wrists, elbows, legs, lower and upper torso and feet. The job requires sitting 6 hours per day in a straight and leaning position. Walking is required one hour per day which is slow in speed. Requires the use of manual dexterity skills for typing and filing up to 60% of the business day. Specific vision requirements include close vision of 18”-20” for computer work. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Job Description
At WSFS Bank, we empower our Associates to grow their careers, guide our customers to secure their financial futures, and actively support our Communities so they can fully thrive. Careers with WSFS Bank offer an inclusive and supportive culture, competitive salaries, advancement opportunities, and more. We Stand For Service® is more than part of our name, it’s our mission and our purpose.
The Commercial Banking Business Intelligence Analyst will be the divisional owner of data and financial systems leveraged by Commercial Banking. The role will also be focused on business planning & analysis, financial reporting, and business case development. This includes assisting with the delivery of the annual financial plan, monthly and quarterly financial reporting, and decision support analysis. The role will collaborate with colleagues in Finance in understanding and communicating corporate and business performance, opportunities, and risks. The incumbent will discuss patterns/trends, root causes, and recommended actions resulting from data analysis and use tools such as Microsoft Teams, SQL, SharePoint, and Excel.
Job Responsibilities:
Primary responsibility is for performance management data, systems, and reporting.
Manage all data management functions for dashboards, reports, and trending for Commercial Banking Division
Leverage data visualization tools such as Power BI with multiple data sources to build impactful reports and trends for leadership
Understanding departments business initiatives and key assumptions and implement reports and dashboards to help track progress and trends
Draw on strengths of being detailed oriented, data driven, and organized to produce reports that enable the business to highlight progress, risks, and defects across systems and processes.
Build relationships with technology management, Finance, and Commercial leadership.
Collaborate as needed on the development of established group and individual performance goals and incentive plan criteria that drive behaviors to positively impact performance.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related business or technical or equivalent combination of education and experience
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a data, finance or reporting analyst. Prior financial service industry experience preferred.
Knowledge and hands-on experience building reports with various tools such as Tableau, Qlik, or Microsoft Power BI experience needed
Demonstrated understanding of major banking principles, processes, and technologies with experience with data reporting.
Proficient in Microsoft Office

Analyzes financial data and interprets trends to all levels within the organization in support of functional business objectives. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities to effectively deliver against expectations. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.

Partners with Finance peer groups to identify and facilitate opportunities to optimize business results.
Connects with Business Partners to develops a clear action plan to deliver against the team’s objectives.
Influences Business & Financial Performance. Identifies business risk and collaborates to identify mitigation strategies and solutions.

Participates in Workforce Planning Meetings to align on the people, financial, and strategic needs of the group. Work with leadership teams to plan and manage headcount, evaluate requisitions and offers of employment to support roadmap and operational plans.

Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.

Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.
