Vanguard’s Institutional Marketing team is looking for a Product Owner to lead the implementation and ongoing enhancements of our customer data and identity resolution platforms. The CDP/IDR Product Owner is responsible for optimizing the value and use of the Adobe Real Time CDP and IDR platforms by defining and prioritizing the features and functionality with our digital marketing, marketing technology and technical development teams. This position will also partner with a digital marketing team to enable omnichannel activations, analytics, personalization, retargeting, and remarketing strategies to position the organization for continued advancement of marketing effectiveness given the changing dynamic landscape of digital marketing.

A successful candidate will have marketing technology experience, will be results oriented and a creative problem solver who thrives on learning and team collaboration. This individual will lead the strategic vision and roadmap for a product or products within a specific business area, demonstrating a deep understanding of the product(s). Products may have enterprise-wide implications.

This role:

Build the overarching strategy and high-level plan for CDP and IDR implementation, ingestion from multiple data sources, customer profile synthetization into traits and audiences, journey orchestration and integration with downstream system in partnership with Marketing and IT.
Act as the Product Owner representing Vanguards Institutional marketing team for utilization of the customer data and identity resolution platforms. Maintain and prioritize a backlog of features for implementation.
Contribute to the creation of a robust segmentation and testing strategy aimed at personalizing the consumer experience (marketing teams will own the customer journey strategy and segmentation criteria).
Ensure the highest quality, performance, delivery, and availability standards are met. Manage multiple, concurrent initiatives in various phases of ideation, execution, or delivery.
Bring best practices and strategy for consumer data journey and overall orchestration by working with both internal resources, including the Marketing Technology Team, IT and outside professional services, as necessary, to execute omni channel use cases.
Work with Marketing Analysts, Data Engineering, Data Science and other cross functional teams to define requirements for data and analytics solutions.
Understand consumer privacy regulations like CCPA and work with legal, engineering and marketing teams to ensure that consent and permissions are updated in the platform when needed.
Regularly present and communicate findings to senior leadership in a clear and compelling way.

What it takes:

Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required.
Minimum of 3 years of related work experience including experience with multiple components of the marketing technology stack including personalization, segmentation, campaign and data orchestration, etc. is required. At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering
Experience leading the implementation and management of Adobe’s Real Time CDP, or similar platforms such as, Segment, Tealium, Amperity and SAP.
Expert in leading components of large scale, high volume, real-time customer centric applications and digital infrastructure.
Understanding of related technologies, such as data management platforms, data lakes, and marketing automation tools.
Curious and shows high level of comfort in situations of ambiguity.
Proven track record working with diverse cross-functional teams and vendors. Adept at guiding groups with divergent opinions towards a unifying decision, drawing upon data to ground decision making.
A structured problem solver who can use technical aptitude, cross functional communication skills and results focus to align a broad set of stakeholders on solutions.
Comfortable thinking big and connecting the dots to align our product direction with the strategic goals of our business.
Can communicate complex ideas clearly, regardless of audience.
Not afraid to take a deep dive into metrics and data, whether it’s to diagnose a problem, evaluate a solution or propose a new KPI. Should have experience using analytic tools and querying data tables with basic SQL.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Bachelor’s degree in related field.

Job Summary

Responsible for the day-to-day activities of the Value Recovery Business (Mobile and Materials). Responsible for a variety of programs involving business reengineering efforts that support our operations and customer experience. Works with a cross-functional team that encompasses representation from all divisions to understand current challenges. Works to define our current processes that support the Marketing, Provisioning, Customer Care and Technical Operations and to define the future state that will be enabled through technology. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

Job Description

Core Responsibilities

Manages the Day to Day Activities of the Value Recovery Business
Supports the Value Recovery Business for Mobile and Materials
Maintains and improves the E2E Reporting for the Value Recovery Business
Creates and maintains training documents for the Value Recovery Business
Leads analysis and design of existing and new business processes that span multiple areas of the organization, including Customer Operations, Sales Operations, Marketing, Training, Finance and Legal.
Develops scalable processes to support and benefit the Company's architecture vision.
Deconstructs technical concepts and metrics to facilitate process development.
Helps to define success metrics for each new system or process and establishes a plan to track, monitor and measure the success of those metrics.

Develops repeatable and thus scalable, plans and processes in order to speed time to market and improve operational efficiency.
Interacts closely with matrixed cross-functional teams (both field and corporate) in order to secure alignment.
Diagnoses, corrects and documents issues, risks and problems using Quality Assurance (QA) practices.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.

Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Job Title: Wholesale Operations Analyst

Department: Retail

Reports to: Business Development Manager

FLSA Status: Regular- Exempt

Location: Must live in PA / remote


Role Summary:

Reporting to the Wholesale Business Development Manager, the Wholesale Operations Analyst will serve as the lead between the sales and supply chain teams. This position will be responsible for all systems (primarily SAP and LeafTrade) that drive the ordering process for Trulieve wholesale brands in PA. The Wholesale Operations Analyst will also report on monthly sales data, lead customer delivery communication, and support the efforts of the wholesale analytics department. The wholesale organization is excited to add a team player that is prepared to dig into and continue to optimize the wholesale process in PA.


Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Lead the wholesale delivery function through SAP and LeafTrade
Act as the wholesale order/ delivery point person for supply chain/ logistics
Assembling and communicating the weekly customer order menu -available products/pricing with applicable selling notes, and agreed-to promotional pricing
Attendance and participation in weekly supply chain/ logistics meetings to provide insight into customer experiences (good/opportunistic), shipping performance and future shipping forecast
Assessing business conditions, evaluating business needs, and taking action to address near-term opportunities to improve delivery service and enhance wholesale operational results
Allocation of warehouse stock to wholesale orders to ensure availability for shipping
Providing agreed to customer discounts to pertinent orders
Ensuring everyday pricing accuracy
Effective and efficient customer communication
Liaising with customers to arrange collection, agree on delivery, resolve delivery and/ or invoice issues
Reconciliation of approved customer product returns


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with wholesale operation/ logistics and retail distribution processes
Experience with SAP inventory management and order placement
A high level of organizational skill with the ability to multi-task and see activities through to completion to a high standard
Attention to detail and capable of reacting flexibly to different requirements for multiple accounts
Expert Excel and PowerPoint skills; must be competent in managing and manipulation large complex data sets
A strong team player, capable of working with others to get the job done and willing to step outside core role to help the broader team
High energy and sense of urgency
Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to establish strong relationships with cross-functional teams at all levels
Bachelors degree. • 5+ years’ relatable experience
Must possess a valid driver’s license and a clear driving record
Must be able to pass a level 1 and level 2 background check and drug screening




ADDITIONAL MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Must be able to move intermittently throughout the workday.
Must be able to see and hear or use prosthetics that will enable these senses to function adequately to ensure requirements of this position can be fully met.
Due to the nature of our business, it is advocated that when representing Trulieve that our professionalism meets the needs of the medical patient base that we respectively serve.
To uniformly align with the organization, an individual must be able to provide a level of communication that aligns respectively with the diversification of our patients which may exhibit opportunities to assess the situation and apply meaningful service.
In addition, must be able to quickly identify and insert additional support where needed to deescalate situations without compromising Trulieve’s objective in serving our patient base with excellent customer service.
Must be able to push, pull, move, and/or lift a minimum of 25 pounds to a minimum height of 5 feet and be able to push, pull, move, and/or carry such weight a minimum distance of 50 feet, with or without mechanical assistance.


WORK SCHEDULE:

45+ hours weekly with flexible hours depending on store needs. Must be available to work occasional evenings, weekends and holidays.




Equal Opportunity Employer l Trulieve Supports a Drug Free Workplace

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency situation should arise.

Are you a dedicated IT (Information Technology) professional ready to move forward with your career? The Department of Military & Veterans Affairs is seeking an Information Technology Executive 2 to manage the agency's IT department. This position will give you the opportunity to lead staff in multiple IT disciplines such as applications development, telecommunications, and network security and coordinate with the agency's federal IT department.

Elevate your career with the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and watch your professional journey soar. Apply today!

Watch this video to see how you can make a difference caring for Pennsylvania's veterans working for the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs. Come join the DMVA team, apply today!



DESCRIPTION OF WORK

As an Information Technology Executive 2, you will have the responsibility for the direction and oversight of DMVA's information technology program for headquarters offices and six veterans' homes. You will directly supervise the IT Customer Support Division, their Infrastructure and Operations Division and the IT Applications Development Division. You will also coordinate with the Commonwealth's Office for Information Technology and the federal office of the Deputy Chief of Staff for Information Management to ensure that the state and federal entities are working together in order to develop department-wide computing strategies to accomplish DMVA's overall automation objectives.

Interested in learning more? Additional details regarding this position can be found in the position description.

Full-time employment, 37.5-hours per week.
Work hours are 8:15 am to 4:30 pm, Monday - Friday, with 45-minute lunch.
Telework: This position is not eligible for telework.
Salary: In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.
Must pass a favorable National Crime Information Center (NCIC) screening for admittance to Fort Indiantown Gap. Must maintain an Automated Installation Entry (AIE) card once it is issued.

Eleven years of professional information technology experience; or

Four or more years of consulting or technical expert professional management experience.
Professional leadership experience directing project management, policy standard development, strategic planning and/or business analysis in IT services.
Professional management experience identifying software and hardware to support a project that includes applications, servers, network, cloud, and software licenses.

Shop Vac USA, LLC, located in Williamsport, PA, is recruiting for a driven Sales Analyst to join our team. Shop Vac USA is home to the Shop Vac brand and the world’s leader in heavy-duty wet dry vacuums for consumer, commercial and industrial applications, and pioneered the first in vehicle vacuum system. Best know for its wet/dry vacs, Shop Vac manufactures motors, fans, blowers, trash cans and mop buckets as well as manufacturing the SK brand of tools. Shop Vac, USA, LLC is a wholly owned subsidiary of GreatStar Tools USA, whose other operating companies include Arrow Fastener Co., LLC and Prime-Line Products.




REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: The Sales Analyst will report directly to the VP and/or Director of Sales of the Shop Vac USA business.




ABOUT THE ROLE: This role provides the Sales team with real time data and analysis to drive sales and capture market share, in addition to collaborating with cross functional groups to help support the forecast process, pricing and new product development.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:




Compile and analyze data over time to forecast sales trends.

Support sales team with Customer POS data analysis.

Collaborate with team members and cross functional groups inside and outside the organization.

Interact with various customers to understand their systems and data.

Prepare accurate reports on a regular basis.

Evaluate third-party data to determine best practices for company success.

Present actionable information and insight to team members and management.

Onboard new ways of working and tools to improve our collective ability to develop business insights.

Understand the sales process and how it integrates with other business functions.

Stay up to date on industry trends and best practices.

Maintain knowledge of company products and services.

Analyze data to find trends and patterns that can help improve sales.




THIS SHOULD DESCRIBE YOU:




Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Marketing or commensurate of equivalent experience and education.

1+ years (or prior internship/co-op experience) in an analytical role

Strong knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, databases and presentation software.

Advances problem solving and analysis skills.

Excellent oral and written communication skills a must.

High level of organization and detail oriented.

Must possess a strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative.

Multitasking, prioritizing and excellent time management skills are required.

Job Title: Business/Quality Analyst, Pennsylvania Commission on Sentencing, College of the Liberal Arts
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION AND POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

The Pennsylvania Commission on Sentencing (PCS) seeks applicants for a Business/Quality Analyst for its Applications and Information Technology unit.

PCS is a legislative service agency affiliated with the Penn State Department of Sociology and Criminology in the College of Liberal Arts. The Applications and Information Technology unit is responsible for enhancing and managing the custom-developed Sentencing Guidelines web application (SGS Web). SGS Web is used by courts of records to calculate Sentencing and Resentencing Guidelines and to report sentences imposed.

The Business/Quality Analyst position will be primarily responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements for system enhancements, testing to ensure requirements have been satisfied and the application is functioning properly, and investigating system issues reported by users.

This position will play a key role in an initiative to reengineer SGS Web, which will include building new functionality to support PCS’s expanding mandates. The reengineering of the SGS Web application is expected to take several years; after the initial rollout, this position will continue to support enhancements and modifications to the application. The Business/Quality Analyst position will also support other information technology projects for PCS as needed.



Primary Responsibilities:

Gather business and system requirements for application software initiatives to support legislative mandates, modernize technology, and deliver advanced capabilities for PCS.

Author specifications used by developers for implementation of system modifications, enhancements, and new application modules.

Analyze and document new or current system processes and workflows.

Create diagrams, workflow maps, wireframes, or other visuals to clarify system requirements and enhance system understanding.

Develop test plans and test scripts, as well as other quality assurance measures.

Execute testing to verify application programming accurately reflects guidelines and related statutes, functional requirements have been satisfied, and desired results have been achieved.

Coordinate testing efforts such as user acceptance, performance, security, and usability.

Participate in the implementation of new features, application updates, and system patches by verifying functionality in application after deployments.

Investigate system issues reported by users and PCS staff.

Assist with devising and implementing workarounds when system issues affect operations or when resources are limited.

Collect user feedback regarding system functionality and performance, and work with the unit to prioritize modification requests.

Benefits for full-time employees at Penn State include (visit https://hr.psu.edu/benefits for more detailed information):

Medical, dental, vision, and retirement plans.

75% tuition discounts (including for a spouse and dependent children up to the age of 26).

Generous vacation and sick time.

15 paid holidays/campus closure days.



Education and Experience:
This position will be filled as a Business Systems Analyst level 3 or 4, depending upon the successful candidate’s competencies, education, and experience. A level 3 typically requires a Bachelor’s degree or higher and four years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Additional experience and/or education and competencies are required for higher level jobs.

Other Required Qualifications:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Demonstrated ability to convey complex technical information to non-technical users and to those in executive roles.

Expertise in developing software requirements specifications and functional test cases.

Extensive process, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Able to effectively handle multiple projects or tasks.

Proficiency in relational databases and SQL will be considered a plus, as will knowledge of the Pennsylvania criminal justice system.

In addition, successful candidates must either have demonstrated a commitment to building an inclusive, equitable, and diverse campus community, or describe one or more ways they would envision doing so, given the opportunity.

Application Instructions:
Both a cover letter and resume must be submitted to be considered for the position.

Additional Information:
PCS has two offices, located in State College and Harrisburg. This position will be based at the State College office.



The College of the Liberal Arts and PCS are supportive of flexible work arrangements when aligned with the ability to meet the needs of the unit and the essential duties of the position. Questions related to flexible work should be directed to the hiring manager during the interview process.

PCS is externally funded by state appropriations. This is a limited-term appointment through the University, funded for one year from the date of hire with an excellent possibility of re-funding.

Penn State is committed to and accountable for advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in all of its forms. We embrace individual uniqueness, foster a culture of inclusion that supports both broad and specific diversity initiatives, leverage the educational and institutional benefits of diversity, and engage all individuals to help them thrive. We value inclusion as a core strength and an essential element of our public service mission.

CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS:

Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and the Pennsylvania Act of 1988, Penn State publishes a combined Annual Security and Annual Fire Safety Report (ASR). The ASR includes crime statistics and institutional policies concerning campus security, such as those concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. The ASR is available for review here .

Employment with the University will require successful completion of background check(s) in accordance with University policies.

EEO IS THE LAW

Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact 814-865-1473.

Job Title: Advanced Business Analyst - Any FE location
Job Description:
FirstEnergy at a Glance



We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.



FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to integrity, safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,000 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of more than 3,500 megawatts.



About the Opportunity

This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Co., a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [FEU]



Work location will be determined based on business needs and the selected candidate.


The Business Analyst position in Transmission Portfolio Management is responsible for the creation of project master data in SAP (work orders and WBS's) as requested from Transmission Portfolio Development or other business entities. This requires an in-depth understanding of FERC accounting, SAP cost flows, the concepts of: FE Operating Companies, Distribution vs. Transmission, Lines vs. Substations, capital vs removal vs. O&M, and the ability to determine asset ownership. The position also requires an understanding of various systems (SAP, PowerPlan, CREWS, Cascade, OPPM, etc.) to determine the correct attributes. The position will work closely with the FET Forecasting group in support of project forecasting and budgeting. This position also supports the Transmission Project Managers with project accounting and participates in accounting related activities such as determining CIAC, developing journal entries, and project close-out.


Responsibilities include:

Demonstrate commitment to the FirstEnergy Core Values and Behaviors
Ensure the accounting compliance of Transmission cost collectors
Create Transmission project WBS's and work orders in SAP
Determine correct asset ownership and incorporate in the development of the project accounting
Determine correct project accounting settlement rules relating to Operating Companies, Voltage, Capital, Removal, O&M of project accounting
Support the FET forecasting group with project accounting issues, CIAC (make the necessary system entries to ensure accurate posting), and create journal entries as needed
Support the Transmission Portfolio Development and Emerging Technology groups by creating project WBS's and work orders in SAP for projects approved in the Transmission Portfolio
Ensure that the correct WBS's and work orders are mapped to the appropriate project RPA
Run master data queries; ensure the integrity of the MasterData in SAP and PowerPlant is accurate; make the necessary modifications as required
Support ad hoc research of WBS's and work orders
Collaborate with the Transmission Business Services Group
Support of storm activities
Travel may be required at times across the FirstEnergy system


Qualifications include:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline preferred. In lieu of degree, minimum 4 years relevant work experience will be required. Relevant work experience may include financial analysis, accounting, financial reporting.
Excellent interpersonal skills, strong written and verbal communication skills
Utility accounting experience preferred
Proficient with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access
Demonstrated working knowledge of FE specific systems such as SAP, PowerPlan, CREWS,OPPM, Transmission GIS, Toad Data Point, UI Planner is preferred
Knowledge of FERC accounting is preferred


Benefits, Compensation & Workforce Diversity

At FirstEnergy, employees are key to our success. We depend on their talents to meet the challenges of our changing business environment. We are committed to rewarding individual and team efforts through our total rewards philosophy which includes competitive pay plus incentive compensation, a company-sponsored pension plan, 401(k) savings plan with matching employer contribution, a choice of medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, and life insurance programs, as well as skills development training with tuition reimbursement. Please visit our website at www.firstenergycorp.com to learn more about all of our employee rewards programs. FirstEnergy proudly supports workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract. Unable to sponsor or transfer H-1B visas at this time.

Safety

Safety is a core value for FirstEnergy and is essential to all of our business activities. We ensure employees have the tools, information, and processes to perform their duties in a manner that assures safety for themselves, their co-workers, our customers and the public. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace, and to promote and maintain public safety. To meet these goals, we dedicate ourselves to achieving world-class safety standards.

Job Title: Supervisor, Clinical Business Program Analyst - Remote
Job Description:
Your career starts now. We’re looking for the next generation of health care leaders.

At AmeriHealth Caritas, we’re passionate about helping people get care, stay well and build healthy communities. As one of the nation's leaders in health care solutions, we offer our associates the opportunity to impact the lives of millions of people through our national footprint of products, services and award-winning programs. AmeriHealth Caritas is seeking talented, passionate individuals to join our team. Together we can build healthier communities. If you want to make a difference, we’d like to hear from you.

Headquartered in Newtown Square, AmeriHealth Caritas is a mission-driven organization with more than 30 years of experience. We deliver comprehensive, outcomes-driven care to those who need it most. We offer integrated managed care products, pharmaceutical benefit management and specialty pharmacy services, behavioral health services, and other administrative services. Discover more about us at www.amerihealthcaritas.com.

PerformRx is a Pharmacy Benefits Manager (PBM) dedicated to clinical culture, boutique service and holistic solutions. Our mission is to help clients, providers and members use effective medication therapy to improve health and wellness. For over two decades, our focus has been on providing optimal service through a clinical culture which seeks to provide members with high quality care while ensuring our partners receive favorable costs. That culture is reflected in our employees — more than 80 percent of our staff members are Pharmacists and Pharmacy Technicians — and in the services we provide.

PerformRx is headquartered in Philadelphia. Our dedication to innovation and to providing the most efficacious outcomes is the core of our clinical culture and is the heart of PerformRx. PerformRx is a subsidiary of the AmeriHealth Caritas Family of Companies.

Responsibilities:

Report to Manager, Clinical Business & Programs Analytics
Supervise the Clinical Business & Programs Analyst team responsible on the management of the Prior Authorization application including all projects and assignments related to all topics below
Supervise Analyst Team responsible for development and maintenance of ePA question sets and decision assessments which includes the overall management of data collection and clinical criteria-based question set protocols used to help facilitate the Prior Authorization and Coverage Determination request review process. Protocols include provider facing and internal question sets. Responsibilities include: protocol (Decision Assessment) creation and maintenance, discussions and reviews with clinical staff including Pharmacists and Pharmacy Technicians, research in data and industry trends to identify new protocols or updates, and routine auditing of protocols, their outcomes, and their use
Support the Clinical Business & Programs Manager in leading Analyst team members on tasks and facilitating direction of projects and assignments related to all topics below.
Manage and audit vendor relationships involving: software coding and development, pharmacy and medical claims processing, Electronic Prior Authorization (ePA), printing/mailing, translation services, automated phone call services, telephonic systems, and inbound/outbound fax services.
Key decision maker on determining direction on actions and assignments associated with Clinical Business & Programs Analyst team tasks, including needing to adjust current direction or take on additional responsibilities.
Audit assigned tasks and projects for Clinical Business & Programs Analyst team members within their vertical, to ensure that they are completed timely and accurately
Facilitate escalations to fellow Prior Authorization Management team members, other department management teams, and vendors when necessary to complete tasks and projects involving Clinical Business & Programs Analyst team
Management of Prior Authorization/Coverage Determination software including:

Identify and develop new enhancements and system functionality updates, and oversee the testing and production deployment for Prior Authorization/Coverage Determination application based upon Federal and/or State requirements, customer requirements, or areas of efficiency gains
Identify and troubleshoot application defects
Oversight of application user accounts
Management of outbound communications to members, prescribers, and pharmacies
Subject-Matter Expert (SME) in Pharmacy Authorizations including their functions and proper usage in Pharmacy Claims Processing systems
Full audit participation including universe generation and preparation, case file creation, live audit participation, and staying up to date with industry/regulatory body requirements
Gather, summarize, and present data in meaningful ways using appropriate software applications and disseminate to appropriate areas, including: Federal and State agencies, and AmeriHealth Caritas and PerformRx customers
Develop staffing models for yearly budgeting purposes for the Prior Authorization Department, generate the supporting productivity data for both Technician and Pharmacist staffing requirements
Design, run, prepare, and audit ad hoc and standard reports for Clinical Services, involving but not limited to: Prior Authorization (Pharmacy and Medical), Coverage Determination and Redeterminations, Finance, Formulary Management, Clinical Outcomes and Therapeutic Optimization, Informatics, Specialty Pharmacies, Opioid Management, Hemophilia, Hepatitis C, and High Cost medications
Overall management of and involvement in various projects including project plan creation and tracking. Work with various stakeholders, including AmeriHealth Caritas Family of Companies, management and fellow Analyst team members, other departments, application developers, and various AmeriHealth Caritas and PerformRx vendors
Overall management of the departmental reference and help sites (SharePoint) including its maintenance, assurance of interactive files, and user database for the main site and sub-sites
Track accomplishments and delays in operational productivity improvements within Clinical Services
Build and develop required Access databases, including tracking and analysis through queries, reports and data mining
Summarize the data as specified to meet requirements; set up information in Excel and validate results
Cooperate with others to achieve departmental goals, interdepartmental relations and public relations
Attend required training on an annual basis
Project an image of professionalism in appearance and conduct.
Maintain confidentiality of all documents and conversations, respecting the dignity and privacy of all members, providers, and employees
Perform other job related duties and projects as assigned

Education/Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent required
Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare and/or Technology preferred and/or equivalent experience
Current National Pharmacy Technician Certification (NHA or PTCB) or ability to obtain one within first 12 months of employment required
Minimum three (3) years current/recent experience of application management including enhancement requirement writing, regression testing, debugging, production deployments required
Current/recent experience in creating Microsoft Office suite, specializing in Excel, Access, Project required; Visio preferred
Current/recent experience in using Tableau reporting including report creation and data analysis required

The Independent Advisor Solutions has an opening for a Business Intelligence Specialist. This individual will be responsible for leading and assisting in projects that propel our business forward through a data driven approach. This individual will work closely with our Salesforce product manager and our lead data strategist to develop and deploy analytical frameworks that create valuable business insights for our executive leaders and partners across sales, technology, and service.

What you’ll do:
Quickly develop a working knowledge of our data infrastructure and existing technologies
Gather business intelligence from a variety of sources including company data, industry reports, and public information
Identify, organize, and report analytical insights derived from various data sets that support actionable recommendations
Build and maintain executive level dashboards leveraging data visualizations tools such as Power BI
Support our Salesforce Product Manager; collect input from stakeholders, organize feedback and requests, and generate product ideas that inform overall product strategy and enhancements
Work closely with our technical team to monitor development progress. Test and validate the user experience as our user acceptance testing lead
Support sales and service colleagues by managing inbound requests, issues, and questions

What you bring to the table:
BA/BS degree in related field; or the equivalent in education and work experience
A minimum of 2 years industry related experience
Experience using statistical methodologies to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets
Familiarity with SQL and Python, or willingness to learn
Proven ability to manage multiple agendas and achieve results
Experience in administering Microsoft Power BI solutions
Interest in product management

Attributes we value:
Positive attitude and intellectual curiosity
Problem solving
Organizational and analytical skills
Commitment to continuous learning and development

SEI’s competitive advantage:
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive care for your physical and mental well-being, a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, a hybrid working environment for most roles, support for working parents and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Benefits include healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription, wellness, EAP, FSA), life and disability insurance (premiums paid for base coverage), 401(k) match, education assistance, commuter benefits, up to 11 paid holidays/year, 21 days PTO/year pro-rated for new hires which increases over time, paid parental leave, back-up childcare arrangements, paid volunteer days, a discounted stock purchase plan, investment options, access to thriving employee networks and more.

We are a technology and asset management company delivering on our promise of building brave futures (SM)—for our clients, our communities, and ourselves. Come build your brave future at SEI.

SEI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and so much more…

After over 50 years in business, SEI remains a leading global provider of investment processing, investment management, and investment operations solutions. Reflecting our experience within financial services and financial technology our offices encompass an open floor plan and numerous art installations designed to encourage innovation and creativity in our workforce. We recognize that our people are our most valuable asset and that a healthy, happy, and motivated workforce is key to our continued growth. At SEI, we’re (literally) invested in your success. We offer our employees paid parental leave, back-up childcare arrangements, paid volunteer days, education assistance and access to thriving employee networks.

SEI is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title




Sales Audit Analyst




Reports to




Sales Audit Supervisor




Supervises




N/A




Overview




The Sales Audit Analyst is responsible for daily auditing of store transactions for all brands. Also responsible for the verification of electronic payment types: Cash, credit cards, gift cards, merchandise credits, etc. Responsible for succinct communication with stores and all related internal departments to help maintain a high level of customer care. The main goal of the analyst is to correctly complete all daily tasks in order for the monthly sales journal to be closed and posted and bank reconciliation completed by book cut off timeframe.




Our Company




URBN’s parent company, Urban Outfitters, Inc. (www.URBN.com) is an innovative specialty retailer which offers a variety of lifestyle merchandise to highly defined customer niches through brands including Urban Outfitters, Anthropologie, Free People, Terrain, and BHLDN. Urban Outfitters, Inc., is both a Fortune 1000 and S&P 500 ranked company with $3.3 Billion in revenues.




Responsibilities



Responsible for the analysis of financial transactions; especially receipt and overages/shortages as reported by retail stores, including trending, corrections, and reporting to field and internal management
Complete daily cash reconciliation from the cash sweep and credit card settlement process, and ensure all entries are accounted for and added to the monthly reconciliation process.
Works with Sales Audit Supervisor to ensure daily reviews are completed accurately and timely
Partners with the Brand Operations and Loss Prevention groups to ensure store procedures are clear and up to date relative to transactions, special receipts, and overages/shortages
Administers the store audit process by working with Brand Operations and other internal departments to ensure compliance expectations and consequences are established and met
Recommends new reporting to accommodate changes in the business environment and/or requests from internal or external departments. Performs other ad hoc reporting as requested.
Assists and provides support to Sales Audit Supervisor and team in any major initiatives impacting Sales Audit. Supports the monthly calendar sales close process and assists by completing duties in a timely manner.





Qualifications



Prior retail experience equivalent to 3-4 years
Intermediate Microsoft Office knowledge including Microsoft Excel
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze data in an organized and clear fashion
Multi-Currency experience a plus
Accurate bookkeeping skills
Capable of navigating through financial systems, ReconNet Reconciliation system a plus
Able to work with high degree of accuracy, integrity, and accountability
Excellent and efficient written and verbal communication skills with upper management and external customers
Skillful at identifying and reporting potential issues and/or opportunities
Solid organizational skills
Proven problem-solving skills
Self-motivated
Team oriented
Ability to adapt quickly in a fast paced, ever changing retail environment





Education




Bachelors degree or equivalent job experience




Location




Hybrid / Philadelphia, PA




Travel




No Travel Required




Urban Outfitters, Inc. celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. To ensure compliance with our non-discrimination and anti-harassment policies, we offer anti-harassment training to managers and employees.

Janney is an award-winning full-service financial services firm committed to understanding our clients' needs and providing advice beyond investments. We are equally committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture where employees can use their talents to thrive and grow professionally with the firm.

Janney Montgomery Scott’s Investment Banking team is seeking a full-time candidate, for a first year Analyst position, who have demonstrated professional, academic and extracurricular achievement and possess strong quantitative, analytical and interpersonal skills.

Analysts serve as key members of merger and acquisition and capital raising transaction teams, drafting information memoranda, developing management and investor presentations, and participating in the transaction process from start to finish. Analysts also create and analyze financial models, develop client presentations, and conduct industry research.

Analysts will be expected to:

Prepare marketing documents, pitch materials, confidential information memoranda, board presentations, management presentations, etc.
Create valuation analyses, including comparable companies, comparable transactions, discounted cash flows, etc.
Conduct financial and company due diligence and industry research
Support senior bankers in their relationship management responsibilities
Work in a hybrid environment, coming to the office at least four (4) days a week
What you have:

Ability to work beyond a full-time (37.5 hours/week) work schedule
Minimum cumulative GPA requirement of 3.2
0-2 years as a business analyst or related experience in the brokerage industry
Skills:

Strong finance and accounting skills
Exceptional research, analytical and quantitative reasoning skills
Self-starter with a high level of initiative and motivation
Ability to work in a self-directed manner in a project or deadline-driven environment
Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain relationships at all organizational levels

Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and initiatives while maintaining a strong sense of urgency
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated leadership and/or participation in extracurricular activities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with Visual Basic, Bloomberg or Capital IQ preferred
Desire for a career in the financial services industry
Ability to collaborate and work effectively with diverse team members
Strong written and verbal communication skills
High level of initiative, motivation, attention to detail, positive attitude, and the ability to work in a project or deadline-driven environment
Strong quantitative, analytical, and interpersonal skills
Required Experience:

Undergraduate degree; Finance & Accounting preferred but other majors will be considered
Relevant previous financial, accounting or valuation internship experience preferred
History of outstanding academic and extracurricular achievement
Why work for us?
Benefits: Janney believes that its employees are the key to what makes a great company. Although work makes up a large portion of an employee’s life, we believe that a balance between work and non-work activities is essential to maintain quality performance and a positive work atmosphere. We offer a competitive package including Paid Paternal Leave, generous Paid Time Off, eligibility for a $2,000 referral bonus and Professional Development Assistance Plan designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future. Job Title: Line of Business Operational Risk Analyst
Job Description:
The Line of Business (LOB) Operational Risk Analyst is responsible for the identification, assessment, monitoring, reporting, and supporting activities required to effectively execute TSC's Operational Risk Framework.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct periodic Risk and Control Self-Assessments (RCSA) review for each business unit within Bank Operations.
Perform proactive control testing for automated and manual controls.
Lead assessments pertaining to Incidents, Issues, Internal Loss Data, External Loss Data, Scenario Analysis, Risk Appetite, and Key Risk Indicators KRI).
Provides risk expertise while working with the businesses and other risk partners (e.g., Compliance, Credit, Legal, Audit)
Leads or influences risk initiatives and business as usual activities. Identifies risk, assesses impact, and makes recommendations on resolution. Reports and escalates risk and program compliance as appropriate.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


Knowledge of:


Fundamental concepts, practices and procedures risk management (including Operational Risk Management and Enterprise Risk Management).
Financial markets and products.


Skill in:


Conducting and documenting risk assessments.
Understanding and documenting business process workflow and control points.
Identifying, documenting, and evaluating risks and controls relating to operations, financial reporting, and compliance processes and objectives
Operating standard office equipment and using required software applications.


Ability to:


Partner with others to accomplish objectives.
Attend to detail while maintaining a big picture orientation.
Interpret and apply policies.
Manage multiple tasks with changing priorities to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment with constant interruptions.
Provide a high level of customer service.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.


Educational/Previous Experience Requirements:


Bachelor’s Degree (B.A.) in related field.
~or~
Any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training approved by Human Resources.


Licenses/Certifications:


None required.

Raymond James Guiding Behaviors
At Raymond James our associates use five guiding behaviors (Develop, Collaborate, Decide, Deliver, Improve) to deliver on the firm's core values of client-first, integrity, independence and a conservative, long-term view.

We expect our associates at all levels to:
Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same
Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes
Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind
Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter
Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm
At Raymond James – as part of our people-first culture, we honor, value, and respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic selves, our organization, clients, and communities thrive. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.
Job Banking
Primary Location US-PA-Pittsburgh-Pittsburgh
Organization TriState Capital Bank
Schedule Full-time
Shift Day Job
Travel No

Thank You

If you’ve always dreamt of an exciting career in Banking, Finance and Tech, now’s the time to make it a reality.

Over the past decade, increasing regulatory scrutiny has led to the evolution of banking services which now play a critical part in every single stage of the trade lifecycle and the overall client journey. It is now the sharp tip of a bank’s competitive edge. Within Banking Services, it has therefore never been more crucial to get it right and demand for top talent is high.

These roles are challenging, demanding attention to detail and a strong client focus, a keen sense of risk and an awareness of the regulations. At Wiley Edge, we can provide you with the professional training to embark on your career within banking and open doors to world leading financial institutions.

As a part of the Wiley Edge Alumni program, Wiley Edge has an exciting and exclusive partnership with Columbia University’s School of Engineering. All Wiley Edge Alumni are eligible to receive two Executive Education certificates from Columbia Engineering as part of their Academy and industry placement experience at no cost. Further, all participating Alumni will have access to the Columbia Engineering network and ongoing training.

Some of these roles include:

Trade Support (Securities, Treasury, Transaction Management)
Risk, Regulation and Compliance (Credit Risk, Market Risk, Controls, Reporting)
Client Lifecycle Management (KYC/AML, CDD, Risk Assessment)
Regulatory Transformation (Business Analysis, Project Management, Client Outreach)
Data (Governance, Management, Remediation, Analysis)

Working within Banking Services will offer fulfilment, increased opportunities for progression and the chance to work with new technologies and multiple business lines.

This pathway is perfect for you if…

You have a genuine interest in Banking and Financial Markets.
You have a 2.75+ GPA
Degree topics we have seen succeed but not limited to include - Accounting, Law, Mathematics, Finance, Banking, Economics.
You’re an excellent verbal and written communicator.
You’re hungry to learn and upskill.
It’s a bonus if you already have experience working in teams in a collaborative environment.

How it works….

Apply via the form below. You must have an interest and knowledge in Banking and/or regulation.
Complete the assessments. You will receive a link to an online assessment, followed by telephone and video interviews.
Get trained remotely. You’ll learn everything you need to start your career in banking services. Learning from experts from Wiley Edge who have decades of experience, you'll be taught the technical and soft skills that organizations really need. Training is completely free and there are no hidden costs or catches.
Work with our careers service to start your career. After the training, you’ll be supported by Wiley Edge’s careers service which will help you connect with opportunities at some of the world’s most exciting companies.

What you’ll learn at Wiley Edge Academy:

Knowledge of financial markets, trading and financial regulations.
The inner workings of investment banks, from sales to back office processes.
The full trade lifecycle; risk; regulation and compliance.
Business analysis, data analytics and project skills.
How to recognize and combat the exploitation of financial services companies as a vehicle for specific types of financial crime.
Excel, VBA, SQL (Visual Basic for Applications), proprietary data processing, reporting tools and applications.

What you’ll get:

In-depth interactive training in small classes with graduates like you. Our training is created and delivered by industry experts who know your field inside out.
A generous graduate salary with pay rises every 6 months to reflect your progress.
A flexible benefit package
Ongoing training, support and social events throughout your placement.
An opportunity to kickstart your career and gain valuable experience in an attractive and exciting industry.

At Wiley Edge, our values support courageous teammates, needle movers, and learning champions all while striving to support the health and well-being of all employees. We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each individual who contributes to making Wiley Edge the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within Wiley Edge and with our partner companies, and we're proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish. That means promoting a strong culture of equality but, most importantly, inclusion.

We are committed to fair, transparent pay, and we strive to provide competitive compensation in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. The base pay rate for this position is $45,000-$50,000 USD. This pay rate represents Wiley Edge’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the base pay for this role at the time of posting and based on the locations listed in the job advertisement. It is anticipated that qualified candidates selected for a placement will receive this pay rate as a starting salary once onsite with the Wiley Edge client, however, the ultimate salary offered for this role may be higher or lower and will be set based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to, geographic location, skills, and competencies.

The stated salary and benefits package will be received once the training in the Wiley Edge Academy has been successfully completed and the candidate starts on-site with the Wiley Edge client. Trainees are paid a stipend of $625 USD for a full week of training in the Academy; training durations vary depending on training pathways and will be disclosed during the recruitment process.

All Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The company will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Highlight Health is a small, rapidly-growing startup located in Center City Philadelphia. Our company is committed to revolutionizing how employers and consumers pay for healthcare. We are seeking a motivated, hard-working Business Analyst who is passionate about helping to alter the landscape of the American healthcare system. This role will require the ability to understand, synthesize, and document constantly evolving company learnings to enhance and/or expand our ability to provide high quality and timely service to our customers. This rule truly requires someone who is ready and willing to be the author of our “trailblazing” methodologies designed to bring equity back to healthcare pricing.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Identify and listen to key stakeholders
Gather, review and analyze business and industry data, including KPIs, financial reports and other key metrics using data analytics tools
Liaise between various business departments internal personnel and sometimes external stakeholders
Assess options for process improvement, including business process modeling
Maintain documentation regarding various projects, processes and operations
Collaborate with project managers and cross-functional teams
Test newly developed or modified processes

Compensation and Benefits

Salary Range: $80,000+
Benefits: Health Insurance & 401(k)
Work from Home: After 90 days, employee can work from home 1 – 2 days a week.

How to Apply

Provide Cover Letter outlining your interest in the role and why you think you are a good fit.
Provide your resume.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree preferred
Business analyst and/or project management certificates will be view favorably
Minimum 2 years of business analysis experience
Experience in healthcare or health insurance industry
Familiarity with industry vernacular, stakeholders, and technology systems to gather data and problem solve
Ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements and operational decisions
Resourcefulness and ability to devise creative solutions to problems
Experience testing and mapping various business processes and protocols

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary that reflects your experience, skills, training, certifications, and education. We also provide benefits, including health insurance, 401(k) matching, sick time, paid time-off, and training.
We value diversity and inclusion and do not discriminate based on race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or sex – nor do we welcome anyone that does.
We are a small company with a big vision and a friendly culture. You will have the opportunity to work closely with our leadership team and have a direct impact on our growth and success. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where you can balance your personal and professional goals.

Role Overview

You’ll be joining the team in role that is at the core of our business operations. We’re looking for someone to embody our brand and use their skillset to translate it towards meeting our business objectives. If you live, breathe, sleep project management and process operations than the sky is limit. You have the opportunity to create your own path and shape the role while being part of a rapidly growing company.


Our Business Operations Analyst must work well in a collaboration skills with a strong attention to detail. As the specialist you must have an innovative mindset and ambitious personality feeling comfortable in a fast paced, entrepreneurial work environment. You’ll be responsible for taking an idea from concept to implementation and optimizing for perfomance. Having great organizational and communication skills mixed with a positive attitude will set you up for success.

Requirements

Serve as the lead on all business operations projects to include planning, requirements gathering, development, management, analysis, recommendations, and execution

Assists in systems administration for software used by the business group to support its operations such as sage, shopware, shipstation, klaviyo, etc... Researches and resolves routine support issues. Follows-up to ensure open issues are resolved. Assists in preparing user reference material.

Assist with product imports and exports by completing HTS research, clearing customs, and completing monthly audits to ensure we are within acceptable range

Complete routine document and process audits in order to maintain stable operations within ERP

Complete routine pricing audits within ERP to ensure calculated prices retain accuracy

Assist with international shipping operations by completing monthly audits to ensure tax was collected and charged, and shipping rates are in acceptable range

Maintain US purchasing process including the documentation, organization, and booking to realize stock in our ERP

Assists in communication of policies, procedures and initiatives to support operations. Helps to facilitate process improvement by engaging appropriate resources in issue identification and resolution.

Document “as-is” processes and information flows, and develop “to-be” process flows and process change diagrams to identify needed organizational and workflow changes

Develop business cases, requirements, and other related tasks in testing new technological implementations and work directly with IT team in resolving any issues

Work with training department and department heads in rolling out new projects to the staff

Identify technical efficiency issues within customer service and fullfilment operations and seek to develop new processes, manual or automated, with partners

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree. A combination of education, training and experience that results in demonstrated competency to perform the work may be substituted.

2-4 years related work experience to include budgeting, finance and or business analytics; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including .csv & .txt files, filtering, conditional formatting, macros, pivot tables, etc.

Ability to meet project deadlines, multitask and managing multiple accounts at same time.

Have initiative, resourcefulness, self-motivation, and a high level of ownership.

Strong planning and organization, priority setting, project management skills, and attention to detail

Confident written and verbal communicator

Detailed oriented and process driven (can define and establish new processes)

Ability to conduct analyses with data driven recommendations for improvements and advancements

Ability to troubleshoot and coordinate cross-functionally to provide timely solutions

Speed, resourcefulness, team player with a go-getter attitude

Job Type: Full-time exempt

To apply, fill out the form below or email your resume to eric@zeitgeistinc.us

UPMC Health Plan is seeking a full-time Operations Analyst, Associate to support the Medicare HCC Department. The team is based out of downtown Pittsburgh's US Steel Tower and this role will work in a hybrid structure. Occasionally travel throughout Western PA may be required as needed.

The Associate Operations Analyst oversees administrative, system processes, and special projects as they relate to the identification, implementation, and maintenance of the claims transactional system for all UPMC Health Plan products. Under the general direction of Business Support Management, this role will analyze, identify, propose, and implement solutions for all business areas. The Associate Operations Analyst acts as a subject matter expert supporting all areas and interacts with staff to answer questions and resolve issues as they arise. The ideal candidate for this position will have previous medical office and/or medical terminology experience, with Electronic Medical Records experience being a plus! Proficient computer and Microsoft Office skills are preferred, as well.

Responsibilities:

Identify areas of concern that may compromise client satisfaction through data analysis, and propose solutions based on findings, expertise, and research
Model business requirements for new systems, special projects and enhancements to existing systems; validate and test fixes/enhancements to new and existing systems
Openly participate in team meetings, provide ideas and suggestions to ensure client satisfaction, and promote teamwork
Completes Executive Summary management documentation as required
Performs in accordance with system-wide competencies/behaviors
Participates in training programs when available/as requested
Effectively prioritize and complete all assigned tasks
Identify, administer, test, audit, and implement new processes on transactional claims systems
Interface with customers by telephone, correspondence, and or in person to answer inquiries and resolve concerns/issues
Performs other duties as assigned
Assists other departments during periods of backlogs
Manages, updates, and maintains source data dictionaries as they relate to processes
Completes inquiries generated from the data reporting and analysis area
Maintains employee/insured confidentiality
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.
Minimum two years general business experience.
Experience in health care insurance or health care industry strongly preferred.
Previous experience in EMR systems is a bonus.
Knowledge of Commercial, Medicaid, Medicare and Individual products preferred.
Competence in MS Office required, including MS Excel, MS Access, MS Word.
Excellent planning communication, documentation, analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Must possess strong interpersonal, organizational, and project management skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
Experience in QA/Audit/Systems testing development and execution preferred.
