Job Description


Kennametal Overview:

Kennametal was founded in 1938. Customers across aerospace, earthworks, energy, general engineering and transportation trust Kennametal’s innovations in materials science, tooling, and wear-resistant solutions.

With over 80 years as an industrial technology leader, Kennametal Inc. delivers productivity to customers through materials science, tooling, and wear-resistant solutions. Customers across aerospace, earthworks, energy, general engineering, and transportation turn to Kennametal to help them manufacture with precision and efficiency. Every day approximately 8,700 employees are helping customers in more than 60 countries stay competitive. Kennametal generated $2 billion in revenues in fiscal 2023.




Location: Prefer Candidate to be located in Eastern US


Summary: This is an exciting position in Kennametal to lead a business unit and grow it to the next level. This is a key position that has responsibility for the development and implementation of short- and long-term strategic plans promoting innovation, change and robust growth objectives over the next few years. This leadership position will also enhance Kennametal’s internal leadership succession bench.

The leader will have demonstrated experience with full P&L responsibility in similar industries. He/She will provide direction, drive business growth and continuous improvement for achieving revenue growth and business profitability. The Business Leader will be responsible for sales, new business development and the business unit’s P&L. He/She will lead by engaging, coaching, and developing cross–functional teams, ensuring all priorities are aligned to drive improved capabilities, competitive customer excellence and industry best practices.


Key Job Responsibilities:


General Management:

Define and develop the business unit strategy with complete understanding of trends, areas of opportunity, business drivers and provide clear roadmap for implementing business transformation and change initiatives.

Serve as an inspirational & influential leader, infusing the unit with strategic thinking as well as a continuous improvement and growth mindset.

Define, develop, and execute the business and profitability growth objectives, gaining buy-in from all team members.

Direct and coordinate all department activities within the Business Unit to deliver on financial performance, manufacturing productivity and continuous improvements.

Deliver profitability objectives while making resource allocation decisions and manages pricing, collaborate on production costs decisions, and company spending.

Provide regular updates to Executive Leadership on overall business performance, profitability, and growth efforts.


Financial:

Lead, enable, and partner with the finance team, driving the P&L of the business unit, ensuring its goals and objectives align with the broader goals and objectives of the company.

Establish and execute the unit’s operating plan and budget, ensuring the attainment of short and long-term financial metrics.

Partner with the CFO as required on shared strategic initiatives.


People/Talent/Culture:

Develop and promote a culture of integrity, innovation, ownership, teamwork, continuous improvement, and meaningful change.

Ability to drive organizational and cultural changes needed to achieve strategic objectives while enhancing employees’ engagement.

Evaluate and build the organizational talent, by attracting, developing, engaging, and retaining talent essential for profitable growth.

Coach and develop the direct reporting team and cross functional leaders.


Manufacturing:

Partner with the VP Operations on implementing Operational Excellence best practices including safety, quality, delivery, and cost, ensuring business competitiveness, and delivering leading levels of customer service including on-time performance, quality, and reduced lead-times.


Compliance and Ethics:

Effectively meet all internal and external regulatory compliance requirements for the Business Unit.


Commercial:

Engage with the sales teams to ensure and maintain a full pipeline of new business with existing and new customers.

Achieve long-term market potential and business opportunity through product line extensions and service expansion expense, operating profit and working capital.

Engage with Key Strategic customers helping to strategize on value proposition opportunities, service delivery and quality improvements.


EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE



Bachelor’s degree is required, MBA is preferred.
Demonstrated success managing industrial business to business manufacturing with full P& L responsibility for business ranging between $300-500M.
5+ years as General Manager of a business with P&L responsibilities.
Overall, 10-15 years’ work experience with roles in sales and/or business development experience.
Experience working in a matrixed, cross-functional, and highly collaborative environment is required.
Exceptional skills in Business Analysis, Financial Acumen, and Business Development with ability to communicate complex ideas and concepts both up and down in the organization.
Knowledge of management principles with experience in complex organizational management.


Accountabilities



Full P&L performance.
Strategic organic growth with value added products and solutions.
Retention of existing customer base and increasing share of wallet with existing customers
Establishing an efficient management operating system that takes strategy into execution.
Strong communication skills that create a vision for the future, inspires the organization.
Drives accountability and responsibility within team.
Manage, lead, and develop the team creating strong succession for current role.

Job Description

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Location/Division Specific Information

Preferred location Rochester, NY; remote

Discover Impactful Work:

How will you make an impact?

The Sales Operations Analyst will partner with the Sales Operations team to ensure the tactical execution of initiatives and projects to drive the sales organization towards meeting the criteria for success within the defined sales strategies and objectives. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen, combined with excellent analytical skills and a bias toward action and collaboration. Strong process orientation and the ability to communicate, collaborate and influence team members in a cross functional environment are also required. This opportunity allows the individual in this role to develop their career in a challenging yet visible role.

A day in the Life:

What will you do?

Responsible for the support of sales incentive compensation within the scope of the North American LPD field sales teams. This includes but is not limited to:
Involvement in sales compensation plan design for all members of the Sales teams that are eligible under the Sales Incentive Plans (SIP).
Working with the Sales Operations team - review monthly incentive compensation payouts and casework (credit adjustments).
Support the Sales and Sales Operations teams with the month end reporting and incentive compensation process. This includes but is not limited to the month end reports for the Sales teams as well as preparing compensation data for review and approval by the Sr. Manager, Sales Operations for incentive compensation.
Support Sr. Manager, Sales Operations in quota setting for North American Sales organization for teams in scope of responsibility
Responsible for data quality and maintenance, by reviewing and updating product key assignments in the Data Warehouse and Xactly Incent (incentive compensation management software).
Responsible for special projects that support the strategic initiatives of the North American Sales Organization.
Ownership of the Sales Rep Product/Channel responsibility matrix. This role will have complete understanding of all the products and sales channels that the various sales teams in the North American organization are responsible for. This includes the complete documentation and change management of this matrix to support the sales strategies of the organization.
Support of the Sales Territory Management process. This includes support of the sales organization with territory mapping; deriving tools and documentation that articulates the mapping to the Sales Organization.
Provide ad-hoc reporting as requested by the members of Sales Operations and Sales teams.
Provide input and insight into commercial discussion as a full-standing member of Commercial and Sales Operations teams.
Keys to Success:
Education
BA/BS degree in finance, or other business related disciplines (MBA a plus)
Experience
3 - 5 years of experience in Sales Operations, Commercial Support, or related Finance role
Diagnostics, Medical Device, Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences experience a plus
Must have experience as a sales operations business partner, or related function, with cross functional teams.
Minimum of 3+ years of progressively responsible business experience
Strong knowledge of Excel (i.e., financial models and analysis), Cognos reporting tool (or equivalent), Xactly ICM Tool, PowerPoint, is preferred
The successful candidate should expect 10% - 15% travel
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
The successful candidate is personable, highly ethical and thrives in a collaborative environment.
Exhibits always: personal accountability to accuracy of information and deadlines
Proactive communication capabilities, identifying and addressing issues via candid dialogue and transparency
Must operate effectively in a complexly matrixed organization, having a track record of developing high levels of credibility and forging solid and positive professional relationships with peers and upper management
Strong commercial orientation with demonstrated experience partnering with business leaders to drive growth
Exceptional analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Self-motivated with high bias for action and accountability
High level of energy; will bring a passion to excel. Able to energize and influence a wide spectrum of people, including senior financial, commercial and operations professionals.
Ability to balance priorities and thrive in a complex global business environment
Drives a culture of accountability
Benefits

We offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus, healthcare, and a range of employee benefits. Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation!

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Job Title: URBN Software Engineer, Product Information Management
Job Description:
URBN Urban Outfitters, Inc. (www.urbn.com) is a portfolio of global consumer brands comprised of Anthropologie, BHLDN, Free People, FP Movement, Terrain, Urban Outfitters, Nuuly and Menus & Venues. Over the last 50 years, we have inspired our customers through our creative and entrepreneurial approach to products and services. At URBN, we Lead with Creativity…. Creativity guides our approach to product, environment, experience, and community. It drives our vision, strategy, and decision-making. It touches every job at URBN.

Title
URBN Software Engineer, Product Information Management


Reports to
URBN Program Manager, Technology


Overview
The URBN Product Information Management (PIM) team is responsible for collating, cleansing, and automating the Product data that powers URBN’s major brands: Urban Outfitters, Anthropologie, and Free People. Our challenges include ensuring data quality, creating automation rules that service our downstream websites and reporting tools, and solving complex business workflow problems. We work closely with our brands to ensure we output the highest quality data possible to both our internal and external customers. We’re looking for a talented and self-motivated Analyst to join our PIM group. If you enjoy improving processes and are passionate about data, we’d love to hear from you!


Responsibilities
Responsible for aspects of system analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, training and post-implementation reviews
Implementing new features as well as maintaining the PIM tool that powers all URBN Brands from a single system
Taking pride in writing code that is readable, maintainable, well tested, and documented
Become a subject-matter expert on our PIM implementation and act as a “super user” to support our business teams
Performance, scalability, and accessibility are top of mind. Finding ways to weave improvements in these areas into all our work is a must
Assesses and identifies essential tasks; reprioritizes tasks dynamically during each sprint; performs risk assessments; identifies and evaluates alternatives
This position needs to anticipate and identify issues that may prevent deliverables and develop and implement corrective actions
Demonstrates active team communication and coordination of ongoing PIM activities with the business, technical and IT partners


Job Skills
JavaScript
Understanding of RESTful web services
Experience with Agile
Experience with Systems Development Lifecycle
Systems Analysis/Business Analysis type of skills (i.e. triaging business requests)
Must be comfortable with negotiating and persuading other groups with diverse perspectives to gain cooperation and achieve business objectives
Ability to work under pressure and deliver to deadlines
Awareness of challenges/improvements around data quality for the industry
Strong attention to detail with emphasis on both quality and speed
Ability to prioritize work effectively and handle multiple competing demands
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both oral and written


Bonus Skills
Experience in PIM/MDM (Stibo STEP, Informatica, Akeneo, Enterworks, etc)
Experience with ERP systems, Planning and Allocation systems, Warehouse Management systems, or PLM systems
Experience in Merchandising/Retail
Experience building global/international solutions
Open to being mentored and/or mentoring others on the team


Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field





Location
Philadelphia, PA

Vanguard’s Institutional Marketing team is looking for a Product Owner to lead the implementation and ongoing enhancements of our customer data and identity resolution platforms. The CDP/IDR Product Owner is responsible for optimizing the value and use of the Adobe Real Time CDP and IDR platforms by defining and prioritizing the features and functionality with our digital marketing, marketing technology and technical development teams. This position will also partner with a digital marketing team to enable omnichannel activations, analytics, personalization, retargeting, and remarketing strategies to position the organization for continued advancement of marketing effectiveness given the changing dynamic landscape of digital marketing.

A successful candidate will have marketing technology experience, will be results oriented and a creative problem solver who thrives on learning and team collaboration. This individual will lead the strategic vision and roadmap for a product or products within a specific business area, demonstrating a deep understanding of the product(s). Products may have enterprise-wide implications.

This role:

Build the overarching strategy and high-level plan for CDP and IDR implementation, ingestion from multiple data sources, customer profile synthetization into traits and audiences, journey orchestration and integration with downstream system in partnership with Marketing and IT.
Act as the Product Owner representing Vanguards Institutional marketing team for utilization of the customer data and identity resolution platforms. Maintain and prioritize a backlog of features for implementation.
Contribute to the creation of a robust segmentation and testing strategy aimed at personalizing the consumer experience (marketing teams will own the customer journey strategy and segmentation criteria).
Ensure the highest quality, performance, delivery, and availability standards are met. Manage multiple, concurrent initiatives in various phases of ideation, execution, or delivery.
Bring best practices and strategy for consumer data journey and overall orchestration by working with both internal resources, including the Marketing Technology Team, IT and outside professional services, as necessary, to execute omni channel use cases.
Work with Marketing Analysts, Data Engineering, Data Science and other cross functional teams to define requirements for data and analytics solutions.
Understand consumer privacy regulations like CCPA and work with legal, engineering and marketing teams to ensure that consent and permissions are updated in the platform when needed.
Regularly present and communicate findings to senior leadership in a clear and compelling way.

What it takes:

Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required.
Minimum of 3 years of related work experience including experience with multiple components of the marketing technology stack including personalization, segmentation, campaign and data orchestration, etc. is required. At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering
Experience leading the implementation and management of Adobe’s Real Time CDP, or similar platforms such as, Segment, Tealium, Amperity and SAP.
Expert in leading components of large scale, high volume, real-time customer centric applications and digital infrastructure.
Understanding of related technologies, such as data management platforms, data lakes, and marketing automation tools.
Curious and shows high level of comfort in situations of ambiguity.
Proven track record working with diverse cross-functional teams and vendors. Adept at guiding groups with divergent opinions towards a unifying decision, drawing upon data to ground decision making.
A structured problem solver who can use technical aptitude, cross functional communication skills and results focus to align a broad set of stakeholders on solutions.
Comfortable thinking big and connecting the dots to align our product direction with the strategic goals of our business.
Can communicate complex ideas clearly, regardless of audience.
Not afraid to take a deep dive into metrics and data, whether it’s to diagnose a problem, evaluate a solution or propose a new KPI. Should have experience using analytic tools and querying data tables with basic SQL.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Overview:

At TierPoint, we are technologists, trendsetters, explorers, and creative minds who like to push the limits of imagination. We are seeking others who share our passion for technology, possess a never-ending curiosity to learn new things and work with cutting edge technology.


Our Enterprise Operations Support Analysts (EOC Support Analyst) provide real-time solutions to our enterprise clients around the clock. This is the perfect position to start your career and learn the ropes into the world of managed services technology. The opportunities for career advancement are right in front of you when you put your best foot forward.


Successful TierPoint EOC candidates are effective team & client communicators utilizing a myriad of tech resources and tools. This position is a first point of contact for TierPoint clients. You are playing both defense and offense – ensuring future successes for all parties involved. Truth be told, this position requires a major portion of the workday to be spent on client calls. You will openly communicate with fellow team members to investigate client managed service needs. It is a role for driven customer service- focused individuals that thrive in a fast-paced (like…lightning speed!) work environment. Our shifts don’t allow for much down time, but you won’t take work home with you. We have lots of fun too. Our great team and support system will help you learn and build your career. We laugh and joke, catch a sports game on the big TV monitor and we’re a family when it comes down to it.


Our EOC Support Analysts join TierPoint with an established path to learn and grow within a very successful EOC team. Through every step of this career progression, you will be offered extensive training for your current role so you may develop into a seasoned Analyst, Specialist and Engineer.


At TierPoint, we recognize the unique contributions that each team member brings to the table regardless of their role in the company. We all roll up our sleeves, keep our feet on the accelerator, and choose to see the positives and growth potential. Are you up for it?


TierPoint is a national leader in providing Colocation and Managed Hybrid IT & Cloud solutions. We are in the right space at the right time making us a very exciting place to be.
Responsibilities:
Making Customer Service the number 1 priority when it comes to all communications and problem solving mainly via phone then chat and email
Being adaptable in an environment that changes quickly
Handle and communicate client requests, escalations, and issues to the EOC Team
Able to efficiently and accurately carry out multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Qualifications:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Strong and empathetic customer service mindset and attitude
Superior communication skills, both verbal and written
Enjoys team collaboration and forward thinking
Basic understanding of computer and IT functions
Eager to venture out and learn new technologies

Job Title: Business Analyst II - Risk and IT Compliance
Job Description:
About Us

At Quaker Houghton, we are experts in the development, production and application of industrial process fluids, lubricants and coatings for the manufacturing industry. We have been an integral part in the growth of the world’s largest industrial and manufacturing companies from aerospace and automotive to primary metal and energy. Today, we have a global presence, with our corporate headquarters located in Conshohocken, PA. Quaker Houghton is a global publicly traded company with a unique collaborative culture that supports career growth for its associates and offers competitive compensation and benefit programs.

Position Summary:

Quaker Houghton’s goal is to apply global IT industry best practices, enabling Quaker Houghton to instill the business with new insights regarding global data, business risk, compliance, and information security.

The Business Analyst II - Risk and IT Compliance is primarily responsible for the SOX ITGC compliance program and supporting ongoing Risk and IT Compliance efforts. The position will work closely with other members of the Risk and IT Compliance team as well as the larger IT department, Finance-Compliance team and both internal and external audit teams. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, well organized, has the proven ability to develop solutions in response to complex audit and compliance related matters and apply precedents. Additionally, the candidate has prior experience driving projects and compliance related activities associated with Internal Control over Financial Reporting (ICFR). The ideal candidate should also have a proven ability exercising sound judgement and providing consultative guidance to stakeholders associated with IT compliance related matters. Role will receive exposure to upper management throughout a global and growing organization. Position reports to the Manager, Risk and IT Compliance. Excellent opportunity for someone looking to transition out of consulting / public accounting and into corporate Risk and IT Compliance.

What will you do?

Key liaison with Internal & External Audit partners
Manage document and project related request tracking and follow up with members of the organization; ensure timely evidence/documentation submission in support of audit activities and special projects
Updating and maintaining existing ITGC process documentation; providing control oriented coaching to control owners and stakeholders
Drafting, rationalizing, and maintaining narratives and process flows for in-scope ITGCs, systems, and processes
Assisting with monitoring of key SOX control activities
Assisting with the execution of key SOX control activities
Assisting with the drafting of IT policies and/or updates to existing policies; rationalizing current policies to ensure relevancy and identity areas for optimization/standardization
Assisting with IT Compliance related communications to key internal stakeholders
Assisting with other non-SOX related IT Compliance initiatives as required
Responsible for timely completion of work as assigned; providing regular status updates over assigned responsibilities
Performing initial quality reviews of staff or consultant related deliverables connected to audit and special project related activities; provide coaching to stakeholders and identify areas for documentation and process level improvements
Assist with special projects related to IT compliance and governance related initiatives

What do we look for?

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in relevant field
Certifications such as CISA, CISSP, CRISC, CISM, QSA, ISO 27001 LA (preferred)
Minimum 3+ years’ experience in IT audit, IT risk management and/or compliance role, public accounting experience preferred, but not required
Knowledge of SOX- ICFR IT General Controls, ISO/IEC 27001, COSO, COBIT, and NIST frameworks
Experience with identifying ITGC risks and controls and maintaining process narratives/flows
Experience with risk assessment frameworks
Effective organizational, time management and interpersonal skills
Analytical mindset with creative and innovative problem-solving skills
Possess ability for critical thinking with capability to skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning or communication; possess ability to apply lessons learned across assignments
Ability to understand the interrelation between financial, operational and technology internal controls
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
Experience with data analytics preferred (not required)
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite
High energy self-starter who can work well with teams and independently in a highly dynamic, fast paced environment

EEO STATEMENT: It is Quaker Houghton's policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Houghton International will also provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. This employer participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. Global Risk and Security enables business strategy, protects client and Vanguard interests (e.g., assets and data), and stewards a strong risk culture. Our teams leverage enterprise-wide insights, deep expertise, and trusted advice so that across Vanguard leaders and crew drive faster, stronger, risk-informed decisions.

Within GR&S, the Enterprise Security and Fraud (ES&F) sub-division is responsible for the global protection of Vanguard crew, property, data, and client assets. We are the trusted advisors that protect the pride of Vanguard with state-of-the-art security and fraud capabilities. We are a world-class destination of highly-engaged, passionate, and diverse talent expected to continuously learn and develop in an ever-changing security landscape.

Do you have prior experience either developing and/or implementing/engineering solutions on a cloud platform? Do you have some previous experience in a Security Operations Center? Do you want to take your current technical acumen to the next level? As a Cloud Security Operations Analyst, you will work closely with the team leads to help implement/design newly developed process and controls to further increase our cloud security posture using native and/or 3rd party mechanisms.

In this role, you will:

Provide senior level cyber security services to prevent, detect, respond to, and remediate threats. Coordinate with external and internal resources to develop and deliver new security solutions.
Utilize existing security controls to improve security posture, and research emerging threats relevant to operations.
Continually develop cloud architecture and security knowledge. Create Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for incident response triage.
Assist with the design and implementation of cyber security and operations procedures, tasks, and reports. Assist with automation of redundant processes.
Provide incident response triage support to other Cyber Security Operations teams.
Participate in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

What it takes:

Minimum of three years related work experience, with two years of Cyber Security experience.
Undergraduate degree in Computer science, Management of Information Systems Security, or equivalent combination of training and experience.
CISSP, AWS Cloud Practitioner, or other cloud or cloud platform equivalent required.

Sponsorship

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

$90,000.00 - $150,000.00

1+ year of a voluntary career break from your profession.

Working knowledge of Lean, OpEx or Continuous Improvement concepts.
Analytical mindset with experience using Excel, PowerBI or other similar tools.
Experience working with cross-functional teams or leading projects in a matrixed environment.

Utz Quality Foods is currently looking for a Part-Time Operations Analyst to work temporarily to support the Supply Planning team. The Operations Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data related to our supply chain operations to drive improvements in efficiency, cost reduction, and overall supply chain performance. This position will work 20 hours per week for approximately 6 months.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Collect, process, and analyze data related to supply chain operations, including inventory levels, demand forecasts, order fulfillment, and transportation logistics.
Performance Metrics: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as on-time delivery, order accuracy, and supplier performance. Identify areas of improvement and recommend corrective actions.
Inventory Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize inventory levels while minimizing carrying costs. Implement strategies to reduce excess inventory and improve inventory turnover.
Process Improvement: Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks in the supply chain process and recommend process improvements or automation opportunities.
Cost Analysis: Conduct cost analysis on various aspects of the supply chain, including transportation, warehousing, and procurement, to identify cost-saving opportunities.
Reporting: Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate supply chain performance to stakeholders and senior management.
Risk Management: Identify potential supply chain risks and develop contingency plans to mitigate them.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant processes related to supply chain operations.

Spreading Joy Through Food!

Here at Utz, we have a passion for food that our associates enjoy creating, our consumers love, and our customers choose. Our renowned family of brands includes Utz, Golden Flake, Good Health, TGI Friday's, On the Border, Bachman, and Zapp's. We provide a supportive, caring and inclusive environment that offers opportunities for career growth and advancement. Join OneUtzTeam and help us spread joy through food for generations to come!

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Requirements:
A minimum of 3 years of Supply Chain experience
Proven ability to conduct complex, quantitative and statistical analyses complimented with qualitative inputs from multiple sources to draw conclusions, make recommendations.
Strong problem solving, negotiation and influencing skills ability to make critical decisions based on the best information at hand and take a leadership role in building consensus among several parties to resolve problems.
Position requires a high-level proficiency with MS Excel, reporting software and competency in Word and PowerPoint.
Previous experience with an ERP and Advanced Planning system capabilities.
A track record of successfully delivering to business objectives against schedule and quality expectations.
Familiar with implementing key performance metrics as a basis for process improvement.
Ability to manage multiple simultaneous priorities.
Excellent communication, teamwork and leadership skills.
Strong sense of urgency, ability to work with minimal direction.

Job Responsibilities and Requirements
Responsible for assisting in the identification and analysis of business needs and solving problems by supporting the implementation of IT solutions that reflect the necessary functionality to address business goals and objectives. Utilizes broad IT and business knowledge to help implement IT solutions which address business needs. For Agile implementations, helps to plan, lead and execute IT Business Analysis effort for the development of software requirements through continual exploration of the business need - eliciting and refining requirements through an iterative process of planning, defining acceptance criteria, prioritizing, developing, and reviewing the results. Mentors and leads other IT Business Analysts and IT Business Analysis effort for projects and operational enhancements.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsibilities may be Operational (Support of “Business as Usual” scope of work) or Strategic (Program/Project scope of work)
Fulfills responsibilities noted below with provision of IT Business Analysis leadership and guidance for projects and operational work items. Responsibilities are performed with a high degree of IT Business Analysis expertise.
Partners with internal and external stakeholders, business and IT staff, to identify, specify, develop, and implement technology solutions and applications that address specific business requirements
Facilitates and executes the following IT Business Analysis activities with no supervision:
Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring
Stakeholder Analysis
Requirements Elicitation activities
Requirements Scope and Solution Management and Communication
Enterprise Analysis
Requirements Analysis
Solution Assessment, Validation and Delivery

Minimal feedback is necessary to complete requirements, regardless of complexity
Work product is fully acceptable and routinely achieved without supervision or feedback
Is able to apply skills to systems or processes where there is no previous experience
Complex situations are dealt with using experience and intuition, with an understanding of the big picture and how the individual actions fit within
Strong ability to resolve complex issues, determining priority of issues, and capability to see alternative courses of action while taking full responsibility for own work and decisions
Knows when work product is off track and is able to self-correct.
Uses business and technical knowledge to participate in the re-engineering of business operations to improve business results, reduce expenses, and improve workflow
Applies advanced skills for facilitating partnerships with all stakeholders identified – Business, Vendor, Systems & Development and Quality Assurance, to ensure that customer requirements are translated to design specifications and address any ambiguities in functional requirements to support appropriate testing efforts

Fosters a team oriented working environment that promotes open discussion on important issues, a high level of personal commitment, transparency and accountability to the business, and a continued focus on quality and customer service

Advanced understanding of Business Requirements fundamentals as encompassed in the BABOK© Guide (Business Analysis Body of Knowledge) and its applicability to the position
5 years prior experience as a Business Analyst in either IT or Operational business areas is required. Prior working experience or practice as a Developer, Project Management Associate, QA/UAT Analyst, Business Analyst, Product Owner, Business Operational/Process Analyst or equivalent experience is preferred.
Degree or college diploma/certificate in business or information technology, or similar work experience is highly preferred
Strong working knowledge and good theoretical knowledge of various requirements tools, techniques and methodologies
Certification in Business/Process Analysis (i.e. CBAP, Lean Six Sigma), Project Management (i.e. PMP, CSM) or other business or technical domains (i.e. ITIL) is highly preferred

Insurance experience preferred
Very strong verbal, written, interpersonal and consultative communication skills with advanced negotiation and influencing abilities
Analytical thinking and problem solving with the ability to maintain a strategic perspective even while being detail-oriented

Must possess strong organization skills and open-minded flexibility to manage changing business priorities
Able, willing and desirous to learn new skills and apply them in a thorough, open-minded and thoughtful manner
Advanced proficiency with various Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Word, Access, Projects, Power Point, and Visio
Prior experience working with AGILE methodologies is required

Ability to analyze and understand complex workflows and processes, and to develop innovative approaches to improve processes.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Senior w/ Healthcare Encounters Experience
Job Description:
Job Brief

Responsible for analyzing and triaging Medicaid encounters errors to resolution and maintaining acceptance rates

Your career starts now. We’re looking for the next generation of health care leaders.

At AmeriHealth Caritas, we’re passionate about helping people get care, stay well and build healthy communities. As one of the nation's leaders in health care solutions, we offer our associates the opportunity to impact the lives of millions of people through our national footprint of products, services and award-winning programs. AmeriHealth Caritas is seeking talented, passionate individuals to join our team. Together we can build healthier communities. If you want to make a difference, we’d like to hear from you.

Headquartered in Newtown Square, AmeriHealth Caritas is a mission-driven organization with more than 30 years of experience. We deliver comprehensive, outcomes-driven care to those who need it most. We offer integrated managed care products, pharmaceutical benefit management and specialty pharmacy services, behavioral health services, and other administrative services. Discover more about us at www.amerihealthcaritas.com.

Responsibilities:

The Business Systems Analyst Senior, Encounters Error Management role is responsible for analyzing and triaging Medicaid encounters errors to resolution and maintaining acceptance rates that align with State and Federal agency service level requirements.

Identifies encounter acceptance improvements and partners with cross-functional teams to remediate and resolve root causes of issues impacting encounters.
Triages encounter errors to meet accuracy metrics for encounters while meeting timeliness requirements.
Analyses, and drives resolution of encounter issues related to upstream claims, members, providers, vendors, inbound and outbound processes.
Monitors vendor encounter metrics, contractual compliance, and SLAs.
Works closely with other departments to align claims intake edits, encounter edits, and regulatory edits with Medicare and Medicaid agency processing rules.
Coordinates with Health Plan counterparts to ensure accurate and timely distribution of information pertaining to encounters accuracy.

Duties Include:

Monitors and researches encounters errors, ensures volume and aging are current.
Generates reports to support encounter error research and resolution using SQL, Excel, and/or Access.
Leverages subject matter expertise to support resolution and escalate encounter rejections and other encounters issues.
Participates in root cause resolution of systemic encounter errors.
Facilitates reoccurring governance calls with subcontractors and other stakeholders.
Communicates effectively to translate complex encounter concepts so they can be understood by a variety of audiences.

Education/Experience:

At least five (5) + years of relevant experience required.
Experience in healthcare, claims and encounters.
Strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
Proficient with verbal and written presentation of complex information.
Bachelor’s Degree required.

Preferred Experience:

Encounter data, Medicaid claims processing, Provider contracting, Health data analysis and reporting, working with various levels of management.
Reporting experience - SQL, Excel (pivot tables, data analysis functions), Access Database.
Experience with 837's, NCPDPs, and X12 transactions.

The incumbent in this position will be responsible for assigned Business Analyst related functions in the areas of: Business Process Reengineering (BPR); Business Architecture Modeling; Business Analysis; Work in cooperation with Project Management; Liaison with Business Partners program areas; collection and documentation of system requirements; coordinating and facilitating Joint Application Development (JAD) or Detail Design Sessions (DDS); Component Integration Testing (CIT); organization of the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) including creation of Test Scripts; use of specialized software for tracking system changes, maintaining documentation, organizing testing efforts; creation of training and standard operating procedures materials.

The agency desires an experienced senior business analyst to help oversee a mission-critical modernization project. This is a two-year project that will require significant amounts of time coordinating with the Department’s program area, Software development vendor and OA-IT/EBR delivery center. Prior experience in Software Development and Implementation project is required. Familiarity with Project Management methodologies and/or managing & tracking a project against a project plan is highly preferred.

Incumbent will work closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) in coordinating activities and staff schedules to support the PM and stay on schedule. The incumbent may also assist the PM with small tasks to ensure project is timely and may suggest or coordinate corrective action to ensure project completion on-time.

Incumbent must be organized, self-motivated, able to meet deadlines and capable of working on multiple tasks at one time. Must also effectively communicate, verbally, in writing, or via electronic media, and facilitate collaboration across the full range of executive, business, and technical resources.

The incumbent has advanced analytical lead responsibility for the following activities within the assigned project.

Plan, coordinate and facilitate session reviews of existing system and potential new system and/or system requirements.
Business Data Modeling; work in conjunction with Operations to identify data and data relationships and processes for inputs, outputs, roles, tasks, barriers, and constraints.
Analyze business process requirements and process diagram flows, review business policy and procedure documentation, create/update documentation as needed and review with agency Operations and EBR/OA- IT administrator resources.
Plan, organize, and implement testing efforts (to include planning, creating and executing test scenarios) for system integration testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Performs Business Process Reengineering (BPR) including assessment of existing business processes (As-Is Assessment), determination of future state (To-Be Assessment and Requirements), BPR gap analysis and assessment, and the general and detailed system design activities needed to support the business systems.
Research, coordinate, write and/or present training and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) materials at (low) technical and non-technical levels in conjunction with Operations.
Interact and provide as needed updates/presentations/reports for Executive staff including, (but not limited to): BPOA Operations, Deputy Commissioner and Commissioner; Deputy Secretary of Regulatory Programs, Exec. Deputy Secretary and Secretary of the Commonwealth.
Negotiate business requests depending upon complexity, priority and level of effort needed for resolutions. Foster productive communications between business partner and IT administrator resources to implement corrective solutions when issue (s) are identified. Escalates requests, as needed, to appropriate roles including the Operations Director, Project Manager, Technical Lead, or Application Developers.

Essential Functions

Facilitate meetings and communicate with business users and IT staff
Develop and review functional specifications for system development
Apply knowledge of the full System Development Life Cycle
Communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Serve as a liaison between program and IT staff
Perform technical and non-technical writing
Lead business process improvement efforts

POSITION SUMMARY

The Professional Services Category Manager is a recognized subject matter expert in the job area, the Professional Services Sourcing Category Manager, is responsible for developing, executing, and implementing strategies to source goods and services to support the internal professional services stakeholders and their related programs. Strategies may be short-term or long-term and must align with the Company goals for reducing costs and meeting financial expectations, while managing vendor relationships and new product innovation. This position follows the 7-step sourcing process in order to select high value suppliers and negotiate competitive pricing. In addition, contract compliance and stakeholder management will be keys to the success of this position.

This is a Hybrid position.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop, direct, and execute strategic sourcing strategies, best practices, and initiatives that support aggressive improvements in supplier consolidation, quality, total cost of ownership, enhanced service levels, improved coordination, delivery, pricing, lead-times, payment, risk compliance and other areas as identified.
Management of Professional Services contracts, including supplier negotiation, contract creation and execution, and supplier compliance to contracts and established service level agreements
Evaluate external market for competitive sources of supply, conducting market research and using benchmarking date to qualify potential sources.
Execute category sourcing strategies to include development and execution of sourcing events (RFx, reverse auctions, etc.); document bid process through supplier communication; drive the selection of suppliers in collaboration with cross-functional teams; conduct supplier negotiations; and ongoing supplier management.
Develop negotiation strategies, gain alignment from stakeholders, lead cross-functional, category-based negotiation teams, and implement appropriate supplier risk analysis.
Use current spend information/data and business knowledge to identify sourcing projects for individual subcategories and develop an overall cost reduction plan. Create and defend category strategies and decisions with sound analytics. Collaborate with key analytical support functions; synthesize results.
Aggressively manage category performance by adhering to internal Savings goals and reviewing financial models for commodity type items. Ensure spend portfolio for recurring, managed spend is balanced through coordinated sourcing waves and leveraged with other sourcing activities.
Drive consolidation of spend and seek out synergies across Business Units where applicable, by forming and leading cross-functional strategic sourcing teams to develop and implement category/commodity strategies and to drive cost from individual spend sub-categories. Champion regular category review meetings with cross-functional teams to manage category performance.
Lead and manage continuous improvement initiatives to drive simultaneous advancement of service levels, quality of goods & services, cost of supply, & favorable working capital terms.
Coach, review, and delegate work to lower-level professionals.
QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, Engineering or related field
Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred
8+ years progressive operational experience in procurement, sourcing or supply chain management; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience in business analysis, market research, financial analysis, procurement/supply chain analysis, supplier performance management, analytics (multi-dimensional analysis, master data management, predictive analysis, visualization)
Purchasing or Supply Chain Management domain experience (buying, vendor management, supplier evaluation, regulatory compliance, segmentation/taxonomy)
Ability to analyze complex data and present in a meaningful manner, making appropriate recommendations and driving actions (e.g., data validity, profit/loss variance, volume trends, ROI)
Strong analytical, prioritizing, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills with track record of proactive problem resolution within complex supply chains
Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as internal and external clients.
Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to work with and influence peers and management.
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting.
Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning).
Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required.
High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications; Advanced Microsoft Excel and database manipulation skills, SAP BI tools

Hershey’s Chocolate World is the most popular brand experience in the world. Nearly four million guests visit our location in Hershey, Pennsylvania every year. Our guests come to experience our attractions, enjoy dining in our food court, and shopping for souvenirs, treats and gifts. Part of what makes our guests’ experience so amazing is the exceptional customer service our team provides. In fact, our mission is to create extraordinary impressions through our people. If you would like to be part of the Hershey Chocolate World team that brings our mission to life every day, keep reading to find a career that fits your interest and abilities.

Job Title: Attractions Operations Manager

Job Location: Hershey, PA




Summary:




Hershey’s Chocolate World is the most popular brand experience in the world. Nearly four million guests visit our location in Hershey, Pennsylvania, every year. Guests come to experience attractions, enjoy dining in the food court, and shopping for souvenirs, treats and gifts. Part of what makes our guests’ experience so amazing is the exceptional guest service our team provides.

This position is responsible for managing Create Your Own Candy Bar (CYOCB), Hershey’s Chocolate Tour Ride (TR), Parking, and supporting day-to-day operations of Hershey’s Chocolate World by providing an entertaining and operationally efficient experience for four million visitors annually. This position supports the overall strategic direction of Hershey’s Chocolate World by optimizing existing attractions, and identifying future attraction development opportunities.

The incumbent supervises team members in the Attractions department and supports training functions to ensure maximum efficiencies, superior guest service, and attraction quality. Responsibilities include employee management (interviewing, hiring, monitoring performance), labor planning, and scheduling. This position works with both internal and external customers. The incumbent acts as Manager on Duty (MOD) during, weekends, weekdays, holidays, and evening operating hours supporting Retail, Food Service, Attractions, and Marketing initiatives to deliver sales goals. Responsibilities also include making operational decisions, merchandise display adjustments, and creating or adjusting processes to efficiently and effectively serve guests.




Major Duties/Responsibilities:




Operations Management of Create Your Own Candy Bar, Tour Ride, and Parking




Develop a solid understanding of our brands and brings them “to life” to engage our guests.
Execute plans to maximize capacity and sales at peak times and deliver a seamless experience by providing fast and efficient guest circulation throughout all attractions.
Recommend improvements/enhancements for attractions.
Partner with photo vendor to maximize sales and guest experience at TR and CYOCB.
Write Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for CYOCB, TR, and Parking. Revise as needed.
Be the subject matter expert of CYOCB, TR, and Parking.



Safety & Quality Assurance




Responsible for safety and develops and maintains safety programs for TR, CYOCB, and Parking; this includes working with management to develop an evacuation plan specific to each attraction and becoming familiar with general facility evacuation plans.
Act as liaison for CYOCB team with the Quality Assurance (QA) team to ensure compliance and adherence to all food safety standards including Food Defense plans.



People & Labor Management




Maintain weekly attendance tracking and follow-up actions.
Conduct weekly payroll review, adjustments and approvals.
Manage employee availability to ensure appropriate staffing levels to support business volume and service execution.
Develop monthly/annual departmental schedule templates for TR, CYOCB, and Parking.
Champion employee engagement by executing employee engagement programming within the department and driving culture by leading with best practices.
Responsible for overall hiring, scheduling, training and coaching of Attractions.
Ensure the team is delivering at the highest level of service.
Achieve labor goals through the effective use of labor across attraction locations.



Parking




Responsible for Parking including pricing recommendations and operational plans and implementation for concerts and special events.
Recommend improvements and optimizations to maximize traffic flow.
Partner with design team to create all signage needed for parking lots and entry/exit road.



Financial

Directly responsible for $6M in Attraction sales annually.
Develops programs to meet sales and income goals and reports on key metrics (sales, productivity, sat scores, etc.) that drive the business.
Accurately communicate progress against key business initiatives. Leverages these metrics to maintain pricing, margins, labor costs and related expenses to meet profitability objectives.
Responsible for Attractions’ financial and business planning components, including sales & expense planning; part-time labor planning; and monitoring progress against planned targets.
Inventory management directly related to attraction operations including products used in attractions.



Manager on Duty (MOD)




Deliver a high level of guest engagement and exceed daily sales goals while maintaining & elevating The Hershey Company brand reputation.
Responsible for the day-to-day operations of all areas of the Hershey’s Chocolate World facility, including Retail Operations, Attractions, Parking, and Food Service.
MOD is responsible for overall satisfaction, safety and security of approximately four million guests annually. MOD is also responsible for ensuring adequate staffing to meet the needs of the business; this includes adjusting schedules to ensure appropriate coverage within budget; making decisions about closing hours based on business levels (i.e. “soft closes”); and monitoring employee performance and attire.
The MOD functions as the on-site incident commander during crisis events, serves as direct liaison to local emergency departments and corporate security and reports any unusual activity immediately.
MOD monitors guest volume & flow throughout the facility and ensures a maximized guest experience; this includes making critical decisions about queue management; parking lot operations; and redeployment of staff to manage business peaks and valleys.
MOD monitors contract employees to ensure excellent customer service.
MODs are required to complete first-aid and CPR training.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:




Leadership skills: team work skills, employee motivation, coaching, and time management
Managerial skills: scheduling employees for peak and non-peak seasons
Presentation skills
Project management
Business analysis
Communication/customer service skills
Attention to detail
Ability to meet tight deadlines/good follow-through
Work under pressure and maintain problem solving skills.
Ability to interact with all levels of people
Ability to handle crisis situations/remain calm
Ability to organize and handle multiple tasks
Flexible
Knowledge of budget, financial concepts
Computer skills (work, excel, e-mail systems, power-point)
Ability to work weekends, evening and holiday (special work hours—works a varied schedule)
Operational background/instincts



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:




Education:




High School Diploma or G.E.D.



Experience:




Minimum of 5 years management or supervisory experience in customer service and operations management preferably in an attraction, entertainment complex, or amusement park.

Position Overview:

The Sales Tax Analyst is responsible for managing and executing all aspects of sales tax compliance and research within our organization. This role involves ensuring the accurate calculation, reporting, and filing of sales tax across various jurisdictions, staying updated on tax laws and regulations, and assisting with tax audits. The Sales Tax Analyst plays a key role in minimizing tax liability through informed application of tax laws and regulations, and effective tax planning.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and file timely and accurate sales tax returns in multiple jurisdictions.
Review and reconcile sales tax accounts and ensure accurate general ledger entries.
Analyze and interpret sales data to calculate tax owed and ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Stay informed of changes in tax laws and regulations and assess their impact on the company's operations and tax compliance.
Collaborate with internal departments, such as finance and legal, to understand business practices and identify tax-related issues.
Assist in managing and responding to sales tax audits, including gathering and preparing necessary documents and data.
Research tax issues and provide guidance and recommendations on tax matters to internal stakeholders.
Develop and implement tax compliance policies and procedures to streamline processes and ensure accuracy.
Provide training and support to other staff members on sales tax issues and processes.
Work with external tax advisors and consultants as needed.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field; CPA or advanced degree in taxation is a plus.
2-4 years of experience in sales tax, tax compliance, or a related field.
Strong understanding of sales tax laws and regulations.
Proficiency in tax software and Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

PHMC is proud to be a leader in public health. PHMC requires that all employees are fully vaccinated with the Covid-19 vaccine before the first day of employment.

GENERAL POSITION DESCRIPTION:
The Philadelphia Department of Public Health is seeking a Performance Management Analyst who will manage the operational performance of the City of Philadelphia SmarterU Learning ManagementSystem (LMS) and coordinate/track educational training activities for the health department as a whole. This role will report to the Director of Accreditation, Performance Management, and Quality Improvement and will support the department’s workforce development objectives.

SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:

The Performance Management Analyst will act as the department’s internal consultant to deliver, track, and measure the performance of the department’s LMS in accordance with the department’s organizational objectives, as well as track trainings and educational activities that may be in addition to the LMS.

This will involve:
1) development, maintenance, and evaluation of e-learning content in the department’s LMS;
2) creating and managing user accounts;
3) troubleshooting and providing technical and/or user support;
4) collaborating with and supporting e-learning content developers throughout the department in preparing content for delivery through the LMS, and;
5) collaborating with training coordinators/staff to manage external training content and completion data for required training and educational activities.

The specific duties of this role include:

Tracking/reporting trainings in the LMS
Facilitating course enrollments across the department
Facilitating course development and revisions in Articulate360 software
Managing annual contracts and vendor relationships for SmarterU and Articulate360 software
Creating and maintaining admin and end user system documentation
Supporting new hire onboarding training needs (account creation, enrollments, tracking, etc.)
Supporting ongoing employee training and professional development through the LMS
Staying current with integrative software and systems to support LMS functionality
Analyzing user and course data trends in the evaluation of departmental training needs
Identifying, evaluating, and promoting training content appropriate for inclusion in the LMS
Assisting with information management of required departmental trainings in addition to the LMS

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Knowledge/Technical Skills:

Strong communication and writing skills
Systems thinking/analytical mindset
Experience with educational or instructional design
Customer service-oriented
Project management experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Working knowledge of learning management systems (experience with SmarterU a plus)
Experience with e-learning integration software (Articulate360 a plus)
Working knowledge of business analysis techniques (i.e., gathering business requirements)
Experience navigating complex organizations with a wide range of training needs
Personal Skills/Characteristics:

Critical and collaborative thinking
Ability to understand process data and related concepts
Observant and patient
Organized and detail-oriented
Curious and inquisitive, with investigative abilities
Ability to explain technical instructions/concepts to a non-technical audience
A self-starter with the flexibility to work as an individual contributor or as part of a team
Ability to successfully engage with staff at all levels

Education/Relevant Experience:

Completion of a bachelor’s degree program at an accredited college or university in educational or instructional technology/design or a related field.
Two to three years of relevant experience. Coursework and/or certifications related to learning management system administration a plus.

OR

Any equivalent combination of education and experience determined to be acceptable by the Department of Public Health.
SALARY:

Salary is around $55,000 and is commensurate with experience and qualifications.

QUALIFIED APPLICANTS:

If you are interested in applying for this position, please send a cover letter and resume to Crystal Brown, Director of Accreditation, Performance Management, and Quality Improvement at: crystal.b.brown@phila.gov. Please be sure to include “Performance Management Analyst” in the subject

Position Summary:

Ability to develop new strategies of approaching business challenges independently
Strong and independent analytical thinker and influencer
Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interface with senior management
Self-starter and highly proactive in outreach to business units and functional organizations
Consultative skills to deliver expertise and problem-solve with business leaders
Proven experience in exercising independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

Location: Harrisburg, PA

Position Type: Contract

Position Term: 3+ Months

***Remote work to start. Candidate will need to report onsite once COVID Restrictions end.***

Requirements:
The position will fulfill the role of Project Manager and Request for Proposal (RFP) Development, and comprehensively support the client in all facets of RFP requirements in development, submission, evaluation, negotiation, and award. The position will maintain the role of advocate for the client at every stage of the RFP procurement process. The successful candidate for this position must possess direct project management experience of similar sized scope and complexity projects. Familiarity with resource management, conservation, and outdoor recreation is highly desired.

The successful applicant must be capable of working independently to meet the objective of developing an RFP using the Commonwealth’s format and assuring compliance with procurement rules. The RFP must succinctly capture the Commission’s need to develop a new automated online stocking authorization application and review system. As the project manager, the incumbent is responsible for developing and maintaining a task list and strict timeline that will meet defined target dates. The incumbent must also develop the Commission’s RFP document, manage the submission, and assist with the vendor evaluation.

Project Management: Using approved project management methodology, the project manager shall develop, control, and maintain a project management plan and timetable that will encompass all facets of writing a comprehensive RFP, vendor bid management, evaluation, and assist with evaluation, negotiation, and contract award.

RFP Development and Submission: Utilize Commonwealth of Pennsylvania procurement and Governor’s Office of Administration and Information Technology RFP procedures to develop an RFP that will be approved by the Commission for submission that will allow the Commission to receive thousands of proposed stockings requests submitted through an online system and ensure that all proposed stockings of fish into waters of the Commonwealth are reviewed, considered for their ecological risk, and where appropriate, authorized for stocking.

Specific system capabilities include the following but may be modified as new information becomes available.

Ability to link to informational pages on Commission website or other hosting locations (i.e., species pages, pond management tips, grass carp permit information, invasive species outreach, agency resources, fact sheets, Propagation and Introduction List, future Fish Health Certificates).
Ability for multiple Commission staff to be able to access the authorization records and to review and provide comments or other information that allow staff approval signoffs or authorization conditions as needed.
System should have the ability to (internally) query specific authorizations via location (i.e., authorization number, municipality, county, species).
System should have the ability for internal (staff) reporting to allow staff users to gather summary information for monthly, quarterly, or annual reporting (e.g., numbers of authorizations issued, species stocked).
System should have the ability to be tracked externally, to enable the applicant to check on the status of an authorization. For example, the status of the authorization could be shown on an applicant dashboard (i.e., status, under review, needs more information, complete). This could potentially reduce the number of status phone calls the reviewing biologist may receive.
Develop and document Commission’s program requirements to meet business specifications.
Conduct regularly scheduled meetings with subject matter experts, key stakeholders, and Commission staff to ensure expected outcomes are met.
Research, document, and recommend best management practices from other states for online authorization (permit) issuing systems that should be considered as enhancements.
Document security requirements in accordance with Commission and Commonwealth policies; as well as industry best practices, especially as it refers to system and data security.
RFP Evaluation Assistance: Develop and maintain vendor response evaluation metrics for the scoring of all qualified vendors. Assist the Commission in evaluating proposals submitted through the subsequent RFP process to ensure vendors meet all of mandatory RFP requirements as established by the Commonwealth, Department of General Service, and the Governor’s Office of Administration/Office of Information Technology.
Assist with question and answer compilation and response, vendor demonstrations, proposal evaluation, and contract negotiations.
Provide consultation to the Commission on the scoring of vendors.

SKILLS:
PMP Certification Required
Project Management Experience Required 5 Years
Business Analysis experience Highly desired 5 Years
Prior Pennsylvania Commonwealth agency experience Highly desired
Experience with Commonwealth procurements and RFPs Highly desired
