Overview

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is digitally transforming our internal enterprise systems through the implementation of a holistic Enterprise Resource Planning platform. This system will touch all parts of the Shift4 business model including order management, engineering, supply chain, production, and financial systems. Our goal is to create a unified "single pane of glass" for which to operate all business processes within and transfer operations from current bespoke applications to this upgraded operating model.
As a Senior Business Analyst, ERP Systems you will help create and define the requirements for this system through your experience in finance, accounting, manufacturing, or supply chain. You will meet with stakeholders, develop the technical documentation for each group, and support implementation of these systems across the enterprise. This is a dynamic and comprehensive role that will have a major impact on the way S4 conducts internal operations and will be an early adopter of these systems to define the company's future state. You will join a highly motivated and technical Digital Transformation team seeking to upscale the Shift4 operating systems.




Responsibilities:

Conduct discovery sessions with business leaders and stakeholders to effectively generate technical requirements for each divisional
operation. Report directly to the VP, Enterprise Systems in this discovery phase.
Create and support technical documentation drafting to formalize requirements during vendor selection.
Participate in vendor demos, provide feedback, and analyze the effectiveness of each potential solution as it relates to the technical requirements.
Support the development of a technical implementation roadmap, including selection, data migration, strategic rollouts, and training of personnel on new systems.
Support and manage contractor implementation teams to ensure on time and on budget delivery of new infrastructure modules and identify any issues or bugs during rollouts.
Build out metadata for ingestion of parts, bill of materials (BOM) structures, accounting systems, and internal Shift4 processes.
Analyze adoption rates of new systems and create visuals to help executive leadership understand current and future architecture strategies.
Develop automations and API developments to connect external systems to newer, more optimized digital systems.
Create training materials and L&D plans to help push adoption rates of new systems.



Minimum Qualifications:

5-8 years of technical analysis or digital transformation work in a highly technical field. (Finance, manufacturing, or supply chain)
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, etc).
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning systems such as Oracle Fusion, SAP, Netsuite, or Microsoft Dynamics, preferably in a development or back end capacity.
Ability to create highly technical documentation, consolidate that information into presentations or one-pagers, and properly communicate technical details in a consumable way to executive leadership.
Experience writing automation in Python, or other API developments. Data analytics experience using Microsoft SQL Server or AWS and traditional BI analytics tools.
Ability to decompose business requirements from stakeholders, and desire to be hands-on with long term projects.




Desired Qualifications:

Masters degree in a relevant technical field
Personal experience building and managing data pipelines, developing ETL processes, and managing data warehouses.
Experience with integrating multiple software systems through APIs, or performing large implementations of new software systems (such as an ERP, Salesforce, or other type of graphical user interface)
Experience with operational fundamentals such as corrective action reporting, non-conformances, inventory management, and data governance.
Personally led a major project from inception to integration
ERP Administrator experience in one of the major ERP platforms.

Job Title: Customer and Supplier System Integration Manager
Job Description:
About Us:

RS Integrated Supply is a rapidly growing leader and global provider of comprehensive supply chain services that drive increased productivity and profitability for our clients, including: Supply Chain Services, Asset Services, Master Data Leadership SM and Technology. We currently deliver our highly focused expertise through integration at more than 220 customer sites across the North America, Europe, and Singapore.




The Customer and Supplier Integration Manager is a strategic leadership role in the development, integration, and support life cycle of RS Integrated Supply enterprise business applications. The applications include internal business systems, interfaces to external customer’s and supply chain partners’ enterprise applications. The manager collaborates with external customers, suppliers and RS Integrated Supply internal business leadership to develop and implement technology and integration strategy that is aligned with the RS Integrated Supply’s enterprise strategic directives to meet business growth and profitability. Reporting into the Director, Enterprise Applications, the manager will be expected to oversee development and support of the integration systems as well as working with the implementation team to deliver integration projects for new and existing customers and suppliers. The manager has oversight of the business applications road map, development and support, and projects implementation and delivery. They will also be expected to evaluate and recommend advanced automation technologies.




Must Haves:

Experience in technology team – ideally managing the technology team
Experience delivering software solutions
Experience working with customers or suppliers in relation to technical systems or integration
Experience managing teams (8-12)
Experience project managing
Experience line managing people (i.e. 121s, appraisals)
Experience of the supply chain



Key Responsibilites:




Business Partner to senior executives with our Customers, and internally with the Implementation team, Finance, Sales, Operations and parts of Supply Chain for strategic IT systems that enhance and sustain the profitability of the organisation
Understand business functions, company direction, and applicable IT platforms in order to assess alternatives and create a strategy to provide effective IT systems
Assessment of technology, identification of opportunities to enhance and optimize existing applications, and incorporation of new technologies into product roadmaps
Provide leadership and oversight for the architecture and development of platforms for consistent and repeatable customer and supplier interfaces
Provide leadership and oversight for enterprise-wide business integration applications including application design, development, implementation, integration, delivery and on-going support
Provide leadership and oversight for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) and other integration environments between RS Integrated Supply and its trading partners
Oversee support and maintenance of existing business and financial applications, including troubleshooting of critical production issues as they occur
Maintain high level knowledge of software development tools and techniques and work with technical team to maximize efficiency and accuracy of software development
Implement and follow sound development methodology and proven approaches to delivery
Promote environment and application stability through accepted principles of change control, quality assurance and software release management
Recruit, retain and organize internal and external resources (as required) to plan and execute projects
Solicit proposals or offers of services from third-party vendors as needed to supply necessary products and services that cannot be provided by in-house staff.
Establish productive professional relationships with key users and customer representatives as needed to provide services
Create and manage budgets for both capital expenditures and operating expenses and assess solutions in the context of business costs and benefits to RSIS
Provide goals, objectives and career path for all resources under direct or indirect supervision
Foster an atmosphere of open communication and team spirit among all levels in the organization
Other duties as assigned

Candidate Requirements:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree required
Experience with integrated supply and MRO industry a plus
Experience with Enterprise Information Technologies roles
Most recent 3 to 5 years of experience should include supervisory and/or senior leadership responsibilities
Proven ability to effectively manage global teams located in different countries and time zones
Strategic problem-solving skills and experience
Ability to effectively interact with and influence all levels of management
Ability to build, lead and grow strong teams
Experience with ERP Systems (i.e SAP, JD Edwards, Infor), PSP Systems (i.e. Ariba and Coupa) and CMMS Systems (i.e. Maximo)
Experience with technologies including Mulesoft, OpenText, EDI, API’s, .Net
Knowledge or experience with automation technologies for example UIPath, Power Automate
Understanding of security, networks and infrastructure components
Solid understanding of key integration concepts such as asynchronous messaging, data transformation, routing, and batch processing
Familiarity with the Agile methodology
Experience with all phases of project life cycle
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills
Ability to work under minimal supervision.
Ability to make decisions and take responsibility for the outcomes without the need to escalate them to higher-level management
Ability to see and understand broader, enterprise level perspective and define strategy
Ability to effectively balance multiple priorities
Leadership ability to inspire, motivate and drive results
Sense of urgency and ownership
Excellent communicator, able to persuasively convey both ideas and data
Proven skills as an effective team player who can engender credibility and confidence within and outside the company
Identifies opportunities and anticipates changes in the business landscape through an understanding and ongoing assessment of the environment affecting the business

Independent Computer Consulting Group, Inc. in Warminster, PA, is seeking a Senior Business Consultant – Finance. The Senior Business Consultant – Finance will be responsible for suggesting and implementing information and financial processing methods to improve efficiency and reduce business costs.

S/he will confer with various organizational units within the client site to analyze requirements and identify problems. S/he will then establish a business plan to improve efficiency and address business concerns. S/he will study existing information processing systems, evaluate effectiveness, and develop new systems to improve workflow.

Senior Business Consultant – Finance will prepare workflow charts and diagrams to specify operations to be performed by personnel and conduct studies pertaining to the development of new information systems to meet current and projected needs. S/he will prepare business report and memoranda in order to document development. S/he will perform the aforementioned job duties for clients within at least one or more of the following industry segments: Equipment, Service Management & Rental, Food & Beverage, Fashion, Distribution and Manufacturing.

Senior Business Consultant – Finance will have an in depth understanding of Finance business processes including: General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets and/or costing. The Finance specialist will also have experience in using Infor M3 Finance Management Suite – including M3 Financial Controlling: Budgeting, Cash Flow Management, Cost Accounting, Product Costing, Multi-Unit Coordination, Risk Management, Time Accounting. As well as M3 Financial Accounting: Automatic Recording Bank Statements, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Current Assets, Fixed Assets, General Ledger, Group Consolidation, Report Generator, Tax Management, ADC for supplier Invoices and Equipment Profitability Management.

Senior Business Consultant – Finance will have strong people management, project planning skills with an ability to define and manage deliverables in collaboration with other project team members. S/he will identify conflicting project priorities (tasks, resources, and schedule) and proactively resolve them. S/he will assist and train other project team members on troubleshooting and finding solutions to complex scenarios and issues. S/he will be responsible to independently architect an engagement defining the strategy, architecting the overall solution, developing systems requirements through blue printing, configuring and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines.

The Senior Business Consultant– Finance must have, at a minimum, a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or Computer Science (or Master’s equiv. of Bach. plus 5 yrs. exp.) plus 2 years of experience as a business analyst/business consultant. Must have experience with M3 ERP.

Business Solutioning and Stakeholder Management

IPA Certifications (RPA Analyst, Solution Architect, Python, AI certifications (Deep/Machine Learning) OR Claims Background and some involvement in continuous improvement work or served as a Business SME on automation or digital claims projects.
4 – 6 years business process engineering/business analysis experience in financial or insurance services

JOB SUMMARY

Due to confidentiality restrictions, only US citizens will be eligible to fill this role.

The job understands healthcare data end-to-end and oversees the analysis and delivery of analytic data for the enterprise. The incumbent is responsible for the scope, planning, and delivery of analytic data efforts for Enterprise Analytics. Understands healthcare data from end-to-end and the analysis, testing and delivery needs of analytic data for the Organization. Oversees requirements solicitation, and testing of analytic delivery systems and collaborates with engineering and quality teams on cross-functional efforts, in this role the incumbent should also act as a business data subject matter expert hands on where possible, and guide, lead and educate staff knowledge and growth. Responsible for customer relationship management.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform management responsibilities including, but not limited to: involved in hiring and termination decisions, coaching and development, rewards and recognition, performance management and staff productivity. Work directly with delivery teams on business domain knowledge where needed. Educating and growing department staff.
Oversee (in Matrix) the incorporation of new data within the analytic framework for the organization, including working with alternative analytic data systems to incorporate them into the data flow for Analytic Teams. Oversee the team conducting verification of analytic data for the organization, including confirmation of the accuracy of new data sources used by analytic entities through the enterprise.
Develop and implement business plans, policies, and procedures related to delivering data and analytic systems. Oversee business needs, testing, and consulting of the core analytic platform/hub for the analytics organizations.
Monitor and report out to management on the status of departmental projects: anticipates and identifies issues that could inhibit achieving the project goals and objectives, and implementing corrective actions and mitigation strategies.

Job Summary

This position will be responsible for support, implementation, upgrades, and maintenance of Logistics specific applications such as our WMS, ERP, shipping software, etc. They will be responsible for leading and participating on project teams from a technical aspect which will engage in WMS system upgrades, warehouse expansions and new warehouse projects. They will get to work closely with both IT and the Business to meet the needs of the Business for continual improvement and growth.

Responsibilities

Perform set-ups/configuration of software, such as ERP, WMS, Shipping Software, and other logistics related software.
Provide thought and knowledge leadership in various areas of the Business and application support, as well as coordinating work with internal and external resources.
Perform troubleshooting and application support for Business and IT issues.
Communicate project status regularly with project teams and end users.
Perform ERP/WMS version updates, including the coordination and testing of kernel updates from our corporate headquarters and external vendors.
Develop and execute system testing; create use cases, develop and execute test plans, and facilitate the user acceptance testing effort.
Provide business systems technical support by:
Develop user and technical support documentation and provide user training.
Providing post-implementation process and technical support.
Provide advance support for various applications and business processes.
Working with vendor, headquarters, and internal key users in the organization for support and problem resolution, as required.
Coordinate efforts to ensure optimum system resources and capacity are available for efficient application operation and high availability.

Must Have Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in CIS/BIS and 5 (+) years of relevant professional level work experience preferred, or Associate Degree and 7 (+) years of relevant professional level work experience preferred.
Previous experience with implementing/supporting WMS and ERP systems is essential.
Previous experience integrating and interfacing systems.
Familiarity working in an automated warehouse/manufacturing environment.
Knowledge of relational database systems, as well as Oracle SQL and PL/SQL.
Ability to provide clear written and verbal communication.
Ability to use analytic skills to perform problem solving and provide solutions.

We Value

Baan or SAP ERP experience preferred.
Viadat/Viastore WMS experience preferred.
Ability to manage projects across technical and functional disciplines.
Ability to execute assigned project tasks within established schedule.
Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively with all levels in the company.
Demonstrates knowledge and skill in technical areas.
Demonstrates a willingness to collaborate with others, build relationships, and involve others in decision making.
Demonstrates the ability to drive customer value through knowledge of the business, putting effort into identifying customer needs, and delivering work to maximize the value for customers.
Demonstrates a willingness to take ownership by making decisions, taking responsibility, and driving things forward.

Essential Job Functions

Must be able to look at a computer screen for extended periods of time (up to 4 hours)
Must be able to sit and/or stand for extended periods of time (2-4 hours at a time)
Must be able to lift 50 pounds
Must be able to travel in vehicles (automobiles, trains & planes) for up to 10 hours
Must comply with company dress code guidelines
Must be able to travel to foreign countries
Must be on-call 24x7, as required
Must be able to travel to (via automobile) and work in the office on occasion

Company Summary Statement : As one of the largest investor-owned utility companies in the United States, PPL Corporation (NYSE: PPL), is committed to creating long-term, sustainable value for our 3.5 million customers, our shareowners and the communities we serve. Our high-performing regulated utilities — PPL Electric Utilities, Louisville Gas and Electric, Kentucky Utilities and Rhode Island Energy — provide an outstanding experience for our customers, consistently ranking among the best utilities in the nation. PPL’s companies are also addressing challenges head-on by investing in new infrastructure and technology that is creating a smarter, more reliable and resilient energy grid. We are committed to doing our part to advance a cleaner energy future and drive innovation that enables us to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 while maintaining energy reliability and affordability for the customers and communities we serve. PPL is a positive force in the cities and towns where we do business, providing support for programs and organizations that empower the success of future generations by helping to build and maintain strong, diverse communities today. Understands big picture concepts and provides leadership to junior team members.

Financial Analyst EU

The Financial Analyst will prepare and deliver well-constructed business insights to management, lead teams on select project assignments, and enhance the overall organizational understanding of financial concepts and their impact on business decisions. Job Description

Description

As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purposely-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade and we are growing our company and capabilities. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day, and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge. Come join us as we lead energy, together.

Constellation has been the leader in carbon-free energy production for more than a decade, and generates 50% more clean, carbon-free electricity than any other company in America. We're generating power 24/7 with the nation's largest emission-free nuclear energy fleet, providing enough clean energy to power 15 million homes. Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build, and power a successful career.

TOTAL REWARDS

Constellation offers a wide range of benefits and rewards, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick days; and much more.

Expected salary range of $110,700 to $123,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k).




PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

This position has a unique blend of business and financial analysis, reporting, and relationship management within the Chief Information Officer’s (CIO) Strategy Enablement organization. Lead and perform support activities for Strategic Vendor Management Office (SVMO) which sets and drives the standards and processes with the focus on operational execution, governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple Strategic Partners (SPs). Build and maintain relationships with SPs, Constellation IT Service Delivery, and supporting organizations to deliver high-quality IT services within a risk managed environment.

Perform detailed analysis and prepare comprehensive reports/charts/graphs to support business operations. Conduct complex modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, and other general financial and operational analysis. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information on operational scorecards and/or service level agreements (SLAs). Support the design, development and implementation of digital technology and automation related to our data collection, analysis, and presentation processes.

PRIMARY DUTIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Lead the Financial Services function:

Ensure financial adherence to the contractual terms and conditions. Support organizational studies, research, and initiatives that could potentially improve operations and/or result in cost reductions.

Deliver a flexible consumption model able to support the changing needs of the business, provide on-demand spend analysis, administer consistent change request process, track savings, validate accuracy and timeliness of invoice submissions, develop, and maintain an innovation program, and sustainment and continuous improvement activities related to Management Model core functional processes.

Compliance & Oversight: Development and implementation of program financial processes (service fee credits, accruals, invoicing) and procedures that support oversight, conform with financial policies, and support auditing. Serve as liaison between Finance, IT Service Delivery leads, Accounting, Supply, and external vendors on a day-to-day basis for program related financial inquiries. Maintain strong relationships with external vendor administrative personnel in Finance, Accounting, Supply, and IT Service Delivery, ensuring adherence to contractual terms.
Financial Planning & Analysis: Lead development of forecast and Long-Range Plan (LRP) outsourcing cost for IT Strategic Partnering Program (SPP); determining and communicating projections in accordance with contractual terms. Manage the delivery of key program metrics and information supporting audit request, benchmarking, cost, and resources for IT senior leadership, business office, and portfolio owners.
New Business Valuation: Collaborate with Finance and IT Business Office to construct business cases, obtain funding authorization, and manage project implementation budget for outsourcing initiatives. Lead cross functional teams through the development and implementation of program processes.
Data Analytics and Reporting Services: Perform detailed analysis and reporting in support of business operations for the SVMO which governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple SPs. Develop models depicting trends and projections that are translated into analytical information for business stakeholders. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information related to operational performance. Develop and maintain various reports/charts/graphs.
Financial Services: Lead performance measures with related financial impacts e.g. Credits/Earn Backs. Work in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP financial information as required.
Innovation Management: Lead the contractual innovation framework to drive innovation and continuous improvement. Effectively leverage the SPs’ capabilities to meet Constellation IT’s strategic objectives; ensures the SPs’ performance continuously improves throughout the term of the services and across all Constellation IT’s business units.
Support of Contract and Performance Services: Work collaboratively with IT SVMO Performance Lead on performance measures with related operational impacts e.g. KPIs/CPIs. Works in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP performance information as required.
Tools and Reporting Automation and Continuous Improvement: Work with internal and external organizations to develop tracking and reporting mechanisms to provide multi-dimensional views of financial data. Drive continuous improvement through the design, development and implementation of digital scorecards and dashboards. Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and drive self-service reporting.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 5 to 8 years experience in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel to retrieve and analyze data in support of business needs.
“Tech Savvy” - Able to leverage technology to solve business problems with proficiency with specialized business technologies (Power BI and other MS development tools).
Ability to provide in-depth analysis analytical and statistical problem solving, financial and business analysis.
Comprehensive knowledge of the practices, procedures, and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and complex problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action.
Strong leadership, organizational, and project management skills.
Excellent writing skills, as well as excellent written and oral presentation and communications skills.
Strong emotional intelligence, including a demonstrated ability to manage confidential, sensitive, or proprietary information in a discreet and professional manner.
Ability to navigate/build relationships and to collaborate at all levels across the organization.
Ability to build consensus, find common ground, and influence outcomes.
Strong initiative, with self-drive and ability to independently manage time, priorities, and deadlines.
Flexible and comfortable navigating through ambiguity or shifting priorities.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of 8 or more years of relevant experience in IT or a business area performing financial activities.
Graduate degree
Demonstrated experience performing vendor management with outsourcing agreements and associated operational processes.
Financial and contractual acumen and negotiation skills
Proficiency with MS 365 Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Teams)

Job Title: Vice President of National Accounts - Food and Hospitality
Job Description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Regional Vice President, this Vice President of Operations (VPO) is responsible for the overall operation of multiple accounts or a significant multi-site account normally generating $100M+ in revenue. This individual will be accountable for galvanizing a team under a common growth and operations platform, and ultimately drive improvement in operational efficiency, revenue, margin, and client retention for each account in the overall portfolio. The VPO will work to continuously ensure the organization is delivering operational excellence, while also identifying innovative and creative services and solutions to expand on our clients' requirements, working closely with internal and external partners. The incumbent of this position will develop and maintain the overall strategy, priorities and direction for operations within the area.

Job Responsibilities

Manage all facets of the area including sales, finance, human resources, and customer service including full P&L accountability.

Drive new sales growth within existing client base and ensure the delivery of exceptional customer service to our clients.

Develop short- and long-term operational strategies in partnership with senior team members and lead the design, development, and execution of those strategies to achieve measurable outcomes in a timely, cost-effective manner.

Lead and manage a highly productive, motivated and driven team through strong communication, empowerment, reward, and coaching techniques. Maintain close working relationships with partner group in functional areas, including Sales, Human Resources, Finance, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Compliance.

Partner with the business unit leaders and other key stakeholders to inspire change and implement new business processes.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree required, master's degree desired

Minimum of 10-12 years of progressive responsibility, successful experience in general management with full P&L responsibility; food, facilities, or retail service sector preferred.

Proven leadership and experience with managing effective client relationships that are high, wide and deep.

Demonstrated leadership skills including broad knowledge of management practices and good business analysis/project management skills.

Demonstrated ability to grasp a large, complex, global business at a base level and use this understanding to set overall strategy and drive business process improvement.

Adept business savvy to effectively communicate and work with other executives in support of achieving business and systems goals.

Strong business planning skills to complete strategic projects with implications for business areas with rapidly evolving business processes. Must possess a balanced perspective on strategic and tactical issues.

Proven ability to manage numerous projects, as well as resources, remotely in a highly dispersed organization.

Established ability to select top talent and create a productive environment that promotes initiative, innovation, continuous learning, and development of key leaders for future advancement.

Excellent communication and presentation skills with a range of audiences including clients, front-line managers, and C-level leaders.

Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

The Sales Operations Analyst plays an integral part in helping senior management understand how to scale the sales organization and drive incremental revenue and growth opportunities. They are responsible for collaborating across the business with the broader sales enablement team, data and analytics team, sales team, product, marketing, finance, and external parties such as consultants to analyze, create, and/or provide sales data and analytics.

Specific responsibilities include but not limited to:

Work with Head of Distribution and finance partners to develop revenue metrics and targets to monitor sales-effectiveness.
Works with sales management to define opportunities and support business decisions by providing primary and secondary research support.
Lead Sales Intelligence effort to gather insights by collecting and compiling data from different sources, including CRM systems, marketing automation platforms, social media networks, and public records to provide meaningful sales intelligence around overall market opportunities.
Conducts research and gathers information and data from internal and external sources to identify market opportunities and prospects.
Works with marketing to provide lead lists applicable to sales campaigns and analytics/lead scoring as campaigns are running and leads are being funneled to sales representatives.
Leverages AUM and HR database resources to provide RFP response information and/or consultant database responses as needed.
Compiles economic and historical data for use in management forecasting and planning.
Manage and maintain sales territory data inclusive of market opportunity.
Create ad hoc reports (potentially integrating data from multiple sources) to address the one-off information needs of the business as they arise.
Strong collaboration with the data and analytics team, Sales Enablement CRM Coordinator, and sales leadership around reporting, forecasting, and pipeline management.
Assist with maintaining the functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, and ensuring data integrity throughout our CRM system.
Partner with sales leadership to build a territory management and account planning process to optimize performance of sales reps and align sales rep coverage to geographic opportunities.
Develop and track meaningful and relevant sales enablement analytics such as win rate and close rate and provide meaningful insights to sales leaders so they can identify areas to improve sales performance.
Identify KPIs to measure sales efficiency and help identify bottlenecks in sales process and opportunities to streamline processes and automate manual tasks.
Evaluate new technologies and act as a liaison to vendors and various levels of management.

Basic qualifications:

Three to Five years-experience in the financial services industry working in Sales, Account Management, and/or Marketing department.
Experience in B2B Sales Operations.
Asset Management experience a plus.
Well-developed analytical, mathematical, and research skills.
Proven experience combining data from multiple sources to produce reports and analysis.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (macros, VLOOKUP’s, etc.).
Familiarity with Government and municipal sales strategies preferred.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Job Title: Technical Manager of Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms
Job Description:
Job Description
Job Title: Technical Manager Analytics and Business Intelligence Platform
Location: Corporate
Department: Information Technology
Job Summary:
The Technical Manager for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platform will be is responsible for the overall delivery of a robust and reliable analytics and business intelligence platforms and solutions for Wawa. The Tech Manager will be responsible for delivering analytics processes from data collection in the presentation layer, analysis, visualization and reporting. Partner and provide all areas of the business with robust, accurate data to drive fast decision making. Manage technical projects through the full development lifecycle (idea to delivery) as well as the daily support operations of the team.
Principal Duties:
Direct the efforts of the team to select/optimize technology (hardware and software) to minimize total cost of ownership while meeting business objectives and architecting for future growth.
Execute the strategic vision for analytics platforms within the organization, aligning it with business objectives and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Manage evaluation and selecting suitable analytics platforms based on the organization's needs, goals, and technical requirements and sunset platforms that are not used.
Manage and architect the implementation and integration of analytics platforms within the organization's infrastructure, including data sources, databases, and other relevant systems.
Oversee technical support and training to users of the analytics platform, ensuring they have the necessary skills and knowledge to effectively use the tools and features.
Oversee the regular maintenance, performance monitoring, and updates of the analytics platform, including installing patches, bug fixes, and software upgrades.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and developing reports, dashboards, and visualizations to analyze data and communicate insights effectively.
Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and implementing measures to protect sensitive data.
Facilitate collaboration between various teams and stakeholders, such as data scientists, business analysts, and executives, to align analytics initiatives with business objectives.
Identify opportunities for performance optimization, data efficiency, and scalability of the analytics platform, and implementing relevant improvements.
Develop analytics platform to generate complex reporting to help the business understand trends and derive insights using advanced analytical models and techniques using tools such as SQL, Python, or other relevant programming languages.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business problems, formulate hypotheses, and design experiments to test and validate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in analytics, and recommend innovative approaches to enhance the organization's analytical capabilities.
Provide thought leadership and act as a subject matter expert in business intelligence solutions integrating into the organization along with architecture guidance, advising senior management on data-driven decision-making processes and opportunities for growth.
Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning within the analytics team, promoting professional development and knowledge sharing.
Stay current on broad technology trends particularly advanced analytics, business intelligence, Cloud data warehousing, analytics governance and mobility.
Play a key role in developing an enterprise-wide analytics/ reporting/ business intelligence roadmap.
Define 7x24x365 production support for Analytics platform. Work with Service and Engagement teams to resolve issues that interrupt business operations. Escalate critical production issues as necessary to drive timely and effective resolution.
Develop usage metrics to determine adoption and most effective strategies and tactics for achieving high levels of business user engagement and satisfaction.
Work with the Cloud/ Infrastructure service team to manage hardware and capacity. Review and manage team to implement and manage retention procedures.
Work with Security team to identify and address security risks related to the security audit requirements. Assess and determine ways to mitigate risk and manage issues.
Plan, organize, monitor and deliver several projects simultaneously. Develop project plans to ensure effective execution and to achieve the business objectives. Direct administration of project contracts, project finances, quality metrics and personnel. Establish project scope and objectives and manage expectations to ensure a high level of satisfaction and delivery.
Manage business intelligence deliverables to include software selection and implementation. Research and provide recommendations regarding product functionality and technical architecture. Partner with PMO as necessary on big data and business intelligence projects.
Establish and maintain internal business relationships across all levels. Understand business and departmental technology requirements and offer appropriate solutions. Develop and maintain external business relationships with service providers. Manage and initiate vendor selection and contract enforcement.
Provide overall direction and support for team and monitor and assess individual work in accordance with high standards of excellence. Provide feedback, coaching, support, and opportunities for development, complete performance appraisals, take corrective action when appropriate, and participate in hiring decisions.
Essential Functions:
Exhibit Wawa values and a high degree of professionalism and confidentiality
Handle multiple priorities simultaneously and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Ability to be hands on and create or analyze comprehensive reports
Embrace DE&I and maintain a positive environment, Drive creativity, and teamwork
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Engineering field preferred
Experience in managing, and implementing 7x24x365 e-commerce analytics offering
Minimum of 12 years previous working experience in IT with 10+ years of experience in BI/Analytics Tech delivery and managing 3-4 BI leads
Experience in working with and managing teams that are both local and global
Hands on experience in Microstrategy, Thoughtspot, Tableau and SAP Analytics platform and are highly preferred
Knowledge of Cloud Data platform, and Business Intelligence tools and solutions strongly preferred
Strong knowledge of Enterprise Data Warehousing, Data Analytics and Data Governance required
Knowledge of Wawa stores or retail/e-commerce business flows and operations are beneficial
Prior applications development experience leveraging a software development lifecycle methodology is a must
Wawa will provide reasonable accommodation to complete an application upon request, consistent with applicable law. If you require an accommodation, please contact our Associate Service Center at
asc@wawa.com
or 1-800-444-9292.
Wawa, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Wawa maintains a work environment in which Associates are treated fairly and with respect and in which discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. In accordance with federal, state and local laws, we recruit, hire, promote and evaluate all applicants and Associates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, familial status, marital status, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Unlawful discrimination will not be a factor in any employment decision.

Overview
Who We Are

For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers

What We Do

Collateral Operations Group Overview
The Collateral Operations group is a global team within the Global Operations & Technology division of BNY Mellon responsible for supporting our clients’ collateral and portfolio reconciliations processes. Our clients include pension funds, endowments, mutual funds, hedge funds and other financial institutions using derivatives to manage their financial risks. We provide processing, inquiry and general support for our clients while working to improve and automate transaction processing systems. We are a center of excellence maximizing specific knowledge around the collateralization of complex derivative products, including swaps, options, forwards, and futures.

Collateral Operations Analyst Role Overview
As a Collateral Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for providing the collateral and portfolio reconciliation support as outlined above to clients on a daily basis. Apart from the daily collateral activities, you will also partner with senior colleagues to identify, develop and implement process changes, and be actively involved in contributing to broader strategic team objectives.

Role-Specific Responsibilities
Performs exchange traded, cleared and bilateral reconciliations for derivative products traded by our clients.
Monitoring collateral calls from counterparties.
Facilitating margin dispute resolution between parties.
Verifying delivery of collateral to clients and brokers.
Applies expertise and judgement in providing quality, and complex client service and support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including phone interaction, problem resolution, transaction processing, reconciliations and accounting services, and updates to client accounts in a timely manner.
Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. Conducts independent analysis and policy interpretation. Performs complex, manual processing of updates to client accounts or company records. Responsible for reconciliations, including reconciling cash breaks, position differences, and gathering and compiling data.
Serves as the primary point of contact for clients and executes all correspondent requisites in a timely and accurate manner with an understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs.
Provides product knowledge and technical assistance, determining when the more complex problems should be referred to a supervisor or senior professional.
Review and check work of other Client Processing Support staff and help resolve escalated issues.
Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.

Standard Job Responsibilities
Works with external clients to resolve day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Works effectively with peers across geographic regions.
Supports clients in addressing operational and technical questions or issues and ensuring requests are executed.
Applies problem solving skills based on precedence and experience.
Uses communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides clients information related to BNY Mellon products and services representing a limited number of lines of business and geographies and directs them to the appropriate resources, as needed.
Leverages a general understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings.
Monitors client inquiries and appropriately escalates non-routine or complex issues to the appropriate team member, as needed.
Tracks and follows up on open items and activities to accurate completion.
Participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience.
Supports a selected number of client accounts of limited complexity.
Involvement in technology projects and enhancements related to our collateral infrastructure.
Contributing to on-going projects, testing and continuous process improvement.
Participates in the onboarding of new clients and new business.
No direct reports.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Up to three (0-3) years of total work experience is preferred.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services is preferred.
Experience and knowledge in derivatives, reconciliations, brokerage, trade, settlements and cash processing are all skills transferrable to this role but not a barrier to entry as on-the-job product training will be available.
Process-mindset and an interest in solving complex problems, performing reconciliations, and finding ways to make processes better.
Interest in advancing technical knowledge specific to derivative and collateral product knowledge.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in high-pressure environment.

Employer Description:
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.

EEO Statement:
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Location: Harrisburg, PA

Position Type: Contract

Position Term: 6-12 Months

The primary objective of this engagement is for the selected candidate to serve as one of the Health Business Analyst / Health Business Intelligence Analyst (HBA / HBIA ) that will be responsible for discovery and requirement sessions with various stakeholders along with analysis of data from disparate systems, including internal and external data. the Director for Public Health Data Modernization.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills to be able to interact with all levels of the Department.
Strong analytical skills with significant experience in data analysis and manipulation
Experience writing functional requirements.
Ability to communicate and present results with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to draft current and future workflows of data flows for presentations with various stakeholders.
Based on data analysis needs, works with various stakeholders to obtain inputs and feedback on final engagement outputs.
Experienced in documenting data and metric definitions and rules.
Experience maintaining a data catalogue is preferred.
Understating of relational databases and experience with transformations and data mappings.
Ability to interpret data from multiple data sources and develop findings and recommendations.
Experienced in consolidating internal and external data to explore patterns and improve outcomes.
Knowledge of Enterprise Data Warehouse and Date Maturity Model preferred.
Experience with reporting and dashboarding tools, Tableau or Power BI preferred.
Review priority health systems to assess if there is a streamlined process to correct errors and adequate data quality measures.
Identify gaps in data required for analysis and interoperability with healthcare IT systems that provide data to the Department for each of the public health surveillance systems.
To improve transparency and trustworthiness, develop a centralized, digital approval process for dashboards and prepared datasets that are made available external to the program areas that ensure the data source, analysis methods, primary point of contact, date of last update, and frequency of updates are documented and readily available to the users of the data.

Skills

Business Analysis. Required 4 years.
Data Analysis. Required 4 years.
Data Flow Process. Required 4 years.
Requirements Definition. Required 4 years.
Experience with reporting and dashboarding tools (such as Tableau or Power BI) Required 4 years.
Knowledge of SharePoint
Experience working with Health related data

Job Title: Operations Analyst II - Revenue Cycle - Chargemaster
Company Name: Universal Health Services, Inc. - Corporate Office
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Growing steadily since its inception into an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, annual revenues were $11.6 billion in 2020. In 2021, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; in 2020, ranked #281 on the Fortune 500; and listed #330 in Forbes ranking of U.S.’ Largest Public Companies. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has 89,000 employees and through its subsidiaries operates 26 acute care hospitals, 334 behavioral health facilities, 39 outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located in 38 U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom.


The UHS Corporate Business Office is seeking a dynamic and talented Operations Analyst - Revenue Cycle Chargemaster.


The Operations Analyst - Revenue Cycle Chargemaster participates in the enhancement of charge description master (CDM) activities via the integrated revenue cycle applications. Reviews and optimizes organizational CDM structures to ensure that CDMs accurately reflect services and supplies provided and are consistent with current industry best practices.


Key Responsibilities include:
Performs annual, quarterly, and regular CDM maintenance activities. Performs the analysis and maintenance of changes in CPT, HCPCS, and Revenue Codes for accuracy, compliance with applicable billing guidelines, and optimization of reimbursement. Maintains internal maintenance audit logs. Manages communications of CDM maintenance to hospital staff and others as appropriate.
Keeps current with regulatory requirements related to CDM activities, i.e. reading Federal Register, CMS Transmittals, payer manuals, etc. Incorporates requirements into the CDM.
Participates in CDM audit activities, charge capture audit activities, and EMR charge capture build audit activities.
Reviews assigned tickets and responds with audit, research, maintenance, etc. Collaborates with others within the department, external departments, and the hospitals. Keeps ticket que and resolution timelines in line with standards.


Qualifications:
Experience & Knowledge:
An Associate's degree is required; however, significant (3+ relevant) years of experience will be accepted in lieu of education.
The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in healthcare billing and charge methodology, CPT HCPCS coding and medical terminology.
Skill set should include professional written and verbal communication skills, critical thinking, and computer literacy.
The ability to meet deadlines and multitask is necessary.

This opportunity provides the following:
Challenging and rewarding work environment
Growth and development opportunities within UHS and its subsidiaries
Competitive Compensation
Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plan
401k plan with company match
Generous Paid Time Off

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence - Media Analytics
Job Description:
Company Description


PHM is the leading health media agency in the US. We are designed for—and dedicated to—delivering best-in-class solutions that connect people with meaningful health and wellness solutions every day. Guided by our genuine passion for health and wellness, our work across the entire media ecosystem helps real patients navigate the most pivotal moments of their healthcare journeys.

While we have grown to be the No. 1 agency in our industry, at heart we’re still a startup. It’s that energy and spirit of innovation that allows us to create bold and meaningful “health media firsts” for our clients, and to do it all with #phmlove.



Job Description


The Senior Analyst of Business Intelligence (hereafter “BI”) will apply their experience in data analysis to support the BI Team in conjunction with Media and Strategy counterparts in delivering all client and publisher reporting needs. The Senior Analyst will be responsible for mastering the various data sources at the disposal of the BI team to create dashboards for the purpose of analyzing media/marketing campaigns and translate those learnings into business implications for our clients. Senior Analysts will help train new team members and manage workload of the greater Analyst/Senior Analyst Team to ensure all work is completed in a timely manner.

Candidate will have excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, outstanding business acumen, intense curiosity and superior verbal/written communications skills. The successful candidate will be a self-starter that is adaptable, exhibits strong attention to detail, and has an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

Key Responsibilities

While every engagement is unique, typical engagements require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:

Ensure all data is accurately reflected in all reporting tools through quality assurance process
Regularly engage with data partners to prepare data and proactively identify and resolve issues including data inaccuracies or discrepancies
Assist with the creation of measurement plans outlining strategy and tactics required to assess brand performance
Assist with collecting market and industry research to provide performance benchmarks, industry updates, market scans, top-line summaries and client reports
Synthesize media campaign data available into insights/recommendations about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (most likely healthcare professionals, patients/prospects, or a combination of the two)
Work with the BI Leadership to utilize the aforementioned insights/recommendations as the foundation for presentations, reports, and assorted client deliverables
Maintain professional relationships with internal (PHM) stakeholders by communicating effectively and delivering on all data needs for which BI is responsible
Clear understanding and demonstrated ability to successfully coach entry level employees on basics of BI Reporting platforms including but not limited to:
Google Display & Video 360 (DCM)
Data Visualization tools (Datorama, Power BI, Tableau)
Search Ads 360/Adwords
Social Reporting (Facebook/Instagram/Twitter)
Web Analytics (Analytics360/Omniture)
Contribute to competitive analyses and best practice audits
Display ability to shift mindset in client/vendor/internal meetings from active listening to proactive participant, presenting new ideas and being able to generate personal POV on discussion topics
Ability to operate autonomously and manage multiple deliverables
Understanding of working within a matrixed organization and the ability to direct questions to the appropriate party necessary in order to quickly provide resolution to client issues/projects



Qualifications

Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to be both strategic and tactical
Ability to multi-task; ability to manage time, deadlines and prioritize work
Capacity to work independently and contribute to larger team initiatives
Understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customers
Superior skills with the following core competencies:
Time Management
Problem Solving
Quantitative Skills
Effective Communication
Intellectual Curiosity
Hands on experience with digital analytics tools (Google Analytics, Omniture)
Power user of MS Excel; Proficiency in Word and PowerPoint is required
Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques, segmentation, research, lifetime value and ROI a plus
Experience in program measurement (online and/or offline) and test design a plus

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required
2 to 3 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus)

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Vanguard’s Institutional Marketing team is looking for a Product Owner to lead the implementation and ongoing enhancements of our customer data and identity resolution platforms. The CDP/IDR Product Owner is responsible for optimizing the value and use of the Adobe Real Time CDP and IDR platforms by defining and prioritizing the features and functionality with our digital marketing, marketing technology and technical development teams. This position will also partner with a digital marketing team to enable omnichannel activations, analytics, personalization, retargeting, and remarketing strategies to position the organization for continued advancement of marketing effectiveness given the changing dynamic landscape of digital marketing.

A successful candidate will have marketing technology experience, will be results oriented and a creative problem solver who thrives on learning and team collaboration. This individual will lead the strategic vision and roadmap for a product or products within a specific business area, demonstrating a deep understanding of the product(s). Products may have enterprise-wide implications.

This role:

Build the overarching strategy and high-level plan for CDP and IDR implementation, ingestion from multiple data sources, customer profile synthetization into traits and audiences, journey orchestration and integration with downstream system in partnership with Marketing and IT.
Act as the Product Owner representing Vanguards Institutional marketing team for utilization of the customer data and identity resolution platforms. Maintain and prioritize a backlog of features for implementation.
Contribute to the creation of a robust segmentation and testing strategy aimed at personalizing the consumer experience (marketing teams will own the customer journey strategy and segmentation criteria).
Ensure the highest quality, performance, delivery, and availability standards are met. Manage multiple, concurrent initiatives in various phases of ideation, execution, or delivery.
Bring best practices and strategy for consumer data journey and overall orchestration by working with both internal resources, including the Marketing Technology Team, IT and outside professional services, as necessary, to execute omni channel use cases.
Work with Marketing Analysts, Data Engineering, Data Science and other cross functional teams to define requirements for data and analytics solutions.
Understand consumer privacy regulations like CCPA and work with legal, engineering and marketing teams to ensure that consent and permissions are updated in the platform when needed.
Regularly present and communicate findings to senior leadership in a clear and compelling way.

What it takes:

Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required.
Minimum of 3 years of related work experience including experience with multiple components of the marketing technology stack including personalization, segmentation, campaign and data orchestration, etc. is required. At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering
Experience leading the implementation and management of Adobe’s Real Time CDP, or similar platforms such as, Segment, Tealium, Amperity and SAP.
Expert in leading components of large scale, high volume, real-time customer centric applications and digital infrastructure.
Understanding of related technologies, such as data management platforms, data lakes, and marketing automation tools.
Curious and shows high level of comfort in situations of ambiguity.
Proven track record working with diverse cross-functional teams and vendors. Adept at guiding groups with divergent opinions towards a unifying decision, drawing upon data to ground decision making.
A structured problem solver who can use technical aptitude, cross functional communication skills and results focus to align a broad set of stakeholders on solutions.
Comfortable thinking big and connecting the dots to align our product direction with the strategic goals of our business.
Can communicate complex ideas clearly, regardless of audience.
Not afraid to take a deep dive into metrics and data, whether it’s to diagnose a problem, evaluate a solution or propose a new KPI. Should have experience using analytic tools and querying data tables with basic SQL.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Position Overview:

The Sales Tax Analyst is responsible for managing and executing all aspects of sales tax compliance and research within our organization. This role involves ensuring the accurate calculation, reporting, and filing of sales tax across various jurisdictions, staying updated on tax laws and regulations, and assisting with tax audits. The Sales Tax Analyst plays a key role in minimizing tax liability through informed application of tax laws and regulations, and effective tax planning.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and file timely and accurate sales tax returns in multiple jurisdictions.
Review and reconcile sales tax accounts and ensure accurate general ledger entries.
Analyze and interpret sales data to calculate tax owed and ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Stay informed of changes in tax laws and regulations and assess their impact on the company's operations and tax compliance.
Collaborate with internal departments, such as finance and legal, to understand business practices and identify tax-related issues.
Assist in managing and responding to sales tax audits, including gathering and preparing necessary documents and data.
Research tax issues and provide guidance and recommendations on tax matters to internal stakeholders.
Develop and implement tax compliance policies and procedures to streamline processes and ensure accuracy.
Provide training and support to other staff members on sales tax issues and processes.
Work with external tax advisors and consultants as needed.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field; CPA or advanced degree in taxation is a plus.
2-4 years of experience in sales tax, tax compliance, or a related field.
Strong understanding of sales tax laws and regulations.
Proficiency in tax software and Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Capacity to manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Westmoreland County Community College is seeking qualified candidates for a full-time Functional Analyst/Academics position. There is flexibility to work remote 2 days/week. On-site presence required minimum of 3 days/week.

The Functional Analyst for Academics is responsible for providing support in advancing innovative, efficient, and effective technology solutions to assist the College in meeting its academic goals. This position will serve as a vital member of the College team leading the business process redesign project based on future state of the college processes that pertain to the new ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system.

The annual salary for this position is $48,003. We offer an excellent benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive PPO Medical plan with minimal bi-weekly contributions
Dental, Vision, Life and long-term disability benefits at no monthly premium cost to the employee
Generous paid time-off benefits including vacation, personal days, sick days, and paid holidays
403(b) Retirement Plan with a 10% employer contribution

**To be considered for this position, please submit an application directly on our applicant portal at https://employment.westmoreland.edu/.**

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: JOB SPECIFIC

Research, implement, document, test, and maintain administrative software solutions including but not limited to enterprise software and third party solutions that stand alone and integrate with the new ERP.
Translate user requirements into designs and specifications to develop queries and reports, and retrieve and present data using the ERP, business intelligence, and data analysis software.
Serve as an interface between functional users and technical resources, coordinating with technical resources to resolve system problems.
Research, test and implement software systems, assuring functionality that meets user expectations.
Meet regularly with the VP of Academic Affairs, VP of Enrollment Management, Director of Information Technology, and collaborate with the other Functional Analysts.
Serve as a member of the College's Data Entry Standards team.
Develop and document improved business processes to promote efficiency, greater productivity, and support operational decision making related to the Academic Affairs division.
Analyze the impact on business processes resulting from implementation, updates, and upgrades of the system. Ensure business processes change, when necessary, to align with best practices and keep the software systems as standardized as possible for minimal changes during upgrades/enhancements.
Coordinate technology-related projects within the Academic Affairs division.
Function as a "power user" skill level in the ERP and other related software related to academics.
Serve as an interface between and the College's technology teams, business units, academic divisions, faculty, administration, and support units.
Oversee technical troubleshooting and training efforts for the Academic Affairs division.
Provide training for constituents (students, staff, and faculty) on ERP software and other related technologies and processes.
Develop and maintain a thorough knowledge of the college's technical capabilities and available functional and technical resources; make recommendations on enhancements when necessary.
Develop and maintain student system documentation.
Assure compliance with established federal, state, local, institutional and departmental policies, procedures and standards related to data integrity, academic standards, computer usage, etc.
Adhere to federal, state and local regulations as they pertain to maintaining the security and confidentiality of all student records, as well as maintain the confidentiality of other documents on behalf of the division and the college.
Maintain data integrity and communicate procedural issues to campus leadership for resolution as necessary.
Create and maintain a high-level policy and procedure documentation
Work in cooperation with the Academic Affairs division in preparing support data for internal and external reports for federal, state and local use.
Work with colleagues across the college to ensure systems, both processes and technology, integrate appropriately and that changes that impact other areas are done collaboratively.
Manage multiple priorities and projects, consistently meeting deadlines.

QUALIFICATIONS - EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/TRAINING

Associate degree in a related field (Bachelor’s degree preferred).
Three to five years of related work experience (a primary focus on high quality, innovative service delivery, data management, and analysis)
Higher education experience is preferred.
Experience with MS Excel and possess data analytical skills. Preferred experience in Power BI.
Experience working with functional and technical aspects of student information systems required.
Evidence of project management skills is required.

Successful candidate will be required to obtain/provide the following clearances prior to hire:

PA Child History clearance
PA Criminal Record Check clearance
FBI Federal Criminal History Record
