Job Title: Data Analyst I / Portfolio Analyst I, Data Operations
Job Description:
CardWorks Servicing ("CWS") is one of the largest privately-held provider of outsourcing services for bankcard-related products to banks and non-bank lenders in North America. CWS offers management expertise across the credit spectrum and supports both MasterCard and Visa accounts as well as a variety of private label debit, credit, stored value, and customer bankcards.

Position Summary:
This position provides programming and analytical support to the firm. The primary responsibilities include report creation, code design, application design and support and the auditing of various portfolio management procedures.

Essential Functions:

Works with business teams to understand business use cases, requirements and translate business requirements into data requirements.
Design, develop, test, and deploy ELT programs to extract, stage, cleanse, transform and load the data needed.
Creates and manages SAS/Python Code to facilitate account level bank procedures, reporting requests and data validations
Troubleshoots, maintains, and supports the warehouse and the downstream data feeds sent to consuming applications.
Conducts testing methodologies, ongoing analysis, and reporting of assigned procedures and protocols
Ensures proper execution of all ad hoc and production code, following and completing proper documentation
Assists other departments as needed with respect to data and reporting requests
Performs other duties as assigned
Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field required or four (4) years of related experience accepted in lieu of required education
One (1) year of related programming and/or analytical experience required
Firm background and experience in logical programming languages including SAS/SQL, Python, R, Visual Basic, C++, C#, Java and or other related language required
Experience in scripting languages: Python, SQL
Experience working with Analytics Databases like Snowflake, Redshift preferred
Summary of Qualifications:

Strong analytical skills with the ability to organize and manipulate complex datasets accurately
Able to pay close attention to details while maintaining a good focus on the big picture
Strong organization skills and problem solving skills
Effective communication/presentations skills (both verbal and written)
Demonstrated proficiency in project management, test design and execution
We are an equal opportunity employer, and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. Job Title: Business Analytics Lead Analyst (Actuarial Data Strategy & Solutions - Repricing)
Job Description:
Summary

We are seeking a self-motivated and inquisitive business analytics professional with a strong desire to learn to join our team. This individual should be a team player who enjoys working in a dynamic environment.

As part of Actuarial Data Strategy & Solutions, the Repricing team supports Cigna's pre-sale and re-sale process and is responsible for medical claim repricing analysis and RFP responses typically related to network financial information such as network discounts, medical utilization statistics and medical trend.

This role will support the development and analysis of Cigna's repricing data, tools and methodology. This position will also develop and maintain internal analysis and reporting to assist management in data review and will also participate in projects and ad-hoc analysis as needed.

Responsibilities

Respond to Medical claim re-pricings and RFP requests

Verify appropriateness of results and ensure accuracy of data analysis and reporting by creating appropriate data checks and internal review documents and tools

Conduct audits to ensure financial controls are maintained

Create, modify, and maintain SAS/SQL coding to accommodate data requests and changes

Create, modify, and maintain databases and reporting tools (Excel and Access). Recommend improvements in financial reporting systems as appropriate

Develop new tools and reports and review existing tools and reports to account for evolving business needs, including implementing process changes to optimize efficiency and results using automation where appropriate

Perform research and analysis of key drivers and changes and communicate results to project lead and management

Sales Development Analyst

Stanley

Location: Pittsburgh, PA




About Us:

Stanley, a HAVI company, is defined by Creativity, Building and Invention. We are makers of the legendary bottle and box. Driven by purpose, passion, and performance. Position overview:

Looking to be part of a Legendary Brand? Are you ready to go big, and to create a better world? The Stanley sales team is growing and we are looking for someone with entrepreneurial spirit and passion to help us tell our legendary story!


The Sales Development Analyst will build tools that level up the data that supports our Strategic Sales team. You will create dashboards, visualizations, and reports to make it easy for internal teams and external partners to see historical data and make informed decisions on the future direction of our business. You will play a critical role in helping our partners tell the Stanley story and in driving sales growth together.


This position will be based in Pittsburgh, PA and will travel 20% of the time. We may also consider candidates based in other parts of the Northeastern United States.


What You Will Do:

Create a standard set of data tools to provide easy visibility to sell through data and POS analytics using data from a variety of internal and external sources.
Perform analyses that ensure assortment planning aligns with category targets and business development activities.
Develop analyses based on market share and trend data to inform strategic sales decisions and promotional planning.
Create tools to identify on sales opportunities and work with the Sales team to create appropriate action plans.
Partner with the demand planning team to ensure accurate item level forecasts based on sales trends and projections.
Provide regular measures of brand penetration by geography that help the Sales team identify key markets/epicenters.
Works with Strategic Sales leaders to ensure planning and discussions with retail accounts are grounded in data.
Supports recurring activities across the Sales team, such as business planning, account inventory maintenance and account-level assortment planning.



About You:

An experienced analyst that has worked in market research, buying/replenishment, or customer analytics in the consumer products, retail, or food service industry.
A data expert that has proven success finding disparate information sources, joining the data to build dashboards and reports, and partnering with business leaders to surface insights and develop targeted action plans.
An excellent communicator, able to tell the story behind the data verbally and in writing; comfortable presenting data and findings to large cross-functional groups
Works independently, possesses the judgment to identify and complete critical work and has the organization skills to manage a wide range of deliverables



Requirements:

5+ years of experience as an analyst supporting sales, merchandising, or planning for a consumer products, retail, or food & beverage brand.
Bachelor’s degree in business, economics or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience
Strong analytical skills and the ability to create dashboards, reports, and analyses by synthesizing data from multiple sources.
Advanced Excel skills and proficiency with SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience with SPS Commerce or a similar cloud-based platform preferred.

AscellaHealth is looking for an Internal Sales Representative to be an essential part of the Sales and Business Development team. He/She/They will research, identify, profile, and develop prospects (Biotech/ Pharmaceutical Manufacturers and Payers) nationally and globally for the organization. This individual will help deliver strategic support in developing and implementing various sales strategies and tactics with a focus on supporting long-term growth and increasing awareness of AscellaHealth and its subsidiaries. This is a great opportunity for a motivated and talented individual to join a rapidly growing global organization, contributing directly to that growth by identifying key revenue targets.

This role is based at AscellaHealth’s headquarters in Berwyn, PA, and will be required to be in the office.

What the position will be doing

Develop in-depth knowledge of AscellaHealth products, services, and solution-based technologies.
Become knowledgeable on the brand guidelines for the AscellaHealth Family of Companies.
Research account profiles, mine and identify information/players, develop a plan to generate interest, and conduct an initial sales pitch.
Work with the Marketing Team to actively engage in lead generation through outbound calls, targeted email campaigns, prospecting, networking, and targeted social media activity.
Develop and execute call plans for targeted accounts.
Shepherd prospects through the process to demo and introductory meetings.
Develop meaningful relationships with customers to encourage trust and loyalty.
Establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through contact plans and touchpoints.
Build an understanding of client's needs and ensure the ability to answer questions and provide follow-up information.
Route qualified opportunities to the appropriate SMEs for further development and closure.
Provide support for RFI and RFP submissions as needed.
Track submitted proposals and provided feedback to management.
Attend bi-weekly BD meetings prepared to present updates on the assigned list of targeted pipeline opportunities.
Effectively communicate with all groups involved with the Sales and Business Development Pipeline.
Coordinate and arrange client events, meetings, appointments, and conferences.
Write and distribute agendas, proposals, cost estimates, and briefing documents for internal and external meetings.
Maintain accurate records and information on all customer activities in CRM.
Perform other related duties as assigned or as necessary; remain flexible and adaptable in work schedules and work assignments as defined by departmental and organizational needs.

Necessary Skills, Education & Abilities

Graduate of a 4-year degree program, or equivalent, focused on Business, Sales/Marketing, Finance, or a related field required.

Excellent business/ computer skills including, Outlook, Word, Excel, and virtual collaboration technologies, like MS Teams and Zoom.

Highly self-motivated with a strong initiative to lead projects and tasks.
Excellent, transparent, and persuasive communication and presentation skills.

Excellent analytical skills and the ability to provide solutions to complex problems.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills required.
A passionate and curious person who looks to continuously learn and embraces the adoption of new technologies that impact business, markets, and user experiences.

Our Story

AscellaHealth, a global Healthcare & Specialty Pharmacy solutions organization, serving patients, life sciences manufacturers, payers, and providers, offers a comprehensive portfolio of uniquely tailored, tech-enabled services supporting complex, chronic conditions or rare diseases that require specialty medications and/or cell and gene therapies. A recipient of numerous industry awards for innovation, and a NASP Strategic Channel Partner of the Year award winner, AscellaHealth’s best-in-class, patient-centric approach is built upon proprietary technology processes for novel programs and services to support the launch of specialty medications and proactively addresses multiple challenges, optimize clinical health outcomes, and improve quality of life for this patient population. Are you a motivated, out of the box thinker who is passionate about solving business problems with the latest construction technology? We are dedicated to the well-being of our associates and are proud to be consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work. Our compensation and benefits package not only supports our associates and their families but benefits local communities and communities around the world.

Ability to solve complex technical issues through root cause analysis

Ability to communicate effectively and build/foster relationships with other departments outside of IT (i.e. Safety, Legal, and Accounting)
The ability to anticipate needs at a high level and organize and plan accordingly

Be a visionary to take ARCO to the next level by being a self starter and identify where we could improve, make processes more efficient through technology

The Cyber Security Operations Analyst will play a significant role in our Security Operations Center team (SOC), reviewing and handling several security controls, and providing operational insight to complete review of Cyber threats.
Protecting the Bank ensures that we can deliver solutions securely protecting BBH’s digital assets and our clients.
Role Overview:
Day to day operations of BBH’s Cyber Intelligence Monitoring and Threat analysis.
Provide log analysis, real-time intrusion analysis, incident response, and security monitoring using a wide array of industry leading tools and technologies.
Investigating suspicious activities, alerts, and events detected by the security tools or reported by users and containing and preventing any potential incidents.
Analyzing and reporting on any information security issues, emerging trends, threats, and vulnerabilities affecting the organization or its industry.
Respond and perform analysis and risk assessment of all security events and incidents.
Provide related documentation in support of BBH regulatory guidelines (FFIEC, SOC2, NYDFS, etc.) and auditing initiatives.
Bi-weekly and Monthly reporting.
Key responsibilities include:
Cyber Security Operations Center
Maintain a working relationship with a 24x7 external cyber intelligence and threat monitoring service (MSSP) in support of our team.
Engage in security investigations and use tools to identify and report the outcomes of incidents to senior management.
Participate in discussions around security events and activities with various non-technical and technical parties.
Collaborate with various teams to manage security investigations and provide prevention solutions for cyber threats.
Follow the firm’s project management, SDLC disciplines to insure structured effectiveness in implementation and operations.
Vulnerability Management Program
Responsibilities in working with tools in for identifying the firm’s security vulnerabilities.
Troubleshoot and work with vendors in identifying security vulnerabilities.
Collaborate with application and operation system teams to remediate any security vulnerability findings.
Recommend, and apply best practices for addressing ongoing threats.
Security Operations and Response tools
Help support security tools that monitor the firm’s security configuration, changes, health, and baselines, such as SIEM, Anti-Virus and other cyber tools.
Respond to Endpoint protection and malware detection tools alerts following response templates.
Makes suggestions on tuning alert volumes.
Makes sure responses are remediated within SLA.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) or advanced degree highly desired.
3+ years of Cyber Security experience.
Relevant or similar work experience in some of the following areas:
Security Incident Response
Security Operations management and maintaining IT general controls
Malware analysis and remediation / Data Analysis
Designing and Operating enterprise security controls
Vulnerability & Patch management
Expertise with security assessment methodologies.
Some knowledge of networking protocols and related equipment.
Interest in packet analysis and forensic tools.
Familiar with Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Web Firewalls, Sandboxing, and other security tool terminology.
Interested in scripting with Bash, Batch, Perl, or Python.
Data Analysis using Excel.
Interest in Unix/Linux & Windows operating systems and privilege access.
Data analysis of various security logs.

Who We Are

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Description

As the Insurance Technology Analyst, you will be supporting the growth of Granular Insurance by performing business analysis functions on projects and processes within the company. These include projects in varying degrees of the project life cycle; from ideation, planning, execution, and maintenance. You will also help administer systems within Granular, including Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery data management and SQL processing, Salesforce.com or Google Workspace issues. You will be creating new business processes and adjusting existing ones by collaborating with Sales, Underwriting, Operational and other teams within Granular. You will also be working with a number of key stakeholders including company management, development partners, staff members, as well as the Verily technology teams supporting Granular.

To succeed in this role, you will need experience in building and fixing systems and processes. You will need to be able to work at a strategic level and in the details. You will need to feel comfortable working in a "start-up" environment where processes and systems still need to be defined and built. Understanding the data about our business is very important and you will need to be familiar with data definitions, analytics, and reporting.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams at Granular to meet project goals both as a participant and as a leader.
Create news processes and adjust existing processes by performing business analysis work and recommending changes to people, process and technology; use critical thinking skills to determine optimal business processes given the maturity of the organization while also understanding the business goals and timelines.
Administer processes and systems including Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery data management and operations, Salesforce, Google Workspace, Reporting system, and other internal needs; perform system testing on new functions and features of software, as well as coordinate User Acceptance Testing.
Ensure alignment on new technology efforts through effective requirements gathering, communications and change management processes; responsible for internal and external stakeholder communications, as well as detailing system and process documentation.
Work closely with various roles including project and product management teams to ensure the delivery of software aligns to corporate goals.
Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

Undergraduate degree (BA/BS).
3+ years of experience in business analysis, data management, project management, preferably within health insurance or technology.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written), analytical and presentation skills with outstanding attention to detail and ability to take initiative, build productive relationships and influence effectively across various levels of stakeholders.
Strong data, reporting and application skills.
Strong interpersonal skills with sensitivity to changing personalities and priorities.
Demonstrated ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define effective approaches and proactively overcome challenges.
Strong understanding of technology, preferably application development, workflow management, and enterprise architecture.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience in building solutions, including Salesforce.com, SQL management, Reporting systems.
Experience in building cloud-based software solutions.
Experience in managing data ETL processes and data reporting.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effect at communicating complicated technical concepts in simple ways for business teams.
Excellent project management skills.
Experienced in data analysis and reporting of insurance operations.
Experience managing processes independently with little oversight.
Experience participating in large cross-functional projects or implementations.

Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) that will play a pivotal role in transforming, organizing, and continuously improving quality system processes and information managed through global systems and tools that support the Quality Management System at Olympus. This role focuses on providing management insights, visibility, and governance to the quality system globally. The SME will collaborate closely with global project teams to ensure the fulfillment of stakeholder requirements. They will assist Global Process Owners (GPO) and the Project Management Office (PMO) in project management efforts to maintain schedules and ensure task completion. The role will be responsible for translating business needs into requirements, facilitating user validation, conducting end-user training, authoring system and process documentation, performing data analysis, and actively engaging with stakeholders.

Job Duties
Serves an as subject matter expert, understanding business requirements and technical capabilities of the business system tools to be developed or in use.
Conduct in-depth analysis of existing business processes, systems, and data to identify areas for improvement.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to extract, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to inform decision-making.
Collaborates with business users, internal technology teams across Olympus and vendors to establish and prioritize business and technology requirements.
Leads gathering and documenting business requirements with stakeholders globally.
Analyses the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; from a business and technology perspective to ensure the system design fits the needs of the users.
Translates business requirements into clear and comprehensive functional specifications that are understandable to the end-users.
Change agent to facilitate effective deployment of business systems. Work with and manage complex workflows as they pertain to business process.
Assists in the development of validation documentation (i.e., IQ, OQ, PQ, and UAT).
Provides training, guidance, and is a resource support for end users.
Supports defining project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.
All Other Essential Duties as assigned by Management.
Job Qualifications

Required:

BA/BS medical, engineering, scientific discipline.
5 years of related experience analyzing, clarifying, and translating business requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Experience supporting or working within a pharma, medical device, or any other regulatory controlled industry.
Background and familiarity with U.S. FDA QSR, requirements including ISO 9001, MDD 93/42, ISO 13485-2003, and Canadian Medical Device requirements.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Excel, data visualization tools); Competent understanding of International medical device regulations.
Competent with Microsoft Office 365 Suite, Visio, Adobe, DocuSign, Agile and Windows platforms.
Global working hours.


Preferred:

Black Belt / Green Belt, Continuous improvement techniques and/or demonstrated problem-solving and root cause techniques is a plus.
Industry certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA) are beneficial.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving driving proactive solutions.
Knowledge of business application testing approaches.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
A motivated self-starter that is able to work independently and in teams on tasks and projects with limited supervision.
Project management experience is a plus.

Mentor, guide and train team of sales analysts in providing sales support and relationship building. Evaluate the work of staff, provide guidance and coaching, establish individual goals and objectives. Manage performance to include conducting performance appraisals, partner with Human Resources to resolve employment related issues.

Thorough knowledge of cash management products, services and solutions (Required)

Ability to establish and maintain working relationships with internal and external partners (Required)

Position: Sales and Use Tax Analyst

Job Type: Full Time
Company Summary:

Montauk Renewables, Inc. (NASDAQ: MNTK) is a renewable energy company specializing in the management, recovery, and conversion of biogas into RNG. The Company captures methane, preventing it from being released into the atmosphere, and converts it into either RNG or electrical power for the electrical grid (“Renewable Electricity”). The Company, headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, has more than 30 years of experience in the development, operation, and management of landfill methane-fueled renewable energy projects. The Company has current operations at 15 operating projects located in California, Idaho, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, North Carolina, and Texas. The Company sells RNG and Renewable Electricity, taking advantage of Environmental Attribute premiums available under federal and state policies that incentivize their use.




Summary of Responsibilities:

Montauk Renewables, Inc. is hiring a Sales & Use Tax Analyst that is analytically minded, multi-tasking, highly organized who will be responsible for maintaining the Sales & Use Tax compliance process notices. Additional responsibilities include account reconciliations, state sales, and use registrations and other tax-related tasks. This position will require the incumbent to communicate with procurement and various other departments to create a streamlined process so that all invoices are reviewed for the proper tax exemption status. This position is based in Pittsburgh, PA and will work in a weekly hybrid environment with some in-office and remote capabilities.




Primary Responsibilities:

Assist in the creation of sales and use tax procedures company wide. Including working with A/P and other parties related to sales and use tax to establish company wide policies.
Ensure all sales and use tax filings are completed accurately and all filing deadlines are adhered to.
Assist Tax Manager with Sales and Use Tax audits including data collection, documentation, liaison with auditor.
Research various states sales and use tax guidelines and requirements for exemption.
Manage Tax Exemption Certificates.
Amend Sales & Use tax returns as needed
Prepare accrual for use tax account reconciliations and journal entries
Ensure timely and effective resolution for tax notices.
Knowledge of corporate accounting procedures and practices.
Other ad hoc sales and use tax related activities as needed.



Skills and Qualifications:

Strong computer skills, including Excel, and tax research software.
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 360 experience is preferred.
At least 4 year of sales and use tax experience.
Bachelor’s degree preferred.



Benefits

Full-Time employees are eligible for a strong benefits package including:
Medical, Dental and Vision
Flexible spending account
Paid time off
Long term disability, and life insurance
Retirement 401K
Pay is commensurate with qualifications



Montauk Renewables is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age. We are a drug free work environment based on Federal guidelines and use e-verify to confirm employment eligibility.

Univest Financial Corporation (UVSP), has approximately $7.8 billion in assets and $4.3 billion in assets under management (as of September 30, 2023). Headquartered in Souderton, Pa. and founded in 1876, the Corporation and its subsidiaries provide a full-range of financial solutions for individuals, businesses, municipalities and nonprofit organizations in the Mid-Atlantic Region. In 2022, Univest donated $2.5 million to our communities, and our employees volunteered more than 12,300 hours.

Seeking career-focused individuals, looking to bring passion and creativity to drive change. Job Title: Operational Excellence Asset Data Automation Manager
Job Description:
US-PA-Trexlertown (Corporate HQ) (0905)

Job Description and Qualifications

Air Products and Chemicals, Inc., a Fortune 500 manufacturer of industrial gases, has an immediate opening for an Operational Excellence Asset Data Automation Manager.

A key enabler to business growth is data integrity and digitization to complete Air Products’ large integrated projects globally, across all regions, seamlessly and effectively. As an owner-operator, it is business critical to operate these new assets most efficiently, using innovative data automation and digital twin technologies over the life of the asset.

This role provides leadership/expertise in the field of Operating asset data automation along with integration across the suite of tools Operations uses to safety and efficiently operate and maintain our equipment and systems. Partnering with the operating, maintenance and operations engineering organization, the position will lead all aspects of the definition and implementation of integrated tools, focusing initially on green field site large scale assets which used a data hub during project design and execution.

Dimensions:

The role’s objective is to provide global asset data automation requirements as well as continuous improvement of systems, tools, and processes to sustain Operational Excellence of the assets. While the role will focus initially on one large scale operations location, the individual will be developing the vision and road map for how digital twins and data hubs will be used and kept evergreen at other sites in the future.

The candidate must have prior experience in the systems and tools for an owner-operator organization. Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of typical O&M work processes and systems roadmap, integration, interfaces, and dependencies. This individual will collaborate closely with all key internal customers including Operations, Maintenance, Project, Operations Engineering/Technical Support, Training, EHS&Q, Digital Information Technology Management, Tools Suppliers, AP Engineering Organization, Commissioning, and Project Controls to develop the overall OpEx digital twin roadmap.

Principal accountabilities:

Responsible for all asset data automation-related activities for a green field complex operations site.
Work with Global Engineering organization and automation manager to enable handover of a data hub and develop a functioning digital twin for use by the AP O&M organization.
Work with Operational Excellence, Regional Operations technical support and Information Technology to identify the desired system automations between the new data hub and existing O&M data tools.
Develop definition and documentation of data requirements with Engineering and OpEx internal customers.
Support project IM managers to develop project specific IM plans and deliver IM scope on project.
Lead the asset data automation scope, services, budget, and schedule for OpEx data automation for each asset location which will receive a digital twin.
Maintain strong links with AP Digital Technology organization and strategic partners.
Keep aware of trends, best practices, and innovative information management in the process industries to enable the strategic vision to be regularly updated and extended.
Establish asset data automation work processes of change (MOC), work process definition and alignment will be critical to the success of the digital twin over the life of the asset.
Drive and implement strategic plan toward Vision of true “digital twin.”
Perform data integrity audits to ensure that data standards and nomenclature established are followed.
Ensure that the digital twin can be managed and updated by developing robust work processes for the asset undergoing change brought on by turn-arounds and debottleneck projects.
Ensure that required pre-qualifications of contractors/suppliers with respect to data automation capabilities are undertaken; integrate the technology needs of the project; propose/provide methods for connectivity and consulting to implement technology, if required
Advise joint- venture operating companies of which Air Products is a partner on whether to choose to adapt the data hub and develop a digital twin.
Implement standards and practices to enable project execution (work-sharing activities) and Electronic Data Interchange.
Critical competencies:
Strong organization and planning skills
Knowledge of key OpEx and O&M systems sourcing (Technology, Hexagon, Document Management System, Subcontract Management, Construction Management, Maintenance, Mechanical Integrity, Plant Data Historians and Data Visualization platforms)
Strong influencing, communication (written and verbal) and facilitative skills, including cross cultures and geographies
Business Analysis & Strategies to drive OpEx execution efficiencies.
Strong analytical, leadership, and facilitation skills
Experienced in functional matrix organization
Thorough understanding of data management, integrity, digitization, and dependencies
Preferred qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Engineering or Computational Sciences.
Min. 10 years relevant professional experience.
Experience in leading the asset data automation effort for large owner-operator in related industries.
Knowledge of the information flow between the operating asset various tools

This job will have the following responsibilities:

Provides advanced level systems quality assurance testing services. Implements and maintains new techniques and tools to improve the quality and efficiency of software development.
Automation and manual testing They will develop test strategy/plans (from end user requirements and use cases), design, implement and run automated/manual tests and work with developers / managers to ensure sufficient quality prior to release.

Create CRMA reports and dashboards.

Accountable for creating training deck associated with the process/service as required.
Work with team members for Salesforce release updates, and issue reporting
Communicate ideas and progressive thinking with your team.
User support tickets
Monitor and Improve adoption.

Operational Excellence

Documents, reviews, and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met.
Creates, tests, and refines assumptions and hypotheses through user research and testing.
Manage discovery, design confluence pages, host all the sprint orchestrations.
Creates, prioritizes, and accepts user stories; incorporate them into release planning.
Makes Salesforce.com product outcomes that inspire value daily.
Identifies pros, cons, issues, obstacles, dependencies, and value associated with features and enhancements.
Assess new methods and tools and provide management with updates and recommendations of changes to processes.
Lead standups, iteration planning sessions, product demos and retrospectives
Condenses complex technical concepts into non-technical language for your team.

Resources & Leadership

Manage Insights and plans for team members and management.
Gather and report important information from meetings with multiple partners.
Monitor deliverables and ensuring completion of project.

Your Skills and Experience

Required Education and Certifications:

BS/MS or equivalent education.
Salesforce Administrator certification preferred.
Business Analyst Certification preferred.

Required Experience

2-3 years of experience in Salesforce Business Analyst within a life sciences, services company, or related consulting firm
Participate requirement elicitation, analysis, validation, and scoping.
Examine data and draw business/system insights.
Work with Project Manager to communicate with the partners throughout each project.
Lead requirements gathering sessions to capture functional requirements.
Map functional requirements to Salesforce functionality.
Work with Salesforce team and partners to create user stories in the development backlog.
Own our development backlog and facilitate quarterly planning sessions with partners.

Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile inconsistency, and break down high-level information into details.

Experience with DevOps tools.

Project management experience. PMI certification is a plus.

The Business Analyst will be involved in all aspects of the Development Lifecycle (SDLC) taking part as the consistent and knowledgeable focal point throughout projects. You will supply support for projects, enhancements and break fix efforts including keeping business units apprised of the progress of key efforts. You will work within projects teams consisting of business and IT staff, as well as consultants and offshore testing and development resources.

In support of business operations and systems, the Business Analyst will identify problems, diagnose, find root causes, and either solve issues or coordinate resolution with the IT and Operations teams. This is a hands-on position that requires subject matter expertise in the business functions supported by the application.

Responsibilities:

Develop strong working relationships with business users and external partners and become knowledgeable about how the business unit’s function, with the objective of being able to recommend and define process and systems improvements.
Gather requirements and create documentation to be reviewed and approved by IT and business unit management.
Review, analyze and evaluate business user needs and develop requirements for projects and enhancements that are consistent with overall business and IT strategies.
Evaluate project requests by working with business units to understand, articulate and communicate project scope, costs, and benefits.
Recommend and specify process and systems improvements through analysis of system incidents, bug fixes, change requests.
Conduct analyses to investigate on-going or one-time operational issues.
Create and manage project plans, monitor project progress by tracking activity, identifying, and remediating project risks, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions to keep projects on schedule and within budget.
Work alongside development teams to ensure full and accurate understanding of business requirements and specifications. Perform functional walkthroughs as needed throughout the development process.
Develop test plans and specific test cases based on project requirements and systems specifications. Ensure the traceability of discrete requirements and specifications through structured documentation and test plans/cases to ensure proper test coverage.
Coordinate testing phases of projects tracking errors and fixes and ensuring proper regression testing of any effected system elements.
Develop user acceptance test plans and partner with business units through the successful completion of user acceptance testing (UAT).
Actively take part in the implementation of process and system changes including attendance at regular change management meetings and involvement in deployments and any post-implementation check out activities.
Update and develop system and user documentation.
Participate in user training sessions as needed.

Requirements:

Proficiency with project management software packages (i.e.: MS Project, Asana, JIRA).
Expert level knowledge of MS Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Excellent analytical and documentation skills.
Detail oriented and focused on constant improvement in personal skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team framework.
Well organized with strong time-management skills.
Experience developing enterprise web applications leveraging responsive design for mobile devices is a plus.
Working knowledge of marketing automation platforms and CRMs (Salesforce) is a plus.

Education/Experience:

The ideal candidate is preferred to possess a bachelor’s degree in an appropriate field of study (including business analytics, computer systems or information technology) or 6 to 10 years of equivalent work experience.
Proven experience in all aspects of a full SDLC acting in the role of Business Analyst with QA responsibilities or Project Manager.
Must have excellent verbal communication, written communication, and social interaction skills.

Company Name: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
Job Description:
Bring your ideas. Make history.



BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.

With over 238 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.

We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Specialist, Business Technology Liaison to join our Client Onboarding team. This role is in Pittsburgh, PA - HYBRID .

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:

Works with external parties and business users to identify, define, challenge, prioritize and deliver requirements across a range of projects, both strategic and tactical.
Applies existing knowledge to global projects covering a wide range of scopes including but not limited to, regulatory, products, market, technology, strategic direction.
Prepares, reviews, and approves business requirements and functional scope documents on behalf of the group.
Develops a thorough understanding of the various processes across the group including regional specifics and up and downstream impacts, delivers projects with both a local and harmonized approach as needed.
Maintains an awareness of ongoing global projects with the potential to impact the group, engages in those with a potential to impact our role and uses that knowledge in coordinating and leading business change.
Acts as an SME on behalf of Client Activation, advising on approach and impact of proposed change.
Gathers and analyses information and develops recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span the global team.
Provides guidance in development of the technical design, delivers UAT testing, and creates process mapping, user documentation, client documentation and delivers training as needed. Leads implementation/conversion strategy planning and implementation.
Manages scope and change throughout the initiative utilizing formal change control and requirements traceability.
Communicates with key stakeholders at various levels on progress of ongoing projects.
Represents the group on various steercos, committees and forums as needed.
Is accountable for overall delivery of their assigned functional work stream across various small- and large-scale programs.
Applies experiences across various software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and identify and implement opportunities for improvement to increase quality of requirements and speed time-to-market.
Actively influences software and/or systems development process improvement initiatives.


To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Intermediate/Advanced Microsoft Excel skills needed.
Familiarity with Jira, Microsoft Visio and Power BI preferred but not essential.
3-5 years of total work experience preferred, with minimum 1-2 years specifically in Business Analysis function.
Experience in securities, financial services or client-facing or project management roles preferred.

The selected contractor must be familiar with a variety of the project management methodologies and rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. They will have proven experience in leading projects to successful implementation and building consensus. They consult with the client to define needs or problems and analyze problems to advise on or recommend solutions, utilizing knowledge of theory, principles, or technology of specific discipline or field of specialization. The Project Manager will coordinate identification of requirements, analyze available and implement agreed solutions, and oversee and track all activities from start to finish ensuring that the project is completed on schedule and that the final project meets business, technical, and established contractual requirements.

The contractor will be required to:
Manage and track the project progress against the project schedule.
Manage contract compliance during the transition period.
Monitor project milestones and take corrective action as needed to ensure the project stays on schedule.
Plan, organize, prioritize, and manage multiple work efforts across the transition teams.
Notify transition leads of project timelines, milestones, target dates, and approved transition plans and schedules via status reports.
Schedule or monitor status reviews, project management inspections, and quality assurance and process reviews with the appropriate stakeholders.
Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders and customer representatives.
Serve as a contact for project-related issues and resolution.
Coordinate all Local agency transitions with appropriate staff resources.
Give presentations as necessary.
Identify and manage project risk, develop risk mitigation strategies, and track to closure.
Coordinate the establishment of project standards and project specific procedures with team leads.
Ensure project compliance with HHSDC standards and procedures.
Develop and facilitate achievement of project service commitments.
Ensure that tasks provide value and support the strategic direction of the project.
Balance workload with project members’ capacity.
Plan, coordinate, and conduct training and orientation sessions.
Complete weekly timesheet reporting in VectorVMS by COB Friday.
Complete weekly project status updates in Daptiv
Provide weekly personal status reporting by COB Friday submitted on SharePoint.
Establish or leverage an existing project site in SharePoint; review existing documentation.
Schedule project status weekly meetings.

Skills

Experience with formal project management methodology. Required 7 Years
4 year college degree or equivalent technical study with advanced study
Project management experience in government sector
Business Analyst Experience
Project Management or work related experience in the WIC program

***WTSS CONTRACT OPPORTUNITY***


Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports reputable organizations across multiple industries?


If so, we are looking for you. At WECTEC Staffing Services, a wholly owned subsidiary of Westinghouse Electric Company LLC, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.

The Senior Staff Business Analyst’s (BA) primary role will be to work closely with Agile Product Owners, software developers, UI/UX designers, Azure architects, end users and SMEs to create functional and nonfunctional product backlog items and user stories for commercial-grade AI/ML and digital solutions in the nuclear industry.

Guides the team to ensure a solid understanding of the ceremonies, expectations, deliverables, dependencies, and their role in the Agile development methodology

Provides guidance and facilitates conversations as needed on sizing stories, choosing stories for sprints, splitting stories and determining technical story details

Provides coaching in the discipline for junior resources
Effectively communicate relevant information to key stakeholders including software developers and architects and support strategic and business planning sessions as required through the business planning cycle


What we’d like to see from you:


Education:
B.S. degree - Computer/Electrical/Mechanical/Nuclear Engineering, Computer Science preferred


Experience/Requirements:
5-7 years working on SDLC projects in one or more capacities
Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Scrum Master, Agile Team Leader, Agile Business Analyst, and/or Agile Project Manager for a software development team that diligently applied Agile principles and practices
Understanding of software development lifecycles and experience working on software development agile teams
Experience interacting with cross-functional groups to support consensus outcome/decision
Proven ability to play a key role in delivering iterative solutions that drive from ideation to full scale customer deployments
Experience moderating team dynamics and leading through influence
Certification of an agile framework or method (i.e. SAFE, DAD, Kanban) and Agile tools, including reporting
Demonstrated experience facilitating meetings at multiple levels of an organization and an understanding of facilitation techniques
Experience in how to apply different techniques to optimize the team's effectiveness when developing in an agile framework (for example: various Burndown technologies, differing retrospective, sprint planning handling bugs, etc.)
Experience with removing blockers for teams and acting as a champion for a cross-functional team or department


Our Safety Pledge to You:


If you are as committed to your success as we are committed to your safety, then this is the position for you! For us, our guiding principle has always been and will continue to be the safety of our people. It’s that simple!
Why WECTEC Staffing Services?

Our dedicated employees range in expertise from highly specialized technical niche positions to corporate function positions and we want YOU to be a part of our impressive talent network!

Veolia Water Technologies & Solutions (WTS) is a worldwide leader in water recovery, treatment and reuse. We design and supply a range of water systems, from food and beverage applications, to municipal water, to microelectronics ultrapure water and heavy industrial wastewater treatment.

At WTS, we realize diverse teams make smarter decisions, deliver better results, and build stronger communities. We’re an organization that champions diversity and inclusion at every rung of the ladder and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We offer challenging and meaningful careers, with competitive benefits and flexible work arrangements.




The Data Governance IT Business/Systems Analyst is a core role that will mature the Veolia Water Technologies and Solutions business up the data maturity curve. By partnering with the Enterprise Data Architect and the IT Business Intelligence Leader, you will be at the forefront of accelerating our time to data insights and guiding business teams to begin making data-driven decisions. This will be achieved through execution of Data Projects, democratization of Data Knowledge and facilitating/educating Data personnel on the Data technologies available to them.




Key Characteristics

Advanced communication skills, with a keen ability to simplify complex technical concepts for non-technical audiences
Facilitation skills, ability to negotiate with parties with initially-divergent perspectives to a point of consensus
Operational mindset, able to understand more than just the technology, but how people will use it to optimize its value



Duties & Responsibilities

Be the technology and operational owner for the company’s Data Catalog (Alation), ensuring it remains up, running and performant for all Data Personnel
While the business is in the beginning phases of its Data Maturity journey, you will at times be a Data Project Manager:
Own, lead and run data projects across the business, demonstrating the process and skillset required for all future data PM's to be successful
Assess business' current data maturity to right-size data projects and set proper expectations of success
Define and implement metrics and systems to track post project-delivery performance. Clearly communicate performance and use data to evaluate and prioritize future projects and roadmap
Take learnings from these projects and develop revised processes that refine our Data Catalog to maximize self-sufficiency and value of the Data Catalog to all Data Personnel
Making our Data Catalog the center of knowledge for all data personnel
Building partnerships between Data Analysts/Scientists & Data Architects to continually increase the utility of our Data Warehouse
Be the glue that brings and holds together the enterprise’s data personnel: Process Owners, Stewards, Architects, Engineers, Analysts/Scientists and Visualization Designers (BI)
Facilitate Data Governance Communications, assisting communications between Data SME’s and Data Analysts/Scientists of changes to data structures that may impact existing analyses. (Precursor to Data Governance Council Meetings)
Propose process-modification projects that improve a business operation’s data validity, velocity and/or volume, leading to more valuable Data Intelligence



Hard Skills

Business Intelligence Report/Dashboard development (Tableau/Power BI/etc.)
Intermediate SQL development skills
Exposure to data warehouse/data modeling principles



Soft Skills

Achievement: Ability to come up with new ideas based on experience and competencies to

develop or implement new procedures or systems to improve the business and the client experience.

Inclusive: Passioned for working in different cultures and environments, in a matrixed organization with a more universal and a diversity team.
Team Player: Ability to work with others toward a shared goal, participating actively, accountable and committed to the entire team respecting peers, leadership, stakeholders, and clients.
Innovate: Challenge the status quo and contribute to the IT environment and leverage technologies to bring new ideas and connect them to provide the best practices and tools to our stakeholders and clients.
Inspirational: Excellent oral and written communication skills: Communicate clearly and professionally with IT and non-IT professionals within the organization being able to inspire others.



Education & Experience

Required:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Information Technology required.
8+ years in Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence and/or Data Governance functions
3 years experience in leading cross-functional project teams



Preferred:

You can partner with peer-leaders in other IT functions to deliver on program goals and objectives
You have strong communication skills; experience speaking at industry or academic level a plus
Ability to lead cross-functional product, design and technology teams and can vigilantly prioritize in a rapidly-changing environment
Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts and manage tradeoffs
Ability to drive user research to build requirements and weigh tradeoffs in design decisions
Experience defining projects, driving requirements, writing detailed techno-functional specifications, and coordinating feature team efforts
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to break down a technical problem into clear and direct communication

Job Title: Operating Room Business/Data Analyst - Remote Opportunity for Local Candidates
Job Description:
St. Luke's is proud of the skills, experience and compassion of its employees. The employees of St. Luke's are our most valuable asset! Individually and together, our employees are dedicated to satisfying the mission of our organization which is an unwavering commitment to excellence as we care for the sick and injured; educate physicians, nurses and other health care providers; and improve access to care in the communities we serve, regardless of a patient's ability to pay for health care.
Researches, analyzes, evaluates, and assists with ongoing data analysis and data needs within the Surgical Services Service Line. Gathers and interprets data from a variety of databases to help the network make operational business decisions that will result in positive financial and clinical outcomes.
JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyzes large complex files for transformation and customization of raw data into useful finished products
Researches, validates, analyzes, and produces actionable data that is accurate and easily understood by the requestor
Works with Surgical Services leadership and administrative leaders in professional and business departments to compile, organize, display, and provide useful operational and financial data in support of operational needs
Works closely with Financial Management, Cost Accounting, Medical Records, Revenue Management, Pharmacy, Business Offices, and Service Line Administrators to find opportunities that will result in surgical cost reduction and/or increased insurance reimbursements while maintaining high quality patient care
Provides input to Materials Management that identifies pricing opportunities and cost savings relative to specific surgical procedures and surgeons
Provides requesters with an accurate understanding of financial, clinical, and operational data relative to Surgical Services, identifying appropriate sources for strategic planning, business development, and physician activity
Understands all available reports and analytical tools to provide financial analysis, reviews, and presentations to other business partners and senior leadership
Has a working knowledge of medical coding, health insurance requirements and reimbursement, and materials management practices
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:
Four years of job-related experience in the healthcare industry required. Familiarity with the day to day functions and processes in the operating rooms, as well as a robust understanding of how ongoing operational decisions affect finances in a healthcare environment preferred. Must be skilled in TEAMS, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat. Must have high level Excel skills.
Must be proficient in using and running reports in the following databases: EPIC, the STRATAJAZZ financial database, ALLSCRIPTS Supply Chain Management, Tableau, and Medapproved.
Additional web based databases used are: Codecorrect, Epic User Web, and Premier Supply Chain.
Must be able to anticipate the needs of the stakeholder with limited guidance. Must have strong written and oral communication skills required for frequent interaction with physicians, administration, and teammates.
Please complete your application using your full legal name and current home address. Be sure to include employment history for the past seven (7) years, including your present employer. Additionally, you are encouraged to upload a current resume, including all work history, education, and/or certifications and licenses, if applicable. It is highly recommended that you create a profile at the conclusion of submitting your first application. Thank you for your interest in St. Luke's!!
St. Luke's University Health Network is an
Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Associate Director, Business Intelligence - Media Analytics
Job Description:
Company Description


PHM is the leading health media agency in the US. We are designed for—and dedicated to—delivering solutions that connect people with meaningful health and wellness solutions every day. Guided by our genuine passion for health and wellness, our work across the entire media ecosystem helps patients navigate the most important moments of their healthcare journeys.

While we have grown to be the No. 1 agency in our industry, at heart we’re still a startup. It’s that energy and spirit of innovation that allows us to create bold and meaningful “health media firsts” for our clients, and to do it all with #phmlove.



Job Description


The Associate Director of Business Intelligence will apply their years of experience in data analysis and strategic consulting as the BI lead on any of our myriad of enterprise clients within the health and wellness industry. Important to this success will be the ability to source and use the many data sources at the disposal of the BI team to not only represent the business impact that our media/marketing campaigns have in the marketplace but also the ability to translate these insights into relevant recommendations to optimize media investment for our clients. You will report to the Director of Business Intelligence.


Responsibilities

While every engagement is unique, typical Associate Director engagement expectations require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:

Create and maintain professional relationships with the many members of your internal and client team(s) while being solely responsible for the level of quality in communications and deliverables for the entire team that serves on the client’s behalf.
Work throughout the year with internal and external (client team, partner agencies/consulting groups) partners to create measurement plans/proposals that satisfy all client goals and address challenges/opportunities with clearly defined goals and definitions of program success.
Oversee the creation of the business rules and parameters of the engagement and participate together with internal Finance and Operations teams in the scoping process and any necessary requests for proposal from outside vendors/data companies.
Manage the many internal data sources and (where applicable) third-party vendors/data streams that comprise our custom measurement platform while keeping process on task within the established timelines and delivery dates.
Synthesize the data available into insights about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (healthcare professionals, patients/prospects or a combination of the two) while identifying opportunities for program optimization and enhancement.
Be a strategic consultant using the aforementioned insights as the foundation for presentations, reports, assorted client deliverables in either a face-to-face or virtual setting.
Identify areas of opportunity to expand our presence through consultative selling at current clients while periodically participating in the any new business development opportunities as they arise.
Understand client needs and internal operations to achieve success for the client and team.
Provide strategic review of your team’s work to ensure deliverables are on time, data cleanliness & clean presentation of story is presented, and overall, of high quality.
Collaborate with people across the organization, affect positive change, understand competitive offerings, identify needs to get projects moving and keep them moving forward with our teams.
Independently provide POV for clients or our teams, while sourcing or researching any needed information to inform decision-making in consideration of business rules.
Manage a team, teaching process and providing a growth path for direct reports while managing their workload for success.
Remain objective making fact-based recommendations and decisions.
Understanding of agency operations and display ability to support Senior leadership & developing trust within all partners.


Qualifications

Depth of understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customers
Skills with the following primary competencies:
Project Management
Problem Solving Abilities & Strategic Consultation
Quantitative Skills
Communication Abilities
Management
Help recruit new additions to the BI Team and management of both the career development and daily workflow of junior team members/resources
Power-user of business IT software: MS excel (can perform complex functions)
Literacy of business intelligence software such as Datorama, Tableau, Power BI, Adobe, Google, etc.
While all engagements are unique, travel is normally required 10 to 15% of the time.


Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required.
5 to 7 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience preferred)

#LI-Hybrid


Additional Information


Our Publicis Groupe motto “Viva La Différence” means we’re better together, and we believe that our differences make us stronger. It means we honor and celebrate all identities, across all facets of intersectionality, and it underpins all that we do as an organization. We are focused on fostering belonging and creating equitable & inclusive experiences for all talent.

Publicis Groupe provides robust and inclusive benefit programs and policies to support the evolving and diverse needs of our talent and enable every person to grow and thrive. Our benefits package includes medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401K, as well as parental and family care leave, family forming assistance, tuition reimbursement, and flexible time off.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The Credit Bureau Operations Furnishing Lead supports the credit reporting/monitoring of auto loan information to the nationwide consumer reporting agencies (CRA). This role will support Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and Unfair, Deceptive or Abusive Acts or Practices (UDAAP) compliance, and is also responsible for issue tracking, managing issue resolution and ensuring proper closure of issues. The position includes project management of updates impacting credit reporting. Extensive interaction with Legal, Compliance and Operations is required.

This is a hybrid position located in Chadds Ford, PA / Coppell, TX / or Tempe, AZ
What is a day in the life at Flagship as a Credit Bureau Furnishing Lead?

Provides direct oversight and establishes controls related to furnishing of account information to credit bureaus to ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness in accordance with company, regulatory and industry requirements.
Monitoring Metro2 data furnishing format from Flagship's servicing system.
Testing of file layout to ensure the desired reporting.
Responsible for data clean up as required compiling data into Metro2.
Monitoring, testing, and executing monthly quality reviews.
Identifying areas for improvement with leadership and consultation with 3rd party provider
Building and maintaining good relationships with multiple operating groups, including Collections, Credit, Fraud, Customer Delivery, Technology, Customer Experience, Legal, Compliance, etc. as well as service providers who support credit reporting processes
Understanding processes of the multiple operating groups and how those processes will impact reporting.
Reviewing processes and output that drive reporting, recognizing the drivers, testing their effectiveness, and recommending change when they are not effective.
About you:

Preferred: Working knowledge of the auto finance industry, Metro2 Reporting and Consumer Data Industry Association (CDIA) regulations and industry compliance.
Preferred: 3+ years of experience performing business analysis and/or process design and analysis.
Required: 2-5+ years of credit bureau reporting experience in a bank or financial institution, direct experience interfacing with credit reporting agencies.
Preferred: Familiarity or experience with SAS/SQL.
Required: Fluent with Microsoft Office suite.
Working understanding of the FCRA, Regulation V, UDAAP and applicable consumer finance laws.
Knowledge and understanding of e-Oscar dispute processing.
Preferred: MS Power BI, Tableau, Oracle BI, Google Analytics.
Preferred: MS SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle PL/SQL, MariaDB, DBeaver, SAP, Hyperion Financial Management, Essbase, financial reporting, and statement analysis.
Preferred: Windows, iOS, Linux, Chrome OS.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multi-task, maintain accuracy, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to effectively interact with all levels within the organization and the ability to create and summarize detailed written reports.
Strong interpersonal, listening, and interviewing skills with the ability to confront and address sensitive topics while maintaining a high degree of professionalism, confidentiality, diplomacy, and tact.
Strong analytical, decision making and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter possessing the ability to work independently while supporting a team environment while still being able to collaborate with others to achieve company objectives.
Demonstrate sound business judgment in applying proper policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Strong attention to detail and high concern for data accuracy with the ability to objectively identify, assess, resolve, and mitigate risk.
Education requirements:

Required: High School Diploma or Equivalent.
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting or Business Administration or equivalent work-related experience.
Preferred: FCRA Certified.

Program Effectiveness Analyst
Job Summary
The Program Effectiveness Analyst will play a critical role in optimizing our pharmacy programs and help to drive efficiency, insights and impact of RedSail’s program offerings. The RedSail Technologies Network Services Business Unit has the primary mission to create incremental value streams for RedSail and RedSail’s pharmacy network through the development and activation of Clinical, Financial, & Operational Programs that leverage our uniquely integrated technology platforms as well as our associated reach within the targeted market segments. This role will report into our Director, Program Effectiveness and reside within the Network Services Commercial Operations Organization.
Key Duties
General analysis and reporting to leadership on overall RedSail performance associated with key metrics of locations, patients, claims, program metrics analyzed for growth and market share.
Gather, analyze, and interpret data related to pharmacy program performance, including program costs, pharmacy success and utilization metrics.
Build, maintain and enhance comprehensive dashboards for multiple stakeholders (internal and external facing) and reports to monitor program effectiveness.
Conduct regular assessments on program metrics and identify areas where modifications or enhancements are needed.
Identify trends and patterns in program data and make data-driven recommendations for improvement.
Collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement action plans based on data-driven insights.
Assist in the planning and execution of program launches.
Conduct program effectiveness report outs for internal and external stakeholders
Collaboration & partnership with other functions such as finance, legal, operations and marketing as well as other business units for program execution.
P&L data input and reporting support for all active “Programs” and associated vendor contracts, including achievement tracking to defined annual goals.
Assist in identifying annual penetration goals and associated program ROI metrics.
Metrics, dashboards, and reporting for various update forums.
Other duties as assigned.
Customer facing role
Education/Training
Bachelor’s degree required (Business, Data Analytics, Business Analytics or related)
Work Experience/Skills
3+ years data analytics, business analysis, operational data experience
Prior experience with Healthcare/Pharmacy related company a plus
Prior experience working in revenue operations or sales operations a plus
Prior experience with CRM tools such as Salesforce.Com or Monday.Com
Proficiency in data analysis tools/software (Microsoft, Power BI, SQL)
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy, quality, completeness
Strong analytical skills and ability to articulate key insights to decision makers
